ownerResponse/text:
Hi many thanks for taking the time to review us, we would never say we are on the beach we clearly state we are on the lagoon our Tripadvisor page profile photo even shows this I think that is your mistake when booking our hotel.
We are also sorry you did not like our rooms but guess everyone has different tastes, you were really lucky we could accommodate you at all as you booked for 2 double rooms (2 double beds) and turned up with 7 persons which gave us a small problem, so we had to shuffle our rooms that we had all ready allocated to other guest.
you mention you had to pay for food at the hotel your breakfast was not included in the room rate with the online agent  you booked with and I gave that complimentary, all guest have to pay for lunch and dinner, we are not an all inclusive result.
we are glad you liked the restaurant and staff. I would suggest you really look where you are booking and look at the location and bring the correct number of people you book for to save you and the hotel any problems in the future.
We hope you enjoyed sri lanka, and had a safe journey back to India regards Asian Jewel Team
placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed there with family... there were two issues with the hotel:

1) The interiors are extremely old with the room decor very tacky.
2) This is far from the beach... why would one go to a beach area and not stay near a beach specially when there are quite a few hotels near the beach.

I don't understand how this is rated so high in trip advisor (I chose this because of trip advisor ratings which i believe in).  Maybe I completely missed something.

The other hotels in Sri Lanka were top notch interiors and great locations at similar USD 100+ price points.  For the price it is an extremely poor deal specially when you are on a vacation and expect to stay in a better place than your apartment :-)

That said- the staff is very friendly and helpful... the small restaurant is great (but you pay for it separately). This place has about 4-5 rooms in all.
title: ok place with two limitations

placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
First the good points. Both of the owners are nice people, chatty and kind. Similarly the staff are also nice and well meaning and the restaurant makes a good curry but this hotel was not for us.

We stayed in Jasmine which was meant to be a luxury suite. The main feature is a big bathtub which overlooks the river. However the bath was very stained ( looked like muddy paw prints all over) and wasn't inviting so we didn't use it. On our second night we returned and found droppings in the bathroom - I assume it was gecko droppings but still not pleasant, however unsurprising considering the bathroom windows had an open gap between them.

Speaking of gaps, our bedroom door did not close properly. Yes we could lock it but there was a gap between the wood door and doorframe - if you walked past you could peep in, I didn't like that and noticed it with other rooms also.

Design and furniture is old and heavy wood which I wouldn't mind if the room was in good condition. I didn't like to see a stained wall from brown water marks or damp or whatever it was. Also our mosquito net had holes and stains on it.

Lastly the location, nowhere near anything by foot and not possible to go for a stroll either; rubble roads and litter around the perimeters.

Upon booking this hotel we relied heavily onTripadvisor and felt let down.
title: Not for us...

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to review Asian Jewel. It`s our first totally negative review in 5 years, so we must take the negatives and turn them into positives, i can only answer the points you have raised. I have also spoken to the room boy and housekeeping, I think this must have been an Isolated  incident, as we have had another review which is very  positive and they stayed after you in the same room, and stayed longer than the 1 day in which you had booked.
Baddegama Road is indeed very dusty, and undergoing major road works linking it with the Highway, as for the noise we are on Field View, Lane 3 which is a fair distance from Baddegama Road and there is minimal traffic noise. it over looks the lake and is on a dead end.
There are an estimated 2 million stray dogs in Sri Lanka and unfortunately we can not help this as a hotel, its more a Government issue. We do have a dog on site, you will see her mentioned in many reviews, she was also a stray that we rescued from 2 weeks old  and as you said she is very fat, but not pregnant as she is now 11, and very friendly. We also have a hotel cat which is also a rescue cat and we are sorry this caused  you concern.
The Bath is slightly stained from a guest using cinnamon oil and we are waiting for a specialist to recoat it, and I am having to source the spray from the UK as its not available in Sri Lanka but it is still clean, again we apologise for this.
You mentioned rodent droppings , when i showed you the room and checked before you arrived  the room was spotless, what you saw were gecko droppings and no matter how much anybody who lives in Asia will know, you can never keep a room or any place completely gecko free, again I apologise for this but its very difficult.
You mentioned the towels are a little tired, we are not sure why as we just replaced all the towels in January including pool and room towels,

we will take everything you said on board and  we are sorry our hotel did not meet your  standards, 

best regards Dale
placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed here in Feb 2014.  Unfortunately disappointed.  The road from Hikkaduwa to the hotel is dusty and noisy and there are road-works being carried out (although not the fault of the hotel).  There are lots of stray dogs outside and there appeared to be a fat or pregnant one in the eating area.  The bathroom was not clean; the bathtub had what looked like varnish stains on it (did not feel like using it), and found what looked like rodent droppings on the bathroom window.  Towels looked tired.  There was no telephone in the room and did not use the pool (a stray cat was seen drinking from it).  However, wifi was excellent and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and are the best feature of this hotel.  Tanya and Dale were pleasant and helpful.  The food was okay, and breakfast was good. The views over the lake are great but when you go to the lake edge it is quite littered. The impression created by the previous reviews (based on which the booking was made) did not match the experience or expectation of a 'boutique' hotel.
title: Lovely staff, but did not meet expectations

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Redeyeah, 

Ayubowan from Amaya Resorts 

Thank you very much for posting a review. Guest experience are always welcomed by us as it is a way for us to make improvements and correct our standards and services. I am happy to note that you have enjoyed the cleanliness of the hotel and hope, you have had a relaxing stay.  

We have made a note of your concerns regarding bath room lighting and apologize that you had an unpleasant experience . We will investigate this matter further to prevent the re-occurrence of this scenario.

Concerning the majority of reviews we get,  The Oliphant bungalow is a place which gets nothing but compliments from our guests and its truly  disappointing  that the stay fell below your expectations. We do hope that  you will be back for an enhanced experience. 

Warmest Regards

Deepika Dissanayake

text: The hotel is clean but the location is far from every thing no super market no restaurant also the hotel manager is rude this is the first  time and will be the last time also the bath room the light bulbs  from 3 just one is work so you feel the room is dark
title: Kuwait

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
There are several serious inaccuracies and omissions in the hotel’s response that need to be addressed.
	1.	We did not “change our minds.” We raised concerns before arrival.
We contacted Booking.com before arriving to request a cancellation waiver due to concerning recent reviews on Google. These were not isolated incidents, and many described exactly what we later saw ourselves: a worn-down, poorly maintained hotel far from what the photos suggest. Several of those reviews have since been reported and removed, just like the hotel tried to do with ours. This pattern of review suppression speaks volumes.
	2.	We were asked to lie in writing.
After we arrived, saw the condition of the hotel, and decided to leave, we were asked by hotel management to submit a written statement claiming we had changed our travel plans in order to be considered for a refund. That was completely untrue. We did not change our plans — we stayed in Trincomalee as planned and booked a new hotel 10 minutes before checking in, as shown clearly in our Booking.com account history. We have a recorded phone call in which this demand is made, and we have submitted this recording, along with all written correspondence, to the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority.
	3.	The core issue is value and misrepresentation.
This property is priced like a luxury resort but does not meet that standard! The photos online are outdated and misleading. In reality, the hotel is old, visibly run-down, and poorly maintained. After traveling across Sri Lanka and staying in several more affordable places, it was shocking to find this was the most expensive and least impressive of all.
	4.	We have documented everything.
Every part of our experience — the false refund condition, the misleading photos, and the lack of cooperation — is backed by evidence: recordings, whatsapp communication, booking timestamps, and photographs. We have formally reported the hotel and submitted all materials to Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority. Let this also be a warning to not book with Booking.com (check their google rating reviews) since Booking.com has said they cannot assist! 

We stand fully by our review. It reflects a documented experience — not opinion, and certainly not defamation.

— M Wagner & P Roberts
title: Setting the Record Straight: Misleading Response from Hotel Management on M Wagner and P Roberts reviews

ownerResponse/text:
We truly regret to hear that you felt disappointed with the billing experience during your visit. However, we would like to respectfully clarify a few important details to avoid any misunderstandings.
As per standard practice in all registered hotels across Sri Lanka, the rates listed on our menu are exclusive of government taxes (currently 18%) and a 10% service charge. This policy is not unique to our property and is a legal requirement for all licensed establishments. To ensure complete transparency, we have clearly mentioned on every page of the menu that the prices are exclusive of taxes and service charges, along with a reminder to inform our team of any allergies or dietary needs.
We understand that taxes can sometimes add up, but there is absolutely no intention to mislead. Additionally, in good faith and hospitality, we extended a 20% discount on your total bill as part of our ongoing promotional offer.
We sincerely hope that on your future visits—whether with us or at any standard hotel—you’ll be able to review the menu details before placing your order to ensure clarity and avoid any similar concerns. We remain committed to providing a transparent and honest experience for every guest.
With genuine respect and appreciation, Amaranthé Bay.
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
ATTENTION
Les prix affichés sur la carte sont hors taxes. Exemple pour 2 cocktails le total au vu des prix sur la carte etait de 4000rp et en fait nous avons dû régler 400rp + 40rp+110rp+ 819rp de taxes soit un montant total de 5369rp
C’est une honte de prendre les clients en otages !!!!
title: Arnaque

ownerResponse/text:
At Amaranthé Bay, we take pride in offering warm hospitality, honest communication, and consistent service. While we welcome constructive feedback, it’s important to clarify when reviews contain misleading information.

The guests booked via Booking.com under a strictly non-refundable policy, clearly outlined at booking and in the confirmation email. On the day of arrival, they cancelled last-minute, and as per the policy, full payment was processed.

However, just two hours later, the guests arrived at the hotel and requested a full refund, stating they had changed their minds and chosen another hotel. Despite the non-refundable terms, we offered a goodwill refund for unused nights—only charging the first night—on the condition that they update the cancellation reason for proper documentation.

The guests refused and instead posted a review containing false claims. We submitted all relevant communication to Booking.com to ensure transparency and fairness.

We remain committed to resolving concerns respectfully and truthfully, but cannot accept reviews that distort facts to damage our reputation. We thank all our guests who value fairness, honesty, and context.
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid this hotel, there are much better ones around Niaveli Beach
text:
Booked this hotel for a much-anticipated, high-end finish to our Sri Lanka trip. What we got was anything but. The property is dated, badly maintained, and extremely overpriced. After staying at several budget-friendly places around the country, we were shocked to find those were in better condition than this supposed five-star resort.

Upon arrival, we attempted to cancel and request a refund after seeing the state of the property — a request the hotel flatly rejected. Instead, we were met with condescending and unhelpful responses. One manager even insinuated a refund would be possible if we submitted a written statement claiming a change of travel plans, which was absolutely not the case. This felt like an attempt to rewrite the facts to suit their policies.

We have only left one public review (on Google) to date, yet the hotel accused us of damaging their reputation and suggested we remove it — making this entire ordeal feel more like a PR battle than any genuine customer service.

For those considering this hotel based on star rating or images — please read recent reviews and look closely at the photos. We do not recommend this property and are still in the process of resolving this through Booking.com’s head office.
title: Luxury in Name Only — Misleading and Mismanaged

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked this hotel expecting a luxury experience to end our Sri Lanka trip. What we found on arrival was shocking: a severely outdated, run-down property that bore no resemblance to the photos or description. It was a massive letdown — especially given the price. Hostels and backpacker lodges in the area were in better shape and cost a fraction of the rate.

Before arrival, we became concerned after locals and recent online reviews raised red flags. On arrival, our concerns were confirmed — and we immediately expressed that we weren’t comfortable staying. Management’s response was dismissive, at times aggressive, and entirely unprofessional. Instead of addressing the issues, they insisted on keeping the full payment under the pretense of a “non-refundable” policy — regardless of the false advertising.

Worse still, we were asked to submit a written statement falsely claiming we changed our travel plans — something we refused to do out of principle. This was apparently required to “consider” a refund. We chose not to play along with that narrative and escalated the case to Booking.com.

We travel extensively and are always willing to pay for quality. This was not quality. This was a bait-and-switch disguised as a luxury resort. Avoid at all costs.
title: ⭐ 0-Star: Severely Misrepresented and Managed with Arrogance

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
 
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We deeply regret that your stay did not meet your expectations. Please allow us to address the points you raised -
 
Positives:
We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the outdoor space, the restaurant, and the pool staff. Our chef and team work hard to provide excellent service, and it’s encouraging to know that their efforts were appreciated.
We are glad that you found the breakfast spread to your satisfaction and the suite room spacious.
 
Negatives:
We sincerely apologize for the unfortunate incident involving a bat in your room. This is certainly not the standard of experience we aim to provide. We have taken immediate steps to inspect and rectify any potential entry points for wildlife. However, we must clarify the situation as follows, the bat was reported on the night before your departure after you had stayed for three days without any issues. Our team responded immediately, inspected the room, and found no evidence of a bat or any entry points in the ceiling. Additionally, our engineering team confirmed there were no holes in the roof. As a tropical country, Sri Lanka is home to various wildlife, including fruit bats. We provided information to guests, advising them to keep balcony doors closed, especially at night. We offered you an immediate room change, which you accepted.
 
We understand your frustration regarding the handling of this incident. It is never our intention to make our guests feel unheard or disrespected. We are reviewing this situation with our management team to ensure such instances are managed more appropriately in the future.
 
Regarding the refund, we apologize for the inconvenience and dissatisfaction caused. We will revisit our policies to ensure they better align with guest expectations and comfort in exceptional circumstances. We understand the unique expectations of our guests and strive to provide the highest level of hospitality. It’s unfortunate that you did not experience this during your stay. However, it’s important to note that your experience appears to be an isolated incident. In our ten-year history, we have not had any similar reports.
 
We acknowledge your concerns about the value and quality of our Hotel. Your feedback is valuable as we continuously strive to improve the decor and overall guest experience.
 
We genuinely regret that your stay did not reflect the high standards we set for ourselves. We hope you might reconsider and give us another opportunity to provide you with the luxurious and hospitable experience that we aim to deliver, that we are known for.
 
Thank you once again for your feedback.
 
Warm regards
Amaranthe Bay Hotel
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
TLDR: The worst hotel we stayed in in Sri Lanka. Very over-priced for what it is, terrible management & not good for young children! 

To start with the positives: in general, the outdoor space is nice, and the restaurant and pool staff are really lovely. The chef is also super nice. The breakfast spread is decent. The suite room was large.

The negatives: The fact that there was a bat in our room, and that the manager accused us of making it up / that we let them in by leaving the door open. There was an obvious hole in the roof. Refused to give refund for the night we had to vacate our bat-room at nearly midnight with a 4 month old baby. Offered an insulting 40 USD discount on room extras that we declined. 

A very overpriced stay (370 a night) and the hotel decor and finishings feel cheap & tacky with no hospitality from management. Not worth it at all, and not a luxurious hotel at all.
title: worst hotel we stayed in in Sri Lanka. Over-priced, bad management & not good for young children

ownerResponse/text:
Firstly, I would like to extend my heartfelt gratitude to you and your family for your continued support and for choosing our hotel for your stay once again Palavathani Palachandran. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we appreciate your loyalty.
 
I want to sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you faced upon your recent visit. I understand how important it is to ensure that all guests have a comfortable and pleasant stay, including their drivers. However, I would like to clarify that there is no specific law mandated by the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) that enforces accommodation for drivers accompanying guests. It is a practice that may vary from one hotel to another, depending on their policies and availability.
 
That being said, we are pleased that our manager was able to step in and assist in finding alternative accommodations for your drivers. We always strive to go above and beyond to make our guests' experiences as enjoyable as possible. Nevertheless, we must express our deep disappointment at the reported incidents of rudeness and abusive language directed towards our staff and manager by the driver, Asanka Jayasekara. Such behavior is entirely unacceptable, and it is our priority to maintain a respectful and welcoming environment for all our guests and not only for the driver and for our team members as well.
 
It's truly regrettable to hear about the issues with the pool, including the broken tiles and the high chlorine levels. Please accept our deepest apologies for any injuries and discomfort this may have caused to your nephew and the other guests. We take such matters seriously, and we are actively addressing them to ensure that similar incidents do not occur in the future.
Your feedback regarding the condition of our facilities, including the wear and tear in the pool area and the rooms, is duly noted. We are committed to enhancing our property and appreciate your input, which will aid us in our ongoing efforts to improve our guest experience.
 
It is important to note that your group had a total of seven bookings made through various platforms, each with distinct criteria and check-out dates. We understand that this may have caused some confusion, especially as some of these bookings shared similar guest names. While we always strive to ensure our guests have a smooth and pleasant stay, we acknowledge that there were instances of room allocation issues that occurred. Additionally, we were unaware that Mr. Stephen, Mrs. Suzanne, and Ms. Talia were part of the same group until they arrive to the hotel.
 
In reference to our WhatsApp communication, we maintain a standard procedure of reaching out to arriving guests one day prior to their check-in. This practice enables us to verify their expected arrival time, gather information about meal preferences, arrange suitable bed accommodations, and cater to any specific requirements they may have. We undertake these measures with the aim of ensuring a comfortable and relaxing stay for our valued guests.
The invoice sent to you pertains to an on-call doctor's visit during your stay. Unfortunately, this invoice remained unpaid, and we understand there was some confusion surrounding it. When Mrs. Devi fell in ill during your stay, our immediate response was to engage the services of on-call doctor, who recommended hospitalization for your mother. We deeply care for the well-being of our guests and acted promptly to ensure Mrs. Devi received the necessary medical attention.
 
We acknowledge that there was some delay in issuing the invoice due to the doctor's schedule and Mrs. Devi's condition. We had assumed that payment would be made during your stay. However, we understand that there was a misunderstanding, and you intended to settle the invoice once you returned home due to limited Wi-Fi connectivity during your travels.
We also recognize that there were a few reminders sent for payment while you were in Sri Lanka, which you found to be excessive. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. Additionally, we understand your concern about the international transfer charge, and we regret any confusion regarding this matter.
 
The lagoon view is indeed one of our most cherished features, and we're delighted that you found it lovely and peaceful. It's a true gem of tranquility that allows our guests to unwind and connect with nature.
We couldn't agree more about our hotel's prime location, and we're pleased that you were able to explore Trinco easily and enjoy the local restaurants. Our team takes great pride in recommending the best spots to our guests, ensuring that you have a truly immersive experience.
 
Your kind words about our restaurant warms our hearts. We're thrilled to hear that you found the food to be of high quality, and that the service was excellent. Our culinary team works tirelessly to create delicious and memorable dishes, and the restaurant staff takes great pride in providing top-notch service. We will be sure to pass along your compliments to them.
 
Please know that we take your feedback seriously, and we will use it as an opportunity to enhance our services and address any issues that may arise in the future. We genuinely hope that this isolated incident will not deter you from considering a return visit, and we would be honored to have the chance to regain your trust and provide you with the exceptional experience you deserve.
 
Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention, and we look forward to the possibility of serving you and your family in the future.
 
With sincere thanks and gratitude from Amaranthé Bay team
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
My family and I first stayed in this hotel in 2017 and loved it so much we promised to return next time (I wrote a 5 star review for this experience at the time). Unfortunately it is sad to say our experience this time was not the same. 

The first issue we had is that we had 4 vans travelling from Jaffna to Trinco, and the first party arrived to be told that there was not enough rooms for our drivers to stay at the hotel (even though by law the hotels in Sri Lanka must provide accommodation for drivers accompanying their guests). The first driver got upset/by all account was rude to staff - this is unacceptable, however he was reacting to be told he and the 3 other drivers had no place to stay after a long drive - and being told that the hotel would not help rectify this situation. Finally when my sister arrived she managed to have a helpful conversation with the manager who agreed to find and pay for alternative accommodation for all the drivers. 

The next day my family and I spent the whole day in the pool - unfortunately this is where we had our next issue. My nephew and I both cut ourselves on broken tiles in the pool - there is quite wear and tear visible now compared to our trip in 2017. The worst part is that the chlorine levels in the pool were too high so all the children and quite a few of the adults had chemical burns - at first when the children were crying and complaining of rashes we reported this to staff and they were dismissive saying it due to the heat - we had been in Sri Lanka for a week prior to this and the children were fine! We had also been in the pool at the The Thinnai in Jaffna and again had no problems like this! Staff then eventually tested the water, and added a tube into the pool to restore the balance - however the kids did not wish to go back into the pool for the remainder of our time here sadly. 

The hotel definitely needs some renovations as the wear and tear is apparent throughout (including the rooms). 

The last issue I would like to mention is the unnecessary communication via Whatsapp - prior to our stay each of our party had been messaged to confirm our bookings - all fine. When I responded to say that's perfect and to just double check I had a twin room as booked I received a call from the hotel - it was clear that they were getting confused with the bookings as we have similar names but again this was fine - I clarified this but then when we arrived on the day to check in it was clear there was confusion with rooms again and rooms were not allocated properly in advance. Then during our stay unfortunately my Mum needed the attention of the doctor which the hotel was swift in organising - again all fine but after we checked out a few days later I received an invoice via WhatsApp for this doctor's visit. I responded to say I was travelling at the time and not on proper Wi-Fi but would pay this when I got back to the UK. I received a response to say "Well noted. You can do once you reach there." Then a couple of days later I received another 3 text messages relating to this payment - again I responded to say I will pay it this week (as I had just arrived back in the UK) - again the person text to say "sure well noted." Then the next day I got another text asking for the same thing to which I had to respond saying please stop texting me now as I have said I will pay this week! I felt pestered over WhatsApp. I made the payment and was charged £10 extra for this international payment (there was no mention of this payment upon checking out) then when I sent them the screenshot of the payment confirmed I received a long text message ending with "Kindly let us know when it would convenient for you to address the outstanding bill." Whoever is responsible for this communication via WhatsApp on behalf of the hotel just says 'well noted" but nothing is actually noted!  

The positives for this hotel are the view of the lagoon is very lovely and peaceful. It's a good location to explore Trinco near lots of nice local and restaurants. The restaurant at the hotel serves lovely, quality food and the service is excellent! Staff in the restaurant are very attentive.
title: Not what it used to be sadly :(

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you, Mandy, for taking the time to provide us with your valuable feedback regarding your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely apologize for the disappointing experience you had during your time with us. Our aim is to consistently deliver a high standard of service and it is clear that we fell short of your expectations on this occasion.
 
We deeply regret that the pool did not meet your expectations. We understand that its condition was not up to par and did not reflect the images you saw prior to your arrival. Please rest assured that we have addressed this issue with our maintenance team to ensure that such incidents are not repeated in the future.
 
Moreover, we are truly sorry for the state of the bathroom in your standard room. It is disheartening to learn about the various issues you encountered, including the brown and black kit edges, rusty grout pits, loose faucet, crooked mirror, and a dirty ventilation wheel. We take this matter seriously, and immediate steps have been taken to rectify these problems. Our housekeeping and maintenance teams have been thoroughly briefed and will pay extra attention to the cleanliness and maintenance of our rooms and facilities.
 
We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the breakfast and noticed a change in the food selection during your stay. However, we understand that these positives do not compensate for the overall disappointment you experienced. Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience caused.
 
We appreciate your honest feedback as it gives us the opportunity to address areas of improvement and ensure that our guests have a comfortable and memorable stay. We would like to make it up to you, and if you choose to stay with us again, we would be delighted to offer you an upgraded room with a higher level of quality and comfort.
 
Once again, we apologize for the inconveniences you faced and we assure you that we have taken your comments seriously. We value your patronage and hope that you will give us another chance to provide you with the exceptional experience you deserve.
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Dont book a standard room.
text:
The arrival was promising. On first sight beautifull buildings and a great reception. Reception hall and toilet look nice. 

The pool was nothing like on the pictures. It was a bit green and not clear. We decided not to swim.
We had a standard room. The room was nice and the host explained everything nicely. 
But the state of the bathroom was in terrible condition and definitely not 5-star quality. Brown and black kit edges, rusty brown gore pits, loose faucet at the sink, crooked mirror and a dirty spinning ventilation wheel. 
Breakfast was good and for 2 morning they changed the selection of food.

We paid a lot of money for 2 nights, but it wasn’t worth it.
title: Not a 5-star hotel

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: I stayed in this hotel for a night with my wife during a few days trip around the country. This is by far the worst hotel I stayed during that period. The room which we got did not have any privacy because it was between the reception and entrance path where we heard everyone's voices during the night who is working outside. Do no bother booking the standard room on this hotel if you think about any privacy. Room was not used for sometime and not cleaned thoroughly with smells of dust. They did not mention anything about this when booking this room. Hotel is rather small and not upto the standard of a four star hotel. Food is very ordinary type of restaurant food. I am amazed to see a four star belt given to this hotel after experiencing this. You can get a very nice experience in Trincomalee in other places available for the price you pay here. Only good thing was the lagoon view and sitting next to it sipping a drink. Don't be fooled by the nice photos. The service, quality of the food and the quality/cleanliness of the room is not at all upto a four star hotel. Person who welcomed us came inside our room without any notice to show the room around without any mask or sanitary cleaning amidst the covid situation. It was a disappointing stay in this place which we should have omitted during our trip.
title: Dont be fooled by the photos.

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: wPictures on the site and on tripadvisor are probably 10 years old. The hotel is way past it’s duedate. It’s as we call it a fixerupper!!! Rooms are clean but our jacuzzi for which we payed an upgrade didn’t work, the WiFi was poor, all the furniture has seen better days. Pooltowels old and smudgy. Breakfast is fine. People working here are as everywhere in Sri Lanka superfriendly! To the best the hotel is average. You could get a lot better value for money. Average roomprice above $135,-  a night you don’t get a bargin and your entitled to expect more. Also price in the bar and restaurant are adder with  tax and servicecosts which are not communicated with you in advance.
title: Which Once was.....

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: Very disappointing .... the property is rundown and very poorly maintained for the price point. Better to find a better property for the money. Pictures shown on site do not reflect the poor maintains of the rooms.
title: Very disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sichni,
It was our pleasure to host you in our resort. Thank you very much for your review about our resort. We take your complaints seriously and have taken steps to address the issues.  Looking forward to see you again at Amaranthe Bay Resort & Spa.

Thanks,
Leslie and the team
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: We made our visit to Amarante bay resort in the first week of February along with two of our local & foreign friend.Service of the reception was great.The maintenance and the quality of the rooms was not bad.We stayed for two nights and we never had a buffet, only à la carte!! And that too without any diversity.The only good meal we had was one lunch of Sri Lankan cuisine other meals were pretty much not available for us to order.We basically had to order the same salad same main for every meal.I have been to few hotels in Trincomale but this was my least pleasent experience.Despite all the bad service they didnt forget charge an amount which is quite on top than what we expected.I mean it was really a waste of our money.The place looks good but needs some upgrades.They have a beautiful view of bay and good deck.I honestly hope that the management will upgrade their service in terms of quality, food etc. before they can charge something which is equal to five star rate.
title: Not worth for the money!!!

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Wallace, thank you for your feedback. We take all our guest reviews seriously and conduct thorough investigations so we can improve:
 
You arrived early to check-in but since your room was not ready, hotel staff extended their courtesy so you can use the pool and restaurant facilities while your room was being prepared. Your room was made available within 20 minutes but according to our front office staff, you wanted to cancel the reservation because one of your relatives was not feeling well and you had to return to Colombo.
 
I’ll hence address the points you brought up in your review:
 
"comment that the pictures of this hotel doesn’t reflect the reality in booking apps"
It seems like you're attempting to discredit our hotel by targeting all the good effort and time that our past guests have invested when writing their own personal reviews for TripAdvisor.  Claiming that their posted  photos and reviews are deceptive is surely not a productive and fair way to engage in a critique of our establishment.
Our property has been lucky to have been reviewed by almost 450 guests within the last three years since we've opened. These reviews portray each guests’ singularly unique depiction of what our hotel and facilities offer here upon the lagoon.  We feel the conversations have been satisfying and productive for both sides, and we therefore choose to let these reviews speak for themselves. :)

"Location is just lagoon and you can’t swim there , not sea. Sea is 10 min walk away and the way is not good”
We purposely chose the lagoon for our hotel, as we wanted to create a secluded and restive atmosphere, but if surf’s your thing, and it’s quite popular, we have our own aqua taxi that will ferry you and your belongings down stream to the beach. Or, if you’re looking for a sunny walk, just mosey on down the path, and you’ll get there in about five minutes. :)

I'm hoping that there will be another day when you’ll visit our little corner of Trincomalee and  give us another chance to regale and win back your business!

With sincere thoughts and kindness
Loyola & The Team
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: First i should mention that i didnt stay in this hotel altough i booked a room in advance. This is my personel idea and comment that the pictures of this hotel doesnt reflect the reality in booking apps. Location is just lagoon and you cant swim there , not sea. Sea is 10 min walk away and the way is not good. other issue for me was mosquitos , bugs and insects i think  all those are because of lagoon. Actually we coulndt feel comfortable as a family with 5 yo kid but maybe the hotel is good for couple who wants only relaxing. Regarsibg five star , i have found much more better option with better price and we really enjoyed for a week but giving name of hotel is not ethic and against rules of this platform.
title: Booked but didnt stay there.

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Other than the nice junior suite & kind staff, I had nothing appealing about this hotel.

I must say the junior suite is very well designed. Clean & Large. The hotel staff is very kind, but I feel they are not well trained and found some language issues as well. 

Since this has been rated as # 1 in Tripadvisor, I had a big hope. However paying more than 250 USD per night, I felt like I got kind of not even half value of the service.

The entrace and overall setting including the restuarant, I feel like this is kind of B/B Inns property.  Food is very average and not delicious as well.

Finally the photos & the reviews of the tripadvisor doesnt align with my experience.
title: Expectations Turned down !

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
I have been thinking for a long time if I should write a review or not. But considering the fact that we paid USD 250.- per room and night, I think it is important to write that the services in the hotel do not correspond to this price-level and that we were really disappointed. 

The good news: The premises are really nice and you have got a nice view on the river(-island). The staff is really friendly and helpful.

The bad news consist of many details. Summarizing these details this is definitely not a five-star-hotel (even taking into account that we are talking about Sri Lankan categories). Rooms, restaurant and services are overpriced. The staff seems to be untrained. Any sign of management is missing. Some of the details:

- The way to our room was covered with birds-excrements. This was cleaned on day 4.
- The sunbeds are also partly covered with birds-excrements. Nobody seems to clean them.
- There is no coffee in the hotel but filter-coffee.
- Although there is a great variety of food at the breakfast-buffet, nothing looks really appetizing. The scrambled eggs seem to be made of egg-powder. Fruits come out of tin-cans. Juices are not fresh.
- There is promotion of Corona beer everywhere. When you order it, they tell you they don‘t have.
- The cocktail of the day is a cocktail with Gin. When you order it, they tell you that they ran out of Gin.
- The music in the restaurant is simply horrible. This is not a question of taste. It is a „no-go“ to play such cheap music. 
- I order a coke, they bring me a „hot“ coke without gaz because the coke was stored outside in the heat of the day.
- I want to go by the hotel‘s kayak on the river. They charge you USD 5 although the paddle is broken.
- The hotel has no beach. They offer to bring you to the beach by boat. This is a good offer. But they let you out in the middle of nowhere although there are some good parts of the beach with natural shadow and some little infrastructure. Not very attractive.
- On day 4 they forgot to make up our room. 
- I already mentioned that the staff was really friendly. But whenever you needed someone, you could hardly find anyone. In many cases they misunderstood what you said. In some cases they simply forgot what you ordered. We didn‘t have the feeling that they had any training in hotel and hospitality skills. Or it was simply a lack of good management.

These problems are not really big. I think it is a question of management. But Amaranthe Bay considers itself as a 5*-hotel and charges the amount of money for a 5*-hotel. That‘s the problem! It is far from being on the level of a luxury or high-level-hotel.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
The fact that this property comes as first travellers choice in Trinco says it all about the level of accommodation in the area. Still, it really is a rip off for what they offer. It is far from being a resort, in addition rooms are small and old, bathrooms were not properly cleaned, food is just about decent and staff was really rude. 
We tried to have lunch in the garden and as all the tables and chairs were covered in bird's droppings we asked the waiter to please clean one set for us, he told us that we should sit inside instead. That was the general level of laziness.
title: Don't bother

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked a junior suite, which was great and clean. Resort is on a Good location and nice pool. But there ends the good news.
Resort is totally overpriced. We paid a lot for the junior suite (room was great) but the hotel can't meet up to the standard of 5 stars. We had to wait long for our check in and the staff (even the manager) didn't do anything with our complaint. Breakfast was poorly and no attention for details overall: no clean pool towels (had to ask), had to ask if our room could be cleaned, bar staff didn't ask if we wanted to order while their was no one else, tables were not cleaned, etcetera.

Very disappointing overall. Not worth the money.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We are truly disappointed with Amaranthe Bay. Price-quality ratio is completely uneven and when we relayed our feedback (read below) to the hotel manager, no action was taken. 
Without any doubt we will not lodge again in Amaranthe Bay. We spent there 2 nights (2 people, couple) and we will not repeat.

Regarding the HOTEL STAFF, we would like to state that we were able to perceive a disorganization from the second we checked in: we were told that breakfast for the 2 nights we were staying was included (we were paying 500 USD in total) and the following day, after having the breakfast, they brought the bill to the table confirming that they had made a mistake and that it wasn't included. When we insisted that we were said otherwise, they said that they were sorry but that the breakfast had to be charged. 
In addition to this, the restaurant staff was not tidy. When we asked for non used cutterly, they'd take forks from tables that have already been used by other guests. The service was also slow and the 2 times we called them from our room (asking for shampoo and a bottle opener), although they said they were going to take care of our need, nobody ever come to the room with these items we requested.
Gel and shampoo was not refill either during our stay. 

Regarding our ROOM (Junior Suite), we had several light black outs during our stay, the curtains and the window of our room were broken and we even found a lizard next to our bed, besides all the ants.

As stated above, the most disappointing part is when we requested to speak to the Hotel responsible and no action was taken. He listened to us and did not give us any compensation. Unacceptable for a 5 star hotel.

By far, Amaranthe Bay is the worst quality-relation hotel we've been in SRI LANKA in 3 weeks stay.
title: Overpriced and inefficient and disorganized service

ownerResponse/text:
Hi crossbordersrilanka, thanks for your candid feedback. I’m sorry that you had a less than perfect experience while considering an overnight stay with us, but it’s unfortunate that you’ve chosen such a title for your review.  Attempting to discredit all the time and good effort that our guests have invested when writing their reviews for TripAdvisor by claiming that their posted  photos and reviews are deceptive is surely not a productive and fair way to engage in a critique of our establishment. I would have much preferred if you had instead addressed the conversation between youreself and my team without blaming our guests for an experience regarding a perception you felt was untrue.  I’m not at all a fan of having to “air” dirty laundry, but in this case feel the need to defend what we believe is the integrity of Amaranthe Bay as well as the efforts of past guests :) I’ll hence address the points you brought up in your review below:
“The actual place looks a lot different to the images you find online”
-Our property has been reviewed by more than 280  guests and these reviews portray our guests’ depiction of what our hotel and facilities are here on the lagoon.  We feel the conversations have been satisfying and productive for both sides, and we choose to let these reviews speak for themselves :)
"Service was bad as we waited over 30 minutes in the reception area because they had difficulty finding the booking we made online."
-Our hotel check-in time is 2 PM. If guests arrive prior to this time, we do our very best to accommodate them as soon as possible when rooms become ready. You had arrived around 1 PM, and the room was booked via Booking.com as a single room occupancy. Contrary to your claim, our front office had no issues finding the reservation, as we found your booking.com voucher and confirm that you had only booked for a single room occupancy. As you had showed up instead as 2 guests rather than the single guest occupancy you had booked originally for, you were advised about the rate for double occupancy, and this was where the 30 minutes of time was spent, as you did not want to pay for a double occupancy.  :(
“We were told that lunch buffet is open till 2:30pm, but even at 1:30 pm there was no food left.“
-On that day, we had over 20 guests having lunch in the restaurant. The buffet was closed around 3 PM. There was enough food in the trays for all the guests. I believe at this point you were frustrated and annoyed, decided not to stay with us and then left. We then, consequently, had to update the booking.com reservation as a “ NO SHOW’ which will reflect upon your booking.com record :(
As such, I consider it a deep loss for us that we were unable to satisfy your needs and do apologize for any inconvenience you may have suffered. We’ll never have another first-time to show you what so many others have enjoyed here at our hotel, and this is what truly disheartens me.  I'm hoping there will be another day when you’ll be in our little corner of Trincomalee and once again give us a chance to regale and win back your business. 
With sincerest regards and thoughts!
Loyola & The Team :)
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We didn't see the rooms as we turned around and left
text: The actual place looks a lot different to the images you find online. We were told that lunch buffet is open till 2:30pm, but even at 1:30 pm there was no food left. We did not stay because we were utterly disappointed. Service was bad as we waited over 30 minutes in the reception area because they had difficulty finding the booking we made online.
title: Photos are deceptive

ownerResponse/text:
Hi June and thanks for your honest review.  I’m sorry your experience was not more positive, and that you were frustrated with a lack of beach, umbrellas, and turn-down service.  Our endeavour has always been to exceed our guests' expectations,and I’ve taken note of your feedback regarding an arrangement with the neighboring hotel, as well as ordered more umbrellas for our pool, and am investigating the lack of turn-down service which we actually do offer.  I’m hoping you’ll give us a second chance, as our buffet is always a delicious work in progress, with more choices offered daily.  Thanks for writing us, we hope to host you again!
Best regards
Loyola
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
The rooms are very nice in this hotel and the staff are friendly and try their best. The hotel however is located on a lagoon where cattle traverse through every evening so you cannot swim there. The pool is fine but if you want to lie out there for the day there are only 4 umbrellas for shade so first come first served. If you want to go to the beach you can walk three minutes to the next hotel but they will charge you €36 per day to use the sun loungers. Amaranthe should ideally have something arranged that their guests don't have to incur further expense. 

We stayed for four nights and our driver only stayed for one. We had two drivers and they made us pay 1500 for the extra driver despite not having had to accommodate anyone for three nights.

The morning buffet is extremely disappointing and the selection is limited with an airport type atmosphere. We ate out every evening. There are some lovely restaurants near by. 

No gym or turn down service. 

This place would be fine as a four star with lower prices but certainly not a five star. The place doesn't justify the price.
title: Not a 5 star. Don't bother

ownerResponse/text:
Note to self… buy a new beach as soon as possible!  Thanks for the feedback, Conor, I’m sorry your experience was not more positive, especially as the only thing we pretty much can’t change is adding a beach.  However, reading your very lengthy list of everything you did enjoy here at Amaranthe has delighted me, and I am pleased that my staff’s attentive and dutiful service has topped all of your mentioned highlights :)  I’m hoping you’ll give us another chance next year, we’re looking to have a brand new boardwalk built, complete with large umbrellas and cozy seating. And while it may not be a beach, it will be perfect for star-lit dining and loafing about by the quiet waters of our little lagoon.  Hoping to see you’ll visit again, we’d love to see you the next time you’re in Trinco Town :)

Very kind regards
Loyola
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Only the rooms are 5 star. We booked late and therefore may have paid too much... It might be ok if you book in advance and get a fair price. 

The rooms are excellent. Good jacuzzi. Clean. Good tv. Safe. Private balcony. Good views. Big windows. 

There are some down sides. It is on the lagoon not on the beach. If you go the beach and want shade / a sun lounger, it will be expensive. The beach is fantastic. If you stay by the pool, there are a limited number of umbrellas and if you don't arrive early, you don't get one. It is crazy to pay so much for a hotel and then have to pay 36 euro for 2 sun loungers on the beach. 

The staff are really really helpful. The free bikes are ok and you can cycle to the temple or other sites. The big problem is that you are not on the beach. This hotel should have a arrangement for discounted or free sun loungers with a beach hotel.  

The breakfast is ok. The cocktails are good. 

It's is not a 5 star place but the staff do try. They mean well but it is a bit of a shambles.

There should be more fruit for breakfast. The rooms are great but the pool area really needs to be improved. 

If I was coming back to trimco, I would stay on the beach albeit that the rooms would not be as good as this place.
title: Not 5 star but not bad unless you want the beach.

ownerResponse/text: Thanks for your second review after your travel/partner already burned our Hotel  with the same review end of January on TripAdvisor staying your last night with us in Sri Lanka.  We more then happy that our latest guests supported and reward us with highest voting after that. Still we send you our warmest regards from Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: Overpriced hotel, not Sri Lanka prices. Staff is friendly, breakfast all right. Not anything as it seems as in the photos. Really has not aged good. There are many other better options in the area. Sorry but I would not recommend it!
title: Overpriced

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir/Madam, First thanks for fine compliments for the great Breakfast till Noon and for our nice Staff . With your last minute-booking we reply direct on your request on your late check out ,that the room was not available for longer stay through another booking for the next day for the same room, this information we give you before and not after your payment by VISA as you write above. Also we offered you before and after another room for the extra 8 Hours for the full day between 12 noon and 8 PM for special rate of 45 USD for your late check out but you where not interested, then you welcome to stay 2 hours longer at our premisses to hang out at our garden area before your pick up and what you did too. After your check out we found out that your air-condition problem direct was fixed , the A.C. machine in your room where still full out running and after we close all the wide open room windows the room was in 5 minutes A real cool room. You right that the wall light switch was not working, thanks for that we will replace , lucky the light remote control on the bed for all the lights works perfect every where you lay in our widest and most comfortable King Size Bed of Your Room.   

Your information “do not trust booking quality ratings” is exactly true with your quality ratings given.  
What you said your self " it’s the worst example as your last line" you show exact how good reputations of any Hotel you personal try to destroy as revenge when not giving you the free late check out, its happens but lucky only 1 % of tourists do this and we so happy with the other 99 % of all tourists staying with us and Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We chose the most expensive hotel in Negombo (not cheap, an occidental rate in Sri Lanka)
What it was supposed a relaxing last night & day after heading back to Europe, turned out to be a ridiculous experience. 

Staff is wonderful, nice, caring and attentive but...
1- our room (blue room) was not in its best conditions: bad maintained painting, a/c not working properly, general light switch broken, cables and quite dusty. 
You had to go up to it through the accountants office and is located next to the staff room, so it’s noisy.
2- breakfast was great 
3-  “pool premises not available after check out”. The manager send the nice receptionist to tell us we couldn’t use the sun beds after check out because the hotel was fully booked (12 sun beds, just 4 being used at that moment). I’ve never hear such a nonsense thing in a hotel. So after 02.00pm we should wait sitting on a couch until pick up time. So we left. I told the receptionist before checking in and out, but this absurd information came after the visa payment, of course
After my complaint, the answer from the manager  was “no”. So we left to another hotel after noon to spend the day, with no restrictions and 100% Sri Lanka kindness.

So, you guys!!!
- do not trust booking quality ratings 
- do not trust pictures, not updated 
- do not stay here. Sri Lanka is super charming & welcoming country, and this hotel is the worst example due to the management and prices.
title: Overpriced & More

ownerResponse/text: Dear Ladies. Thanks so much for your stay and compliments of the entrance of the hotel and about the very friendly staff and the excellent daily Breakfast at the Terrace. We very happy with that. You booked the Standard Green Room on the ground floor very popular  with the best rates and closely at Pool ,Lounge and Reception. Then the Standard Blue Room on the first floor is further away close at the Mango Suite and more private with windows you can open . Guests always welcome to request for another room when they prefer and when available. We double check your comments and upgraded the Wifi and the Bath Room anti slippery floor tiles ,thank for your update too. Sending our finest Regards to you from management and all helpful staff of Dickman Resort and Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
This 'boutique' hotel has an impressive entrance area and very friendly and helpful staff. There is also an excellent breakfast.

However, given that it was one of the more expensive we stayed in during our 2 week trip, it did let us down somewhat. 

We stayed in the green room and this was accessed directly off reception, giving us little privacy and meaning we could hear the music and pool table being played on when trying to sleep. There was no opening window in the room and given the access we didn't feel comfortable opening the door so were unable to let in any fresh air. The air conditioning in the room worked fine but the bathroom was slifling hot. The tiles to the shower area were more like outdoor paving with a soily grout. 

The coloured paintwork looks nice in photos but in reality the 'boutique' theming of the hotel is not particularly well done. This might be forgiven if the nighly rate was half what it is. Upon check out we were informed that the hotel was shortly closing for a refurbishment so perhaps they could address some of the shortfalls in the design and practitcalities. 

The property is located down a lane off the main strip of restaurants and shops, so is quiet. However, the lane is not lit and was a little intimidating when returning during the evening. The signal of the free wifi was also poor.

The hotel is gay friendly, which is not an issue for us at all. However, we were slightly uncomfortable to see 'company being sought' just outside the front entrance and found ourselves questioning the role of so many young men in such a small hotel.

To be honest there really isn't much of value in Negombo and if we came again we would just go straight from the airport to our next location, rather than making a stop there.
title: Let us down

placeInfo/address: 82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: Based on the reviews here I thought this would be a nice place to stay.   So I tried booking it using the search engine on their website.   It didn’t work.   So I sent them an email requesting a reservation.  The hotel replied saying that payment was required in full at the time of booking and giving me some banking details to which I was supposed to forward payment.   I went back to them asking about their cancellation policy and if I could confirm the booking with a credit card.  They replied that payments are non-refundable and that if I wanted to use a credit card I should book through bookings.com.    I don’t understand why a property would prefer to take bookings through sites like bookings.com to whom they have to pay a commission and which, in my experience, provide unreliable service.
title: Disappointing booking experience

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text: sadly we had to cancel a reservation here -  the booking made through booking, com and we were within the time for free cancellation - they have not refunded the full amount which was taken through booking.com - as yet over 7 weeks and no refund.  This group have taken/stolen my money
title: Thieves

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ne pas venir sauf à moins de 100€
text:
Avec mon mari, nous avons choisi cet hôtel suite aux recommandations des sites, en payant en avance non remboursable nous avons eu 37% de réduction tout en payant 574$ pour deux nuits.

L’accueil est sympathique sans plus et nous n’avons eu la chambre qu’en fin d'après-midi donc partant en balade en arrivant de l’aéroport nous avons dû nous changer dans le lobby, pas top. Nous avons pris un petit-déjeuner et un thé et il nous a été chargé deux petits déjeuner extérieurs donc beaucoup plus cher et nous avons demander la rectification.

La chambre, plafond avec infiltration d��eau et peinture qui boursoufle, climatisation mal fixée donc très bruyante, bonne literie, pas de vrai bureau, une bouilloire cassée, décoration minimaliste. Sans le bruit de la climatisation toute la nuit, calme donc nous aurions bien dormi. Coffre et rangements ok. La lampe de chevet était défectueuse avec court-circuit et une autre lampe ne fonctionnait pas donc très sombre. Wifi ok dans la chambre.

Salle de bain,  bien avec wc séparé, douche à l’italienne grande et baignoire. Juste shampooing et gel douche, pas d'après-shampoing, ni de vanity, ni de brosse à dents…..service minimum. Le meilleur, un sèche cheveux hors d’age très sale avec fils apparent dont il a fallu demander trois fois le changement avant que ce ne soit enfin fait car le personnel ne comprenait pas où était le problème. Pas de serviettes à l'arrivée, il à fallu en demander ni de chaussons. 

Nous n’avons pas pris le dîner vu le petit-déjeuner : pain et viennoiseries industrielles, offre de fruits limite et aucun fruit non coupé (banane, rambutan…). Café à éviter, thé très fort mais ok. Offre de salé correcte avec des curry de poisson très bon. Gaufres ok mais oubliez la chantilly ou sirop d’érable ou miel ou sauce chocolat et une seule confiture. Pas de noix ni de graines pour les céréales mais des corn-flakes, des ersatz de chocapic et basta. Service avec de nombreux stagiaires à l’anglais balbutiant. Quand même comptoir œufs et hoppers. 

Nous n’avons pas testé le bar ni la piscine ni le spa. La salle de sport est très bien avec un prof toujours présent et une grande amplitude horaire. 

Le jardin est luxuriant mais ce navire de béton détonne dans le paysage. Pour le prix payé, franchement zéro. Certainement un hôtel de groupes.
title: Mise à part la piscine, le jardin et la vue…à fuir !!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I regret to hear that aspects of your recent stay didn’t meet your expectations. I’d like to address the construction and roof repairs these were unavoidable, sudden maintenance requirements to ensure the safety and quality of our facilities. While we aim to minimize any inconvenience to our guests, I appreciate your understanding during this essential work.

I’m pleased to hear that Prasanna and our Head Chef were able to make parts of your experience memorable. Your feedback on our dining and room standards is valuable, and we’re taking steps to enhance these areas further.

Thank you again for choosing Aliya Resort and Spa. Your feedback is important to us, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.

Sincerely,
Chirath Chandrapala
Room Division Manager
Aliya Resort & Spa
placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: There are plenty of better hotels in the area. Don’t fall for any older reviews and avoid staying at this hotel.
text:
I recently stayed at Aliya Resort and Spa, hoping for the same quality experience I enjoyed years ago, but sadly, it’s clear the resort has gone downhill.
To start, there was no mention of the large construction project at the hotel entrance on their website. We also weren’t offered a welcome drink, which is usually standard for a resort of this level. During our stay, repairs unexpectedly blocked access to another stairway, causing major inconvenience and wasted time.
Lunch on the first day was the only highlight—tasty and well-prepared. Unfortunately, this was not the case for dinner and breakfast, which were extremely bland. Basic Sri Lankan dishes, including rice and curry, were tasteless, and some items from dinner were repurposed for breakfast. I’ve never had such uninspired food at a hotel in Sri Lanka.
The room was basic and poorly maintained, with issues like a tub with no hot water. Service was inconsistent, and check-in took longer than it should have. Most staff seemed indifferent, though one restaurant employee, Prasanna, went above and beyond to help us. On our final day, the Head Chef asked for feedback, but by then, it felt like too little, too late.
If you’re considering Aliya Resort and Spa, I’d advise looking elsewhere. The resort no longer lives up to its reputation, and the quality has dropped significantly. Not worth the price—would not recommend staying here.
title: Disappointing Stay – Not Worth the Price

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your valuable feedback with us. Your comments are truly appreciated, and we assure you that they will be taken into consideration in a positive light. We believe that constructive feedback like yours helps us in our continuous efforts to enhance the guest experience.

We invite you to visit us again in the future, and we look forward to the opportunity to provide you with a memorable stay.

Warm regards,

Chirath Chandrapala
Front Office Manager
Aliya Resort & Spa
placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
During our stay at Aliya Resort and Spa from April 19th to April 20th, 2024, we noticed several shortcomings, that we would like to bring to your attention. 

1.	 Air conditioner was malfunctioned. The fan of the air conditioner was broken and the fan was not swinging. Throughout the night we were sweating. 
2. We requested bath foam several times to use in the bathtub, but were given handwash instead. This was disappointing and not what we expected from a resort of this caliber. 
3. The welcome drink we received upon arrival was extremely weak and tasted like water. 
4. We had difficulty finding the hotel when we were travelling there. When we contacted the front desk for directions, they were hesitant to provide us with the correct instructions. 
5. Although the food had a decent variety, the taste and quality standards did not meet our expectations. 
6. We observed flies on the food which was concerning and unpleasant. 

We hope that you take our feedback into consideration and take the necessary steps to improve the guest experience at your resort. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
title: Bad Experiences at Aliya Resort and Spa

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

We are extremely disheartened to hear the comments made by you regarding your experiences at our property four months after your stay with us, which was clearly instigated by a different incident rather than the actual conditions / quality of the property. No guest complaint was made by you or any one in your group, at the property or immediately after departure regarding the conditions, the food quality or the kid friendly nature of the property. The only concern raised was regarding some scratch marks on the vehicle exterior at the point of checkout. It was presumed to be due to wild monkey movements however with no solid proof to back this, it is quite vague as to when & how the damage was caused. 
As you are well aware, parking anywhere across the globe is at the customers risk & not the responsibility of the car park owners. Same principle is being applied at our property as well & public notices are on display in this regard. Despite same, the management has gone over & beyond to coordinate & facilitate an insurance claim through the hotel’s insurance to compensate for some of the damage. Further in order to mitigate the discomfort of your group during the inquiry process, the management has offered various amenities & even waived off the extra bills.
Having operated the hotel for nearly a decade we have come across various issues which have all been amicably resolved. However, this is the very first time we have come across unprofessional guests who have gone to the extreme of coordinating cordially with the hotel till the insurance claim was processed and the transactions completed; to go on line & make undue accusations to the hotel on social media platforms. Despite the support extended to you by our Assistant Manager, you have incriminated him online as well. This is rather uncalled for and unacceptable. As a group that goes out of the way to make customer stays memorable, we, sincerely believe that your approach to this situation is unethical & unprofessional. 
We sincerely hope you look at all that has been done to support you & your group during this incident. While all your comments are noted by the property, we hope you will be genuine in your comments regarding your stays in future.

We apologize if there was any confusion or miscommunication regarding this matter. 

We never intended to suggest or encourage you to cancel the second room. Instead, we merely informed you that if you chose to cancel it, our last-minute cancellation policy might not allow for a refund. Our aim is always to be transparent and fair in our dealings with guests.

Regarding the sauna, we are pleased to hear that one of our housekeeping and maintenance team members confirmed it was operating as it should. 

As for the bar service and the birthday dinner, we deeply regret that the quality of food did not meet your expectations. Rest assured, we are already working closely with our culinary team to make necessary improvements and enhance the overall dining experience.

Once again, we genuinely apologize that your stay did not meet your expectations. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and it is our sincere hope that you would consider giving us another chance to demonstrate the high standard of service and hospitality we are known for. Chirath Chandrapala
Front Office Manager
Aliya Resort & Spa
placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
I sometimes wonder if these reviews help as there tends to be so much contrasting information for readers and the detail gets confusing. So can I start by saying avoid this hotel if you can. You don’t need to read the rest of this review if you don’t want to. 

For those that want the detail, when we got there after a short delay a very pleasant lady showed us to our rooms. We were a family of 5 for this trip and on the recommendation of our travel agent we had booked rooms next to each other of the same size and style. 

Our rooms were enormous. The lady showing us the room asked us if we really wanted the second room as we would comfortably fit into the room we were looking at which had 2 big beds, 2 bathrooms and plenty of privacy for our 14 year old. 

We asked the pleasant lady whether we would get a refund if we didn’t take the second room. “Of course” she replied, or should I say lied, “I will confirm with my boss.” 

We told our travel agent who over the next few days told us to get it in writing from this particular hotel. Obviously they have form. We tried a few times and eventually spoke to the manager on the penultimate day of our stay. He said there was no agreement to refund us. The pleasant lying lady was there for the chat and spoke in Sri Lankan to avoid us knowing what she was telling her boss. 

The manager said we were at liberty to use the hotel room for the rest of the stay ie the last night. Yeah, thanks for that. We told them we were not happy at all and had been deprived the room for all of our stay based on what we had been told. The manager looked us in the eye and said that the lady had no authority to offer the refund and as a result matters were out of his hands. Thanks for that too. 

Aside from misleading us, we asked for sheets for our son, 4 times on the first night before they delivered a single sheet that we were supposed to use on the daybed. He slept with us. 

We went to the bar for drinks twice. The first time we left when we decided that life was just too short, the second time it took an age for the drinks to arrive. 

The room had its own sauna. It never worked. They fixed it three times. It still never worked. The staff have a habit of looking you in the eye and saying things are sorted when they aren’t. Frustrating. 

One day our family of five asked for transport to a local restaurant. They ordered a single tuk, built for 2/3 people. Absolutely thoughtless and incompetent. 

Worst of all was a birthday dinner. Organised to be by the pool, the kids could play whilst the adults are eating. The food was pretty inedible. We tried to make up for that with drinks but at one time I ordered a gin and tonic and was given a piece of lime in a glass. 

There are clear communications with the staff, very few of whom speak adequate English. They compensate by smiling and saying yes to everything. 

To add insult to injury, there is a feedback form that you complete, seal and it gets posted to head office. I completed it, sealed it and 5 minutes later as we sat waiting for our luggage to be delivered from the room the manager came running over to ask us what was wrong with the sauna. He’d obviously intercepted the letter intended for head office which is pretty disingenuous. 

It is hard to think of anything right about the hotel. I’m just happy we spent most days out and about.
title: Think twice before booking

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
On December 18–19, 2020, we stayed at Aliya in Deluxe 2022 with Attic. This is our second visit to the same property. However, compared to my previous visits, the service quality has dropped drastically. Even though we arrived at the hotel with a pre-booked room, the front desk took approximately 30-40 minutes to assign us a room. The rooms were clean and spacious. 
After a few unsuccessful attempts in contacting the maintenance department, we had to remind the receptionist twice to check the cable TV.
Their dinner buffet had a good spread with 3–4 action stations and catered to both western and Sri Lankan cuisine. though the restaurant service was on the slower side.
The following day was a rainy day, and, surprisingly, there were no umbrellas available in the rooms to go for breakfast. We noticed that it was a common issue for most of the adjoining room guests as well. We had to call the receptionist four times to request umbrellas and wait nearly 40 minutes to find two umbrellas, which were taken away (kept in the basket at the corner of the main building) when we returned from the restaurant.
The same thing happened during lunchtime, after waiting 30 minutes and making a few requests. I decided to bring my own umbrellas in my car, which was parked in the other corner of the hotel, even though it rained. Somehow, front office staff contacted me and informed me to release the key or room as soon as possible, though they forgot to provide even a single umbrella.
When we returned to the restaurant, I handed over the room keys to the front office around 12.45 pm and requested my bags be kept in the guest reception/departure area. 
After lunch, we noticed that our bags were not in the reception/departure area. The 02 staff members were not informed until I requested my bags several times. They were informed around 2.40 p.m. The internal coordination was very poor, which is disappointing for a hotel of this standard. 
I raised a complaint through Aliya Reports' FB Messenger link on December 22, 2022, and will never recommend this to anyone due to this rude and unpleasant staff service.
title: Superb location but very poor staff/Customer Service
