placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived on the premises with rather good reviews, particularly from our travel agent who was super enthusiastic about the resort. We found a massive concrete structure with zero charm and quite far away from the Sigiriya rock.
Front desk staff took a long time - after a well trained but not convincing ceremonial - to give us a room. While the hotel had plenty of empty rooms, it took us two hours to get a room. Very disappointing room I must say, quite large but basic and with a flagrant lack of taste and style. 
We inquired about other types of rooms available and got to see a cottage room, quite oldy and with zero light. We realized later on that the assistant manager of the resort lied straight to our face because suites were also available. We would have been quite happy to pay extra just to get a decent room. 
Basically, the only think the resort sells is the huge swimming pool overlooking the greenery and with views on the Sigiriya rock. Unfortunately, the water of the swimming pool is far from clear, we couldn’t see our feet in the pool with a depth of 1.2 m. 
In short, the resort has 90+ rooms and works like a big factory. 
Moreover, in our room we realized that the bathtub was leaking. The second day of our stay, the assistant manager lied again to us when we inquired about the suite, arguing they were all occupied while we could still book them on the booking websites including their own.
On the plus side, the executive chef was very helpful and nice, trying to make things as good as possible. Also, the Ayurvedic massage at the spa was very good.
title: Really bad surprise!

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Went there to spend the long weekend. Of course they had advertised some online offers and on top of that being the long weekend they should expected the hotel to be fully booked. And It was. Aliya being a star classed hotel and after paying a  big chunk of money we expected a star classed service and facilities from the hotel.  However what we experienced was the opposite. At the time of the arrival the lobby was crowded. Of course the hotel advertised there self and its the long weekend. They have to be prepared for that. We were fortunate to checkin on time. But the room was not cleaned properly. Tv was not working. Had to spend several hours reminding them to replace the tv. Food was tasteless. All the 3 meals we had had the same menu with few changes. No varieties. Just 2 or 3 options in mains. We doubt whether the hotel had a restaurant manager and enough staff to cater the guests. Water was not served. Finished plates were not cleared. Guests had to clear the tables by their own. Didn't expected this kind of service from a theme resort. Must tell again, if you invite people to spend their money on your hotel, give it the value. If you expect the people to visit you, have your people ready to give the service. If once the service was bad you will never have that customer returned.
title: Disappointed service

roomTip: Front Office staff are rude,Avoid the log cabins..they are rubbish
text: Re posting my Comment again since Theme Resorts & Spas had no backbone to accept their fault and apologize and instead removed my comment and blocked me on my other profile from their FB page.    The last time these people came up with an offer like this,was after the Easter Attacks,when tourist arrivals spiraled and we booked our stay for 5800 Rs per person at Aliya. Right at the outset, I got so many calls from the front office and tried to promote their log cabins, claiming they were better in quality than the Deluxe rooms we originally booked.After a few calls, I sternly told them that I will not change our rooms blindly,and will need to have a look at those log cabins which were supposed to be superior in quality than the Deluxe rooms.Luckily,this was the best decision I made as  the log cabins were situated in an isolated area near the Entrance gate,away from the Restaurant,the Pool and the scenic view of Pidurangala and Sigiriya which is the only selling point for Aliya Resort.Even though their check in time is supposed to be 2 pm,we were given the room only at 3.30 pm,while we waited in the lobby area with little kids since 2.15 pm.A guy from the concierge just gave us our 3 keys, and asked us to proceed to our rooms,with no one to guide us or didn't even give us directions.We were wondering around the whole property for half an hour and we met a young lady from the front office escorting some foreigners to their rooms, who casually pointed us to the direction of our rooms when we inquired about the location,with no real attempt to help us.It was past 4 pm when we found our rooms and settled in...it took about another half an hour for our luggage to reach us...So we lost a good 2 1/2 hours of our stay due to Aliya front office staffs in competencies and complacency.Our stay was ok from then onward till the next morning when the front office kept calling us from 9.30 am and asked us to clear our rooms,despite the fact that the rooms were given 2 hours later because of their own fault.So we ultimately packed up and proceeded to the lobby to hand over the keys when a guy from the concierge rudely started yapping that we are late and there are people coming in who need the rooms at 2pm and bla bla bla...Wonder why the same attitude wasn't blurted at the previous guest as well and hand over the rooms at 2pm to us.The attitude of the front office staff was as such that all who took up on those offers from Aliya  were beggars and we were privileged to book rooms with them only because of the low offers advertised by them out of their generosity.As a person who had made a couple of bookings for 30,000/night at Aliya, when times were good for them,I was very offended at their demeaning attitude towards paying customers,who flocked into safe their jobs and finances due to low arrivals after the devastating attacks.Being a medical officer,my dad being a senior Dental surgeon,sister being a lawyer and my wife an Engineers, we were offended and humiliated by the front office staff and determined never to  book through any offers from Theme Resorts & Spas.If there's anyone else who want to brave the attitude of the front office staff and Still make a booking,avoid the log cabins at all costs.Furthermore,what the management should have done after I made my original post was to contact the property and take remedial action against the front office staff instead of blocking me from their page and removing the comment.This action alone is enough to state the obvious that the management is not at all bothered to accept their faults and atleast apologise. So in retaliation against deleting my original post,I wiill post this review on their tripadvisor and FB pages as well so this can't be removed any more.
title: Superb Property,Rude Front Office Staff

Kelum Jayaweera,
Resident Manager
Jetwing Kaduruketha
placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Never book non-refundable trips with this property
text: Jetwing Kaduruketha's handling of a non-refundable booking left much to be desired. Despite communicating our inability to travel due to heavy rains and the safety concerns for our small children, the hotel rigidly upheld the non-refundable policy, charging us a hefty $430 for two nights. The lack of flexibility and empathy towards our situation was disappointing and demonstrated a disregard for customer circumstances. The hotel's unwillingness to accommodate or consider extenuating circumstances reflects poorly on their customer service standards. For a more understanding and customer-centric approach, exploring alternative accommodations in similar situations might prove more satisfactory.
title: Unsympathetic Policy: Jetwing Kaduruketha's Disappointing Handling of Non-Refundable Booking

We book this hotel for 2 nights stay and we checked in to this hotel on 13th November and we were given room 108 and this room main door lock not working, toilets door cannot close water leaking from the roof in toilet and waste water lines are block and finally they change the room next day and the funniest part is the toilet, my wife showed me this toilet is clearly visible to the restaurant and staff enjoy watching the toilets & showers.

In regards to the food offering, thank you for pointing out the portion issue and this is something I will be reviewing with the Executive Chef when designing the set menus we propose. You might be pleased to learn that we are presently reviewing our menu selection to increase the Sri Lankan food offering as well. We thank you for bringing this up to our attention.

It was otherwise pleasing to read that you found the team very helpful and that you appreciate the services rendered during your stay.

Jetwing Kaduruketha is surrounded by natural scenic views, paddy fields and a stunning views of the Poonagala mountain range. Strolling through the resort allows guest to experience the natural beauties all around and this is a part of the eco tourism experience we want our Guests to be a part of.

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: "Arachchi" villas are better than "Welvidana" villas, "Welvidana" rooms have less/no privacy
text: There are two types of villas(Welvidana & Arachchi) in this hotel, of which we selected a "welvidana" villa for our stay. Every two villas were built jointly and you can hear what your neighbors are talking about. Also villas' walls were built out of bamboos and you are provided with fabric blinds to cover.The villa had a small veranda to relax yourself. But we felt the room did not have any privacy due to the architecture of the hotel room. We were disturbed by the noise of our neighbors. Also they could see us if we are sitting on the veranda.Rooms were clean and neat. But it was not that specious. Food were arranged by way of set menus and we did not like the variety at all. Also food portions were not enough for an individual & tasty. The hotel was fully occupied on the day we went and had a less number of staff to serve the people.But they tried to do their maximum though we had to wait for a long time once the order was placed. It is good if the hotel can include pictures of the dishes to their menu as it will help to get an understanding about what you are going to get on your table. Hotel surrounding was not that clean and appealing. We felt it was untidy.We noticed people were ordering food from the a la carte as well because the set menu was not enough to full their tummies. Though the hotel is promoting the brook down the hotel we felt there is nothing to get entertained in its. You have to walk a long distance from the entrance of the hotel to the restaurant and pool. Anyone  who is visitng wellawaya should not choose this hotel during drought season as the environment and surrounding looks terrible. This hotel best suits for families.I believe the hotel can do better by improving themselves to keep up their good name.
title: Hotel is below the expectation

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at the Jetwing Kaduruketha as part of our honeymoon break. From the pictures it looks like an incredible, luxurious get away that should have been bliss and from what we knew about the Jetwing name we expected great service. As it was we arrived at this remote location to find little reason to want to stay. 

The setting is beautiful and the eco villas in nature is wonderful, however for somewhere so remote we expected a high level of service, facility and information. 

The swimming pool is amazing, but there are only enough deck chairs for 2 families. All around the pool is clearly unfinished and you have to hop over unbrushed concrete and stones to get to it. 

The staff are all very friendly but clearly untrained. We only stayed for dinner the first night. It is the most expensive meal we had in Sri Lanka, around 3000 rupes for a bland simple chicken curry. We had to wait a long time to get served, then the food took a long time, first the rice came, then i had to ask to bring out the curry. It should have come with 3 vegetable dishes and the waiter pointed at a curry leaf and a chili and said these are vegetables! I said "no! they are spices." Then showed him the menu and he returned with the side dishes... All the drinks were warm and they had run out of many things, the hotel was hardly busy. 

There was no information about what to do in the area, we had bikes and asked staff where to go and got vague points into the wilderness. In such a remote place some idea of where is nice to walk to or visit would have been very useful. There was no information at all about local attractions or hotel amenities. 

I think the room had Wifi but there was no code and by this point I was sick of asking the staff.

We booked a wake up call which didn't come. 

We ended up arranging all our own transport and activities and did not return to the hotel for dinner the second night, we had paid for breakfast the last day but had no interest to stay for it, we left 6.30am. 

On leaving I informed the man on reception that our stay had not met our expectations on the Jetwing brand and the service was bad, we just sort of smiled like he knew and agreed. They had already charged us for our room on arrival, I assume this is why.
title: Unfinished, Overpriced, Understaffed and Poor Service

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text: We visited this hotel a couple of days ago. The room is nice with it a semi open concept allowing you to view out into the padi fields as you lie in bed. The outdoor bathroom is big with a good shower. The pool is of a decent size so what you see in the pictures are accurate enough. The staff are friendly, as they have been in every place i have stayed during my 2 weeks in Sri Lanka. The problem comes with the restaurant.  They don't really have a menu per se as every time I asked for one they told me they're just starting up (they opened in Nov 2015) so you're not quite sure what you can order. I had to ask twice before they took out a drinks menu which at least showed how much they charge. A bottle of beer was 700 rupees which is almost twice the price anywhere else.  This is a large hotel chain after all so you can decide if that is reasonable. What I found strange was for such a large chain, they didn't have a proper a la carte menu from the get go. Dinner is from a set menu. You get the feeling that things are quite put together with this place. Maybe the rushed the opening as a lot of the landscape was left as bare earth and rubble with the pool pavilion floors half done, which makes you trip if you try to go into the pool. You also get the sense that a lot of the staff are fairly new and it is quite hard to get service at the pool even though it is right below the restaurant. Hopefully it gets better because for USD$125 a night, this place sort of fell short.
title: Not quite ready.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Greetings from Jetwing Kaduruketha,

Please accept our sincere apology that the facilities didn’t fulfill your expectations including the room facilities.

The hotel is themed around agro-tourism, organic farming, and authentic Old Ceylon Kandiyan village homes.

The reason there's no TV or air-conditioning is that the hotel encourages you to experience a traditional village life and farming culture of Sri Lanka. Our themed dwelling has walls made purely of bamboo shoots, so you get natural lighting in throughout the day and the view of the paddy fields along with the breeze which constantly blows from Poonagala mountain range, and It also helps to get constant noise with the thrums of birds constantly in the background.

We thank you for your detailed & candid feedback; we do regret that the service and the food did not meet your expectations on certain instances. All aspects highlighted by you have been taken note of for our betterment & we thank you for letting us know in detail.

We sincerely hope we will have another opportunity to serve you, if you do decide to stay with us again.

Ayubowan,

Thashinthan Panchanathan
Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Choose a room close to the pool.
text:
Our party of four adults and a kid had a two-night stay at this place in two deluxe rooms. The place looks nice and is similar to the award winning jetwing property at vil uyana in Sigiriya but this has some severe shortcomings. To begin with, the rooms had no AC and no TV and this was a room priced at 31000LKR!. There is no privacy in bathing and toilet area. We had been given a twin room though we booked a double. Please verify this before you book. There were quite a few gekos in the room whose droppings could be found all over each morning.. On the positive side, the room was spacious with clean linen and good general cleanliness. There was a free WiFi service which was very good
The food tasted good but that's about all that is good about it. There were no buffet meals, even the hotel was quite full. We spent at least one and a half hours for each meal.  When all four adults in our party ordered rice and curry,  the curries were served in soup bowl sized dishes and refilling took ages and that too we had to ask ! You would loose appetite just waiting for food. It looked almost as they were reluctant to serve food ! The meals did not have much of a variety compared to hotels of similar class.  However It must be said  that the staff appeared to be doing all they can to be courteous and helpful  but they seem to be working in a system which is totally impractical.

The spa treatment was good though there were limited options.

This place offers a personal butler service for each room, who would also accompany you on exertions as a guide. They also provide two bicycles for each room.

There is a scenic pool with unusually cool water, which is quite nice in the climate.

If you have a relaxed schedule and do not care much for creature comforts, and is an ardent nature enthusiast,  this would be a very nice place  to stay. If you care for AC room comforts and plenty of good food to eat you just might be  disappointed.
title: A dissapointment at a great location

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback, and please accept our heartfelt apologies for the shortcomings during your recent stay. We are deeply sorry to have fallen short of the high expectations rightfully associated with the Anantara name and your loyalty as a GHA Platinum member.

Our Front Office Manager has already been in touch to personally address your concerns, and we are committed to resolving this and regaining your trust. Please rest assured we are reviewing all points raised to ensure immediate corrective actions.

Warm Regards, 
Keith Tomkies – Cluster General Manager 
Anantara Kalutara Resort
placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
This is our fourth different Anantara, which obviously gave us certain reasonable expectations, and only heightened the disappointment.  This is not sabotage by a competitor or the review of some disgruntled ex-employee, please look at my many many other reviews of five star hotels around the world. I have also been for several years a Platinum member of the GHA Discovery loyalty programme of which Anantara is part.  
 
The hotel is on a peninsula by a lagoon so not really a "beach hotel" especially with large waves, being on the west coast.  It has the advantage of being relatively close to the airport as the expressway bypasses Colombo city.  
 
For context we stayed six nights, in a pool villa, at over US$1,000 per night for bed and breakfast, which also creates certain reasonable expectations (especially given Sri Lanka is not generally very expensive and this is not in a major city).  
 
Oh dear. Where to start.  
 
Maybe with the arrival. I could not believe the entrance to the hotel.  It could have been a municipal car park. No nice plants or flowers, just a concrete desk in the brutalist style.   And loads of parked cars with no hedge or anything to screen them.  Literally the worst first impression of any hotel I have ever stayed at anywhere in Asia.    
 
They do try, there is a delightful dance by some girls in local costume with drummers to escort you from the car park entrance to the actual reception, which is a nice touch. 
 
Hotels, in general, and including the Anantara, are not very good at appreciating that after a sixteen hour journey door-to-door, guests just want to get to their rooms, not wait around in very hot un-air-conditioned reception areas. You have all my details, the room is paid for, what takes so long?
 
Wine-gate
The next catastrophe was the religious holiday.  We had arrived two days before the local New Year's celebration.  Mea culpa.  I refer again to the 16 hour journey - we were looking forward to relaxing with a drink. However, the host who took us to the room declared that the hotel bars were now shut due to the holiday, and no alcohol was available for THREE DAYS.  Not, I'm afraid, our idea of a holiday. And half of our entire stay at this hotel. Why had they not e-mailed to warn us of this?  The same guy re-confirmed that by Whatsapp that afternoon, none of the restaurants or bars were serving alcohol.  But we could have alcohol delivered and drink it in the room.  So rather than an atmospheric dinner on our first night we had room service.   
 
So to have a drink the next day by our private pool we ordered beers on room service.  To save phoning again and waiting, answering the door again, we ordered four, and put two in the fridge.  Seemingly all good.  Until later when wanting to consume said beers, we discover there is no bottle opener in the suite. So, phone up again.  And wait.  After 20 minutes, phone again.  Two minutes later a bottle opener arrives.   Three minutes later another knock on the door, and a second bottle opener arrives!   
 
Then I realise that the wine we have ordered in advance for the evening (on the basis there is none in the restaurants) has a cork.  And there is no corkscrew in the room.  Sorry, the thousand-bucks-a-night suite. What they have delivered (twice) will only open beer/soda bottles.  So rather than waiting to call until after dinner I phone, again, and ask for a corkscrew, so I will be prepared.  A few minutes later same room service guy, says he has come to open the wine.  I don't want the wine opened now, I want the advanced technology to enable me to open it later that evening after returning from our (dry) dinner.   
 
Poor guy, he says it is his own personal corkscrew, but hands it over to me anyway, bless him.  I told him to go straight back and make the hotel give him a replacement.  I really hope they did. 
 
Went for dinner.  And guess what, they are serving wine, no problem. The embargo on alcohol was only for one night not three. 
 
The Anantara boasts three restaurants.  The main restaurant is an international buffet (you know the type).  It's alright, if that is what you are looking for in a five star experience. And an Italian (more later!). We chose to go to "Spice Traders", the Asian option.  The food was actually very good, with table service 'n all. An overall nice experience, more or less what we would expect. So far, so good. 
 
On two of the subsequent evenings we tried to book we were told Spice Traders was closed.  This left the five star hotel with a choice of only two restaurants: a buffet, or an Italian. And we had not really flown ten hours to eat Italian. Unacceptable and absolutely not as promoted.
 
I was really hoping to call out the Italian restaurant, Acquolino as a highlight.  We had lunch there, fresh pizza, which was excellent.  For dinner, I had a seafood risotto which was very very good indeed (fine dining standard). The wife had a good lamb shank, falling off the bone. All lovely.  
 
Sadly the wheels fell off with our final lunch.  I guess we chose badly, but the menu is limited and it was our fourth lunch there.  A terrible lasagne that could have been straight from a (down-market) supermarket and a tagliatelle dish with horrible tomato sauce, bland and far too sweet, seemingly out of a jar.  Such a shame. 
 
Bottled water:  there is definitely a problem with the bottled water supplier, or the Anantara is storing it for too long before use.  Increasingly through the stay, the water provided was off. And yes, water can go off!! It started as the occasional bottle, but by day six seemed to be every bottle we opened smelt of old socks.  We did not encounter this at any of the other four hotels at which we stayed in Sri Lanka.
 
We have stayed in several hotels around the world in rooms with private pools.  And never before have only two outdoor towels been provided. The whole point is you want to use the pool in the morning, before housekeeping comes, with a fresh towel.  You then use that one all day.  So provide four towels.  It does not increase the overall towel consumption at all. You simply start the day with a fresh towel. Pool suite etiquette 101. 
 
Checkout: the reception area is not air-conditioned so is naturally very hot and humid. The only ceiling fans are over on the other side of this area and nowhere near the desks.  The process is slow, and made infuriating by the fact that those behind the desk have standalone desk fans on full blast.  Pointing at the staff (who are accustomed to the heat) rather than the paying guests!!
 
There is then a leaving ceremony to wish you well on your journey, which is another nice touch.  
 
All the staff were very polite and friendly and keen for us to be happy. And there was certainly no shortage of staff. But providing a five star experience is all about attention to detail. So many silly things that could be fixed. Like the telephone for room service that sounds like they are underwater and so impossible to understand. It is just unnecessary frustration. Like the coffee cups in the room not being paired with the correct matching saucers so they slide around and spill.  Small but so simple.  
 
Occupancy was clearly low while we were there, which is a cause for concern. And it seems tourism across the island has not returned to pre-pandemic levels. But despite local economic challenges there is a global brand to preserve.  Perhaps merging the Anantara Kalutara into the adjacent Avani (already common ownership) and targeting a lower price point with lower expectations, is a solution worth considering.  
 
Perhaps we were just unlucky. But sadly we will not be using any Anantara again.
title: Seriously disappointing for an Anantara, multiple problems

text:
首先，我不得不提到一个名叫“Chathuka”的工作人员。
他真的很认真也很负责，对每一个细节都照顾处理得很周到，并且他会一直持续关注事件后续的进展。虽然他不是经理，只是一个普通的工作人员，但他发自内心的热情的微笑，让我们本来不太愉快的居住增加了很好的体验！顺便说，这是一位非常有耐心的工作人员，希望酒店可以予以关注并且提拔！
但是遗憾的是，除了上面我提到的这位工作人员，其他的工作人员的服务态度都很好，但是执行力却很差。我的意思是他们会答应得快且笑容满面，但最终未解决我的问题。所以有意义吗？
酒店的沙滩和景观也非常的一般。所谓的“海景套房”，却完全没���海景！所以整体对于这次的入住，我们是不满意的。
我的电视机会自动开机的功能，直到最后一天我离开了酒店，却依然没有修复。而我，不得不每晚睡觉的时候强制关掉总的电源！
我要求更换枕头，而更换完的枕头却有很浓的尿骚味，这真的让我本来就已经疲惫不堪的身体感觉到更加的痛苦。
餐品的确很丰盛！但是即使我点杯咖啡的速度，都简直是令人捉急。最后一天我因为赶着离开，所以早餐时我提前40分钟（当我抵达餐厅时便要求点两杯拿铁）。但直到我最后离开餐厅时，吧台的工作人员在我再三催促下才匆忙为我打包。让我留下了最后一天离开前非常非常不好的体验。
First, I have to mention a staff member named "Chathuka".
He is really serious and responsible, taking care of every detail very carefully, and he will always keep an eye on the progress of the incident. Although he is not a manager, just an ordinary staff member, his warm smile from the bottom of his heart made our otherwise unpleasant stay add a good experience! By the way, this is a very patient staff, I hope the hotel can pay attention to and promote!
But unfortunately, except for the staff I mentioned above, the other staff have a good service attitude, but the execution is poor. I mean they would say yes quickly and with a big smile, but in the end they didn't solve my problem. So does it make sense?
The beach and view of the hotel are also very average. The so-called "sea view suite" has no sea view at all! Therefore, as a whole, we are not satisfied with this stay.
My TV would turn on automatically until the last day I left the hotel, but it still hadn't been fixed. I, on the other hand, have to force the power supply off every night when I go to bed!
I asked to replace the pillow, and the pillow after replacement had a strong smell of urine, which really made my already tired body feel more painful.
The food is really rich! But even the speed with which I can order a cup of coffee is a rush. On my last day, I was in a hurry to leave, so I was 40 minutes early for breakfast (and asked for two lattes when I arrived). But it wasn't until I finally left the restaurant that the bar staff, after much prodding from me, rushed to take out my coffee. It left me with a very, very bad experience before I left on my last day.
title: 不太满意的住宿体验（I'm not very satisfied with the accommodation experience）

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
We got upgraded on check in which is always nice, but unfortunately for us that is where the good news ends.

The food choice and quality at the restaurants was pretty poor, the ambience lacking any real character. We ate at the buffet - dark and dingy with noise above of people playing pool. No atmosphere to speak of and the food was poor.

We also ate at the Asian restaurant which again was very dark and the food was just about okay, but lacking the wow factor.

We had planned to eat at the Italian restaurant on our last night but it was closed. It seems they operate a rotating availability without telling the customer, making it impossible to plan. It seems bizarre that they sell the hotel on the basis of having 3 restaurant options and then randomly reduce it to 2. 

Breakfasts were pretty average, with the usual interminable delay in getting tea delivered to the table - 20 minutes this morning, a new record! and no milk!

The pool areas are nice and the adult only pool is very pleasant. The sunbeds and towels all look like they could do with a refresh and service was patchy. One day we got water and ice creams, the next nothing at all.

The beach is nice although a bit of a trek from the adult pool area and the sand is coarse. 

Housekeeping was excellent- friendly and helpful. If only the other areas could match that standard.
title: Disappointing experience after a great time at the sister hotel at Tangalle.

text:
I stayed for one night with my family during a long weekend, and it was a complete disaster. Everything was fine initially—check-in, rooms, and amenities—until we hit the dinner time. With the hotel almost fully booked for the long weekend, the management and restaurant staff were utterly clueless about handling the crowd. We were forced to wait over 30 minutes just to get a table, which was beyond frustrating.

To make matters worse, the charges were significantly higher than those at other five-star hotels in Sri Lanka, yet the service was abysmal. Paying a premium price for such poor management is a joke. We had to endure an unacceptable wait just for a table. This level of service is completely unacceptable.

Breakfast was no better. We arrived early when it wasn’t too crowded, but by the time we finished, the restaurant was packed. I’ve stayed at various hotels, both bigger and smaller, on busy weekends, and never have I experienced such disorganization and delays.

And to top it all off, when we checked out, all we got was a pathetic verbal apology from the cashier. No one from management even bothered to step in and take responsibility. This hotel chain has proven to be a complete disappointment, and I will never stay at any of their properties again.
title: Might be a good hotel, but not when it's fully booked

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Мы часто отдыхаем в отелях Anantara.
Поэтому в этом отзыве я сравниваю данный отель с другими отелями Anantara и тем высоким уровнем сервиса, к которому они нас приучили.

Заключение: это худший отель сети Minor в котором мы были:
1. Посредине отеля приходит городская дорога, по которой с шумом проносятся машины и Тук -тук, и может пройти любой. Вы идете из ресторана отеля к своему номеру и каждый раз вы пересекаете эту дорогу, вас обступают сомнительные люди с предложением такси, Тук-Тук и прочих услуг, словно вы идете по базару. И это отель 5 звезд от которого вы ожидаете тишины и релаксации. Дверь вашего номера смотрит на эту дорогу так что утром вас будут будить весело проносящиеся на стоянку рядом Тук -туки или местные подростки из ближайшей деревни с гулом спешащие на пляж, где вы и будете отдыхать и купаться в их компании и под их восторженными взглядами. 
2. Пляж не принадлежит отелю. На пляже есть лежаки от отеля и охранник, но готовьтесь что по пляжу будут слоняться люди не относящиеся к отелю, глазеть на вас, предлагать вам различные услуги и всячески стараться способствовать вашему безмятежному отдыху. На пляже нет спасателей, наслаждайтесь купанием и тоните на ваше усмотрение. Если вы решите прогуляться по пляжу до соседнего отеля AVANI также принадлежащего Minor, готовьтесь увидеть дары моря: бревна, палки, грязь вынесенные морем,  которые никто не убирает, зачем, ведь пляж не принадлежит отелю, а значит зачем тратить деньги на его уборку ? 
3. Основной и взрослый бассейны очень маленькие. Анантара приучила нас что лежаков всегда больше чем людей и как только вы приходите, вам приносят полотенца, воду, меню бара и окружают заботой. Здесь все не так. Вокруг переполненного бассейна вы сначала будете сами бегать и искать лежаки, потом бегать за человеком с полотенцами, а потом за официантом с меню бара. Прочем в соседней AVANI персонал внимательный и все у бассейна работает так, как и должно быть в настоящей Anantara, к которой мы привыкли. 
4. Если вы пришли и сели за столик у бара или бассейна это не сигнал для персонала что к вам нужно подойти и предложить меню. Вам придется побегать и заявить о своих намерениях перекусить.
5. 2 раза у нас не убрались в номере к 3 часам дня и убрались только после напоминания. Никогда мы не встречали такого в других отелях сети.
6. Из хорошего хотелось бы отметить Ресторан Spice Traders, он  изумительный! Это гастрономическое удовольствие, но бронировать его нужно за 2 дня, если вы приехали на 2 дня можете не попасть.  
7. Итальянский ресторан полная противоположность.    

В заключении я не рекомендую тем кто уже отдыхал в отелях Anantara, останавливаться в данном отеле, так как вас может ждать разочарование.
title: Отзыв об Anantara Kulutara

text:
I've stayed at several Anantara properties. This by far would be the lowest rated of the lot. Located in a not ideal area. Not a nice beach and the lagoon is not particularly beautiful either.
 Service, especially in the main building and main restaurant, is inadequate in relation to the standards of an Anantara resort. The restaurant is like a waiting room in a train station and you constantly feel like a volunteer in a kindergarten. ...... There is no question of relaxed dining in a luxurious ambience here. Photoshop has also done its job here with the official pictures. The quality and selection of the food is mediocre, especially compared to other hotels (we know what we are talking about as we were guests in 6 excellent 5 star hotels during our round trip). On top, food and drinks are totally overpriced (sometimes 3 times the price of better 5 star hotels in the country........Pizza Magaretha 18 US $.... with what justification remains a mystery to me. No value for money!
Maintenance on buildings are needed especially on the pool decks ……never saw  a 5 star hotel neither any anatara in this bad shape.
Housekeeping is not working properly as it tooks 3 days to remove black long hairs out of the shower, room etc. really not acceptable.
Fish smells from the head my regards to the poor management of the hotel….. totally overpriced hotel with poor facilities.
We are very disappointed with this Anantara Resort because it does not have the usual standard and totally overpriced........ Travel 174 km south to Tangalle and check at Anantara peace heaven ……..two waves collide..... a really really fantastic hotel which provides the original anantara standard.
May be the management from Anantara Kalutara should travel there as well to learn how a hotel will be managed.

Please don’t bother me with pre arranged standard answers or a even a Bot generated answer.
title: An average hotel pretending to be a luxury hotel

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
I was at this resort for a girls getaway for my bachelorette. The booking was made by my cousin and my bridesmaids and I were very excited for this weekend. 
When we arrived check-in was nice and the welcome dance was cool but it all went down hill from there. 

We were driven to our villa by Krish who was stopped by some tuk tuk drivers on the public road when he told them we were local they didn’t want to talk to us but he said they can still talk to us and almost encourage them to try and rip us off. The next morning we were bothered by the same tuk tuk Drivers. 

The villa was nice. The pool was really beautiful, but the master bedroom stank like sewer. There was a horrible stench coming from the bathroom in the master bedroom which infiltrated the entire room. There was also a note for a previous guest from the hotel left on our bed, and we had no welcome notes or appreciation or acknowledgment from the hotel. 

There was absolutely nothing to celebrate my bachelorette. When I was wearing my bride-to-be sash around the hotel staff would give me weird looks and we’re just totally shady and creepy the entire time. 

Service was painfully slow. We had to ask for water three times at breakfast. We also had to ask for tea, and when it finally did come, a staff member spilled the tea all over our table. 

The meals were mediocre at best and repetitive. There was not a big selection, and the entertainment was grotesquely lacking. 

Our experience was so bad! We needed first aid care on our night there and the hotel’s response time was despicable. They took over 15 minutes to get to us while one of us was bleeding and in need of medical attention. 

I would never come back to this hotel again, and I will have to do a bachelorette redo after this horrendous getaway.
title: Bachelorette Redo Needed

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed at Anantara Kalutara for 4 nights as a family with two young kids.
The positive: pool is great, breakfast and dinner was good and had nice variety.
The Negative: we stayed at Anantara resorts all over the world, this one by far is the worst, the resort is run like a 3 star hotel, yes everything you might need at a resort is there, but it's not what you would expect.
1- check-in experience: all the paid activities and dinner/lunch options were discussed at length, when I asked about what I paid for which is half board, I was told that I can use the normal restaurant, but of I want to experience fine dinning should go ahead and reserve at one of the a la carte restaurants.
2- there seemed to be a general feel to the resort that all guest requests are troublesome to staff members, i.e pool towels are always not available, reason given, the laundry didn't come yet. Room cleaning was done, but towels weren't replaced, and old ones were taken away, so after a full day outside of the resort with two small kids, we come back to the room and jump into the showers only to realize there are no towels. 30 mins later we get 1 towel for the 4 of us 
3- we booked a pool side room with a terrace, this wasn't cleaned from bird poo, and only after a couple of calls to guest relations a staff member came over, and just moped it.
4- on our last day we get a call to ask about check out timing, we replied with 12 as the standard checkout timing, the staff member noted that any minute after 12 we will be charged a full day. Which is fair I guess, but why would you say that to a guest that just spent 4 nights at your property.
5- 11 pm we get wake up by substantially loud banging noises from the next door room, we checked to see what's going on, and apparently the room was being cleaned by staff members, we asked for the noise to be kept at a minimum as both our kids were woken up by it. 40 mins later both staff members were still loudly on their phones and loudly moving furniture pieces around. This repeated on two nights, where we had to visit reception and complain for this to stop.

Overall, in my experience, this is a refurbished 3 star hotel, given the Anantara brand.

As a comparison we stayed at the Anantara in Tangalle on a previous trip to Sri Lanka, and absolutely loved every second we spent there.
title: Not an Anantara resort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mrs Hunt

I am sorry that you were not happy with your stay at KK Beach. We have spoken to the staff and would like to respond accurately to your complaints.
1.	No TV in the room   You were booked into one of our entry level rooms, and there are no televisions – a fact that we have made clear to all agents etc. If that was a specific requirement of yours, then you should have made this clear to your agent when booking your holiday.
Because you had wanted to watch a sports programme, we offered you the choice of a brand new tablet, a laptop, or use of the only vacant room available for the period to watch the match. 
You chose to decline all offers.
2.	Upgrade Room offer.  Your husband enquired about upgrading to our Ocean Penthouse Suite and we gave him a hugely discounted rate.
Again you chose to decline the offer.

3.	Lack of storage. Sri Lanka is a tropical island, and very humid, our closets are open spaces, because if you have drawers and cupboard doors, this will lead to them becoming musty and a build-up of mould very quickly - it is important to have airflow.  Again, if having drawers for your clothes was an essential requirement, this should have been made clear by you when booking your holiday. The Duty Manager offered additional coat hangers for your clothes, and again this was declined by you.

4.	Noise disturbance. Regrettably there was a musical show on two consecutive nights approximately 900 metres away from the hotel. This is something that is TOTALLY out of our control. After calling the Duty manager at half past midnight on the second night, he made an inspection of the room next to yours that was vacant that night, and yes, he could hear music, but it was not that loud.  The Duty manager then called the local police station and he got them to enforce an end to the music show at 1.30am – more than that there is nothing we could do. The next morning the Duty Manager went around the tables at breakfast talking to the other guests, none of whom had been disturbed by the music. For you to say the room was vibrating is an exaggeration.
Your request the following day of a free upgrade for the next two nights we could not agree to, particularly when nobody else had raised a complaint. However, because we have a good relationship with the agent through whom you made your booking, we did agree to offer you a complimentary dinner that night, at which point you informed the staff that you had booked another hotel and were checking out there and then. 

We have tried very hard to ameliorate the situation, but it seems you were not to be placated. Especially in light of the fact that no other guest made a complaint about the noise disturbance, we cannot agree to a refund.  

Yours sincerely,
George Cooper
placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No drawers or cupboards in deluxe rooms . Very noisy if there is a music festival happening.
text:
Terrible customer service  for the money small room no storage and very noisy did to a music festival going on the beach. We complained 2 nights in a row as we were kept awake by local party goers celebrating the  bank holiday with a festival of DJS and music until 1.45 am . We were booked for 4 nights and decided we were sick of complaining and tired of being ignored so we left after 2 days and they refused to either upgrade us  us or refund us for the 2 days we didn’t use. Eventually when we were leaving and had loaded our cases into the taxi we were offered a free dinner if we stayed ! I told the manager we had found a quieter hotel and it was too little too late !  I asked him to refund the complimentary dinner from one of the 2 meals we had already had but he would not so we paid for that too. 
The travel agent is still trying to get back the money for the 2 nights we have not used as the hotel is not cheap and we are now in another hotel and paying twice. It’s really disappointing and awful customer service they have said sorry about the horrendous partying but I have had enough of trying g to reason with them at 1.45 in the morning as this has ruined our holiday and our whole experience.
title: Terrible management and customer service

text:
Check in was delayed by two hours. Waited for an hour and then was moved to a temporary room for the second hour. WiFi didn't work - router challenges. 

Primary concern was -  If you call for transportation through ride apps - the drivers are scared to come pick you - because there are tuk tuks outside the hotel who will apparently beat them. Raised concern to hotel. Staffs response was its not their responsibility. These drivers parked at their hotel entrance have no affiliation with them. They asked me to either pay the transportation at the hotel gates - at higher rates - or walk out of their hotel on foot with my luggage if I didn't think it was right.  

When I pointed out - this affects their guests directly and is their responsibility as well to an extent. The staf literally pointed me to to the exit. 

Maybe its a general challenge for all hotels here. Regardless it was a negative experience over all - specially considering this is a 5 star rated hotel.
title: Room for improvements

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Понравилось · Отличные два бассейна с пресной и морской водой. Удобное местоположение. Приветливый персонал. Организуют тематические праздники. Территория хорошо организована, прекрасный вид, особенно на закате.
В ресторане местная кухня хорошая, цены адекватные.
Небольшой, но вполне хороший спортзал (для меня это большой плюс). Есть бильярд.
Завтраки нормальные, кофе не очень.
WiFi работал хорошо, устойчиво по всей территории отеля, скорость нормальная.

Не понравилось · Номер, в котором жили, не соответствует заявленной звездности (заявлено 5 звезд). Номера изношены. Три раза по три дня кондиционер тек, вода лилась в номер и в середине стояла лужа. Сам кондиционер старый, потеки происходят вероятно регулярно, о чем свидетельствуют подтеки на стене у него. Индикатор температуры вообще висел на шнуре, торчащем из кондея.
Убираются не очень аккуратно, по углам, чуть скрытым местам пыль.
В сильный дождь протекал потолок в ванной.
Полотенца меняли через раз, два раза пришлось самому ходить менять. Полотенца только по одному большому на проживающего и одно маленькое, толи для рук, толи для ног, его ни разу не меняли.
Первый раз столкнулся с таким, что в ванной лежали три коробочки шапочек для душа, две их которых были пустыми (не очень то они нужны были, просто неожиданно).
Мыло кусковое положили одно в начале, больше не меняли.
Стояли емкости для шампуня и кондиционера в ванной пустые, после того, как пару раз сказали об этом, наполнили на третий день.
Заказывали ��ду в номер, грязную посуду на следующий день не убрали, поставил за пределы номера, и там она долго простояла.
В ресторане европейское меню делают посредственно.
Возможно нашей семье не повезло с номером.
Еще раз обращаю внимание, что сравнивал из ожидания и личного опыта, что гостиница 5 звезд.
Были в этом отеле 5 лет назад, это был отличный отель, сейчас разница огромная.
title: Не соответствие зведности отеля и состояние номерного фонда.

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bad service
text:
Absolutely avoid booking at this hotel; it's a risky and frustrating experience. Unfortunately, I had to cancel my trip due to a family member's passing, and unlike other hotels in Sri Lanka that promptly refunded me, this particular hotel exhibited an appalling lack of responsiveness. Numerous emails and calls went unanswered, forcing me to rely on Agoda for communication.

What's worse, despite informing the hotel well in advance, they heartlessly charged me for two days and two rooms. There was no willingness to show compassion, even in such a difficult circumstance. The service was abysmal; every attempt to contact them was met with unfriendly and unhelpful staff. When I called, I was redirected to email, and even after multiple attempts and follow-ups, there was zero response.

This hotel's indifferent attitude towards customer concerns and the absence of empathy during challenging times make it an establishment to steer clear of. Save yourself the headache and frustration by considering alternative accommodations that prioritize customer service and basic human decency.
title: Be careful, book at your own risk

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid at all cost
text:
Initially I had no intention to write a review for this hotel. However, I was compelled to write one after seeing the way the property manager responded to comments made by two of my family members (thus just one dot). I've given quoted few lines from a previous replies from the manager. It's up to readers decide the truth.

I have to admit that the front office staff was very friendly and supportive. This hotel has no access to beach or sea, the most important factor in the area. Hence they direct guests to another hotel at the beach. Unfortunately there is no communication between two hotels and guests will experience two different conditions from those two.

Stewards at the restaurant didn't bother to take our order and we had to wait over 20mins for a steward to give the order. That's after walking up to them over four time.

"At your arrival you refused given car keys to valet parking then security had to involve as parking got blocking from your cars"
- It wasn't valet parking. We simply parked in front of the hotel. We refused to give car keys because of the rude manner your security officer treated us and all vehicles were from the same group. Most importantly right to hand over key of a personal vehicle remains with the owner of the vehicle and you cannot force to do that.

"What had happened that you have brought alcohol bottles from outside and drinking in our hotel restaurant and parting- singing of 15 pax group so you understand it is disturbing house guests so beach house management had to involve to make you understand that as we had complained from our hotel guests"
- Alcohol we consumed at hotel restaurant was purchased from your bar and yes we consumed our alcohol at the room balcony initially and in the room after night fall as we did not want to disturb other guests. This was permitted by your hotel front office staff. The group consisted of three generations from the same family members and everything was wrapped up before midnight. All this time hotel played music at the restaurant from a large speakers & ours wasn't loud as you've described here. This is simply a baseless accusation by the manager to convince readers that we were disturbing others. 

After all bitter experiences at this property, we feel that this is how this hotel treat local guests to convey the massage that we are not welcomed at their property.

There're many more to write but please read all responses given by the hotel to negative reviews. They itself speak the truth about the attitude of the manager of the hotel. The same manger who was shouting and commanding his own staff at the restaurant during the breakfast. 

Yes, my other family members informed the hotel that this will go up on various forums after settling all bills both rooms and considerable amount for extra services we obtained. That's purely due to dissatisfaction from the moment we parked the car to checking out and for anything in return. 

So far the worst experience I've experienced from all hotels I've been to internationally.
title: Bad service and attitude

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Dilushka, 

We are sorry that you had this isolated experience with us. We are also disappointed that some aspects of your experience did not live up to the expectations. Thank you for taking the time to write a review. You have already told us that you have to damage the hotel good image by writing a fake review. This is 5th   review you put on the same matter so we have to reply the same over and over again as we never discriminate against Sri Lankans. 
 
 We afford and treat the equal right to all citizens where NO person shall, on the grounds of race religion, language or anyone such grounds, be subject to any disability, liability, restriction or condition concerning access to our hotels. As you mentioned we know very well that domestic tourists have stood by our industry through difficult times and it’s our citizens who have supported our industry right throughout.

text:
Firstly this is an honest review, it is nothing personal against the hotel as the staff were excellent, couldn’t have been friendlier and the management team were great.

However, I do feel that would be guests and fellow travellers should have realistic expectations of what to expect.

Firstly, given the condition of the room we stayed in this certainly is NOT A 5* HOTEL

The room initially appeared fairly clean but upon looking closer the room was worn, tired and did feel slightly grubby because of this. The big cobwebs in the corners of the main room and bathroom speaks volumes about the level of cleanliness as did the old bedsheets which had a hole in them and were ‘grey’ rather than White. 

A generally ‘rough finish’ to the room
(See photos) it appears to have been an old building which has been painted a bit.

Positives:

Nice lobby area, good location only 5-10 walk from unawatuna beach, great view of the sunset form the rooftop bar, two separate pool areas with one that feels like a private pool for 3/4 rooms

Negatives:

No safe in room initially, we asked for one and one was brought to the room but not bolted down and could be carried out (unlikely but still!) Poor aircon, Loud fan, The sofa was stained,  the ‘fresh towels’ were stained as were the pillow cases, grubby and generally very worn feel to the room. Slow bar service and although they advertise ‘premium sprits’ the bottles are all empty and I have a suspicion that the ones that are full are not actually the proper branded liquor.

I’m a reasonable man and understand you get what you pay for but at over £200 per night I expected more… a lot more! At least a certain level of cleanliness, a decent finish to the room, clean towels, and decent bedsheets not ones they were stained and with holes in.

If you are going to stay here then you should be paying no more than £70-£80 a night as it’s a 2*/3* maximum.

Yours disappointedly Donald Holiday
title: Underwhelmed, very disappointed and would not stay here again.

text:
We stayed here for 2 nights during our honeymoon. This hotel is far from what we expected it to be and clearly not a 5 stars hotel. Room facilities are outdated and maintenance is poor, towel rack and sink shelf were ready to fall of the wall, curtains and towels had stains on it. Room is not sound proof, we could hear absolutely everything that was happening outside: steps from the hallway, people talking at the pool, lobby music and phone ringing from the next room. We had a difficult time falling asleep. As if this is not enough, there was an extra window in our room with only light curtain on it hence the sun woke us up really early.
Hotel stuff was over welcoming and keep asking us spa treatments which we didn't wanted.
We ended up spending most of our stay outside the hotel.
Overall we had a bad experience and would defenetly not recommend this hotel.
title: Bad experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear valued guest,
 
Thank you for writing to us following your stay with us.
Your feedback is extremely valuable to us as we strive to improve with each and every day.
 
We are extremely overwhelmed on your comment on our luscious food prepared with utmost care and love and praised by many of our guests. However our sincere apology for not pleasing your palate.
Both Chefs and service are willingly accommodates special meal/dilatory requests in such we would have definitely come up with off menu suggestions i.e. vegetarian options if we could have been informed. Our professional chefs are keen on food quality and temperatures and surprisingly it was the only complaint we received with regards to Christmas Eve Gala Dinner.
Also clearly letting you know that we are a well reputed hospitality brand in country with almost 30 years of history so we never raise funds from guests for staff welfare (party). And also our guests would never praise us if we do not offer a great service (guest comments).
We offered your baby a pasta as always prioritize kids even though you were way early to Gala Dinner. Also we opened you the entire bread section instead of some bread in a basket, which you appreciated but surprisingly complaining.
Our room rates are never ranging US $ 400 + per night, its evident by the rates online where its public.

Thank you very much for sharing your valuable feedback and looking forward in welcoming you back at Thaproban Pavilion.
placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We had high hopes when booking the hotel since the reviews of the place were good. However, our experience of the hotel & the services provided was anything but that. We paid USD 430 per day for our room and for food and with this amount of money we expected a 5 star experience. What we got was at best a 2 star experience. Let me try to summarize point wise:

1) On Christmas eve there was a mandatory dinner (USD 50/person) and the food was cold and limited. It seemed that the hotel was trying to collect this money to fund a party for their staff who were least interested in making sure that the guests were having a good time. The staff was busy trying to have the guests quickly finish the dinner so that they could start with their own party
2) My mother is vegetarian and the only items available on the menu for her were french fries, a vegetable burger, a vegetable pasta, a vegetable pizza and a vegetable wrap
3) There was one member of the staff, who seemed like the owner of the property who always seemed to be eating his food with the guests. The staff too were busy taking food for him instead of ensuring that the guests were having a good time
4) The service was downright abysmal - we ordered a pasta along with bread and the bread came after we had finished the pasta. This is just one example of the lack of professionalism. The staff also did not understand basic instructions in English
5) When we were checking out we were repeatedly told that we are half an hour late and we should leave ASAP. It would have been brilliant if the same level of urgency was shown when we were checking in when we were made to wait for an hour
6) There were limited channels on the Television (10 approximately) and the Wi-Fi was erratic
7) One evening the barbeque grill was being done below our room and the smoke completely filled the room. It took a couple of hours for the smoke to clear
8) The hotel is at the end of a busy & narrow road and is approximately 1km away from the beach
9) The bathroom had no hangars/pegs and the door did not close properly 

You cannot be charging USD 400+ per day and give this level of service. We had spent the first 3 days of our trip in Taj Bentota which had similar prices but the level of hospitality was exceptional. I would urge all people who are looking to book a room in this hotel to look elsewhere since the prices do not reflect the level of hospitality.
title: The only thing 5 star about this hotel were the rates

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We went into this hotel s restaurant for lunch on 17th April 2019. It was an A La carte menu. We ordered a Lagoon prawn curry, chilli Crab Linguine a long with three other dishes....as it was 5 of us. The first disappointment was that they said they didn't have the crab for the linguine as mentioned in the menu but that they will substitute it with prawns. I was ok with that, and went ahead and placed the order.
But alas! When my dish arrived it was not even prawns but shrimp, that they had substituted. So for a dish described as chilli Crab Linguine priced at Rs1450 they served me the linguine with literally 10-15 shrimp!!! It was day light robbery and a complete rip off!!! And the taste was absolutely bland. The shrimp was not marinated adequately and was not tossed in adequate amounts of spices and garnishing as expected, according to the menu description.
Then came the second disappointment. My husband ordered the Lagoon prawn curry - the menu stated that it was going to be accompanied by country rice and a salad. But alas! When the above was served it was accompanied by a small portion of rice, 3 pieces of papadam, lunu miris and chutney!!! This Lagoon prawn curry was priced at Rs3650. Lunu miris, papadam and chutney are mere rice pullers, and are not considered even as accompaniments or side. The taste was the worst!!! We Sri Lankan s know what a typical prawn curry tastes like. At this hotel the, the prawn tasted bland....there was no coconut curry flavour to it at all. It seemed like they had boiled the prawn in water and added it to a pre cooked curry and heated it and served! It was absolutely disappointing.
Being Sri Lankan s and in the hotel and travel trade we are very much in touch with how the food industry works in our country. We take great pride in the signature Sri Lankan dishes like the Lagoon prawn curry. These people have completely down graded this dish. They should have thought twice before serving such a dish prepared at such a low cost and served at such a high price to a local client.
An absolutely disappointing experience at Thaproban Pavilion waves!
title: The food was putrid!

text: Just visited Sun Aqua Pasikudah. Now, don’t get me wrong it is slightly more ‘luxurious’ than your standard hotel BUT it is extremely over priced for what it is. Was not impressed with the layout of the hotel at all. The breakfast was OK and the buffet dinner was horrible. The prices for extra food and drinks are an absolute disgrace.
