placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
It was a disappointment 
Of course it is not crap but not what you would expect for a 5 stars and over 150$ a day in  country where the average wage is about 300$ a month. 

The main disappointment is that you can’t swim in the sea. There is a small lagoon on the beach that face the hotel. This leads to having water under the knees and a lot of dead corals that prevent you from walking with bare foot. 
Plenty of hotels on the other side of the bay like the CALM hotel for example. Have a look on google and you can see it clearly. 

So you’re left with the swimming pool which is nice and large but of course it is disappointing. 

Outdoor bathroom is extremely large but a bit useless and there is no blind meaning that you can expect early rise which is not what you would expect for resting. 

Amenities are terrible. Certainly cheap but it is refilled with the cheapest possible shampoo. Clearly not Hermès as in Sofitel or Bolton as in Shangri-La ;)

Air conditioning is stopping every hour. They claimed it was an electricity supply issue but you would expect that a 5 stars hotel would have invested in a generator. When it stopped it makes a specific ring tone to wake you up :). Anyway at some point It is to warm. 

Food and drinks are extremely overpriced. 

Breakfast is ok but far from 5 stars absolutely not to the level you would expect. 

Very nice ocean suite. 
Staff is nice but management is disgraceful. 

So if you are used to guest houses you will love it. If you are used to 5 stars and have some expectations this hotel will fall short.
title: Far from 5 stars - can’t swim in the sea - not for you if you expect a real 5 stars

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Big expectations. The website is amazing and are selling a ultimate beach dream.
So, the problem is, the landscape and beach are fantastic and really meets the expectations. However, it all stops there. As we also had the Grand Beach Pavillon it is important for us to give our feedback. 

We will make it short:
- Grand Beach Pavillion : this is not in any circumstance a 5 star accommadation. Here is why: it is in a very poor condition. The roof in the bathroom are falling apart. The light does not work. There are no minibar and the fridge is warm. No coffemaker and it is in general dirty both inside and terrace and pool. Also many ants and other bugs inside the villa. Bathroom, not nice, it was very dirty! Not a good sign.
- Staff: We tried to give feedback on the villa. It took three hours for roomservice to come when we had ants and bugs. Also the management wouldn't listen when we tried to communicate.
- Food: POOR! We made a mistake and booked half board. It was buffet for every meal, and especially dinner was bad.

The list could go on and on. This place is overpriced and not worth the money.

We have stayed at many 5 stars hotel, this is not one. More like 3 stars. Maybe...
title: Disappointed!

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Firstly the good- the setting of this hotel is spectacular. The views from the infinity pool out to the ocean are second to none. And if you want a few quiet, relaxing days then this is the place to be. 

There are a few things that aren’t necessarily bad but you should know before booking

- the rooms are called “ocean” rooms, however that seems to mean just facing in the general direction of the ocean not looking  on to the ocean.

- the toilet and shower are in a private area of the room but outside! Therefore when showering after a hot day or doing your other business you’re in a very hot environment

- the place was very very empty when we visited in early July, almost eerily empty and made us feel slightly uncomfortable. 

Then for the things that led to my rating. We only stayed 2 nights and had to walk to reception 4 separate times to complain about something wrong with our room (because the phone didn’t work to call them)

- when we arrived they had written welcome on our bed with flowers and leaves. A nice touch if it didn’t come with a bunch of ants as well. Had to ask for the linen to be changed

- linen was changed but ants prevailed in the battle. New solution was to leave a bottle of RAID in our room

- the power decided to just cut out around 6am one morning when we were sleeping leaving us to wake up to a hot room 

- and then the fourth was early one morning Gardner’s were trimming trees outside our room (fair enough) but for the better part of a day left the clippings on our footpath until I asked them to be cleaned up 

Should also note that even when the power worked the air conditioning was fighting a losing battle it desperately needed to be replaced

Additionally, I need to mention the staff. The reception staff really needs to improve their English skills - most of what I asked of them had to be repeated several times (expect this in a local guest house, not a 5 star resort). And the F&B staff is very inattentive. Took 3 requests over 15 minutes at breakfast to get a cup of coffee, and you can lay by the pool for hours without being waited on.

Overall I believe there are other just as beautiful resorts in the area where you will get better value for money, Sun Aqua needs to lift its game
title: A few stars short of 5

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 7 nights in the sun aqua, so it's save to say that we are pro's and we've seen it all. And no, I would never ever recommend this hotel or would ever come back. Let's start with my experiences and well meant feedback:

The front desk: very friendly and some of the staff there speak good english and give reasonable information. Some though have no idea what they're talking about. 

The rooms: the first impression was very good. Big rooms, nice furniture, big bed. Bathroom is also very big but old. Plus: it's only half covered by a roof. One half is open. We asked right away if we had to expect mosquitos etc... "no, don't worry".... weeeeell, there were a lot of mosquitos, and bugs and that made us go to the bathroom at night with no lights on. That's just a no go.

Room service: one of the few good things. They cleaned our room twice a day very properly and were friendly.

Beach: and now read carefully. If you're going to Passikudah for a beach holiday, DONT GO TO SUN AQUA. You cannot swim at the "beach" there is a huge reef with thousands of corals which make it impossible to swim. Other rewievs said, that 200 meters away was a nice beach. NO THERE ISN'T. there's only the public beach with 100 locals swimming in their clothes and no sunbeds or shade. Also it's dirty. Very dirty! So much litter.
 After the public beach, the nicer beaches start. But again no sunbeds, shade, umbrellas. Only hotels and it's impossible to spend more than an hour in the hot sun. 

The pool: ok. So no beach but a nice pool. The pool is nice indeed. The sunbeds on the other hand are just disgusting. Is is so hard to replace old and used sunbeds with new ones? 

The restaurant: extremely expensive and I'm not exaggerating. At first you think the prices are quite ok (although compared to Sri Lanka's average income still too much) but then you'll find the "small print". They charge you 10% service tax plus 15% government tax which made our stay extremely expensive. 
I usually don't mind paying much money if the service and food are good. But that wasn't the case in Sun Aqua. In fact, there wasn't a single night without complaints. 
For example: they offer a lot of wine, which is actually quite good (they charge you 25% government tax for the wine btw). But everytime we had ordered a bottle of wine, they either didn't have it, they brought the wrong bottle or it was way too warm (white wine) which leads to my next point-

the service: i've never experienced such an incompetent service and I've seen a lot. That's not the fault of the staff but the management HAS to work on that point if they want to compete with other hotels in the area. The staff really has to improve their english skills! There were so many misunderstandings because of the lack of the language. Also, they have to be more present. Many times when people were lying at the pool, nobody came and offered drinks. We had to go to the bar and wait extremely long for our drinks. One time, the crows found a bag of chips at the pool, openend it and made a HUGE mess. None of the staff thought they were responsible and another hotel guest cleaned the mess and told the staff (there were two staff members standing around the corner doing nothing!!!!). Again the management has to work on that!!! Please train and instruct your staff properly. How should they know how (in my case) spoiled Europeans should be treated. I paid A LOT of money and got so little in return.:( 
The last three days, we had dinner at The Calm Hotel because the Sun Aqua only provided a small Sri Lanka Buffet which was boring and not good. The food at the Calm felt like heaven every time we were there. 

The 7 days felt like years especially because there's no infrastructure whatsover in Passikudah, which is not the hotel's fault. However I regret that I spent my holidays, money and time at the Sun Aqua. It was a  disappointment and I really don't know how the hotel got 5* and so many good reviews. If you want a nice holiday in Passikudah, I can recommend the Maalu Maalu where we spent one night. 

My last words: dear Sun Aqua, please read my feedback and don't just write the text you always write. Please think about my points and instruct your staff. And also please reduce your prices in the restaurant-they're ridiculous. We pay the same in Germany and get a lot more quality!
title: Expensive hotel with extremely incompetent staff

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
So here's the long version.

I stayed with my wife in early July, and gotta say this must be the 8th mystery of the world. How in the hell did this hotel get a 5 star rating?

I should be honest and say the building itself is quite impressive. Very spacious, newly built. The good side stops there.

Closer inspection and actual stay revealed so much short coming that even my heavily discounted room rate seemed expensive. After one night (not even one night actually, within 16 hours), I checked out immediately even though the management flatly declined request for refund. I still thought it was worth saving my holiday vacation elsewhere than stay here because i couldn't get a refund. A right choice indeed.

Ok, so let me take you through the experience I had from the beginning. I was given a room at the second floor, where they claim it is a beach suite in the reservation site. But, no this is not a beach suite from other REAL 5 star establishment standard. No view of the beach at any angle. In fact covered by buildings in the front.

So the first image of the room seemed quite nice. Very spacious, high ceiling and quite huge room. (I am guessing they are calling this an all-suite-resort because of the room size, but they have no idea how to manage a suite really.). Outside toilet and bath/shower also seemed quite nice at first glance.

Now, as I start unpacking I start noticing all the worn downs and all the cheap 'money saving' attempts that seem so obvious. First the sunbeds are all torn apart, and the towels are used for so long and often they are quite rough. 

Amenities are half Molton Brown (Loofah, Grooming Kit etc)  and half Sun Aqua (shampoo, shower gel) brand. This is a speculation but it seemed pretty odd they would have different brands of amenities, and after more observations of how this hotel was being so cheap, I came to conclude they might have actually tried to save costs by mixing whatever stock they had left from the previous amenities instead of chaning the entire amenities to the new brand. But anyway, not the important part.

I was surprised the hotel would leae the torn up sunbed as it is and receive guests here. Again, it came to be explained that the management simply DOES NOT CARE or HAVE A VERY LOW STANDARD in service quality. (See Picture). Also noticed the Key Cards had been so worn down it looked like it wasnt ever changed since the beginning of this hotel. The shower booth had strong sewage smell coming out of the sewers as well. The Bathtub was also worn down, and the water tab handles were broken but operatable.

Next very important thing I noted was the lack of cold air from the A/C. And the A/C started spewing out disgusting smell, like sewage smell. We thought it was the hot air outside and the room would cool if we left it on for a few hours. turns out at night, the room is hotter than outside !!! Can you believe that? When complained, the hotel offered to change rooms so we did, because we were not gonna get any sleep there with so much heat in the room and the mattresses.

When we changed rooms, we noticed that the A/C was not any better. Now what we noticed was that the A/C was a cheap chinese maker not ever heard of. Something like 'Cool Power' or something, and must fall drastically short in performance to more famous branded A/Cs like Samsung or LG or other brands. (The hotel we moved to had Panasonic or Philips i cant remember, but had no problem with A/C! So yeah, it's not us, the hotel A/C was really that bad.)

Because I couldnt sleep, we moved back to our rooms, at least it had 9 hours of A/C on despite the room still being hotter than outside (which was night time with sea breeze), and smelling awful (but get used to the smell). I looked through the reviews wondering how people missed all these bad things. Then, I saw one review saying how the hotel is only concerened with making money. After that, I came to realize and started noticing that everything in this hotel was CHEAP. Lack of management due to being CHEAP, despite having built a good building out here.

Another HUGE MAJOR problem comes from the fact that the beach in this hotel had too much rocks and corals and made it dangerous to swim in it. You might be able to walk in it with slippers but thats it, you had risk of being cut if you got caught by the waves.

And the POOL! Oh my god, i never saw anything like it. Another review posted in 2016 said the pool was infested with bugs. So we having not slept much, woke up early in the morning to check it out. And  wow, (check picture) the pool IS INDEED VERY MURKY and INFESTED WITH SO MUCH INSECTS!!!  I've never seen pools so poorly managed like this, not even in 4 star hotels I've been. When this was brought to attention to the RM, I was shocked that he saw no problem with it and said its only natural. I will tell you all, this is NOT NATURAL. IT MEANS THE HOTEL IS NOT CLEANING THE POOL WELL ENOUGH. Other hotel I moved to, THE CALM had pristine clean pools, and obviously no bugs! 

Everything I can expect as common service seemed like a luxury in this poor excuse of a resort. So we decided to check out the next morning, only because no one could accomodate our needs at the time of night when we initially wanted to get out. The supposed Residential Manager came in to work late, (more than an hour later than the hotel staff had initially advised) poorly dressed, with even worse attitude.

The manager only repeated that it was 'natural' how their hotel was in such a poor state, and 'no refund' was possible even for the nights we did not stay. I had a bad  experience in one of the more famous resort hotels, and at least they had a courtesy to refund the nights I did not stay, but here, its a different level. I will make full disclosure, the management did offer an upgrade but I decliend after seeing so much signs of neglect and uncaring enviornment. Just did not think it was worth wasting my vacation time for a little bit of money.

So I moved to the Calm in the morning without the refunds, but it was a much better decision as I had a splendid time in The Calm. The beaches at that part of the hotels are much better (check the google map to see what I am talking about)

Anyway, its a long review, but this hotel is definitely NOT 5 STAR HOTEL. If you think its just worth it staying here because its cheap, think again. In this case, bad management is worse than bad facilities.

If anybody asks me, I would tell them to stay the heck away from this place.
title: A ridiculous resort, quite insulting.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear moose2010Bavaria,

We thank you for your honest review of the property. We apologize for all the shortcoming that you experienced, we are sad that we failed in so many areas when looking at most of our reviews we have done well. Nevertheless we take these comments positively and will move forward and fix the issues. Do connect with us directly if you need any further assistance.
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: 106 is the best room with a plunge pool and beach view
text:
We stayed here for six nights in the end of august. The location is really amazing and quiet, but they could do much better:

Good points:
-	Room with great design, everything worked very good (lights, AC…)
-	Private plunge pool in open air bathroom
-	Public pool nice and clean
-	Room very clean
-	Maintenance staff very fast and friendly
-	Cleaning staff very friendly 
-	Good fruits on breakfast buffet
-	Very qiet and beautiful beach

The sea in front oft he hotel is very shallow and full of dead corals – not good to swim, but i would never review that bad, i informed myself in prior. A short walk out oft he hotel is a public beach thats nice to swim.

Bad points:
-	No clear service level: ONE day (out of 7) – somebody got pool towels to he beach for us.
Others got flowers upon arrival – not for us, even when we were on honeymoon (informed Altamish, the reservation manager in prior!)
Somtimes the bottles and the glasses at the beach were collected – mostly not
-	Ugly toilets at the pool, very stinky
-	Pool towels and sunbed pillows very dirty and damaged
-	No reliable front desk – Example: Altamish told us that we can rent a scooter, next day we were told that there is no scooter rental availiable in all the area

Restaurant(!!!!!):
-	Just 500ml plastic water bottles – so much waste, NEW ZEALAND butter and STRAWBERRY jam in small plasic containers, less homemade stuff
-	Restaurant disappointing vor vegans: We informed the hotel in prior that my wife is vegan, got info from Altamish that it is no problem – BUT: They all have no idea about vegan!!!
MEAT in VEGETARIAN sring rolls, no vegan soup availiable, staff not creative what they can do
-	Less local stuff availialbe: King coconut: just three pieces for all guests in one week, no hoppers, no rotis (when not on breakfast buffet), even one day no curd/lassi – it was end of high season, wouldnt complain when we were the only guests
-	The restaurant staff speaks very bad english, many missunderstandings (and waiting…) and they dont remember anything about food preferences, room number
-	When you go tot he buffet, the crows fly on your table and geht wat they can, other places have security with slingshots to avoid that (no craw did hurt!!!)

We tried to give the staff our feelings and feedback, but nobody did listen to us, they always wanted to inform somebody, but nothing changed. We would not stay there again – can reccomend the Uga bay, they have an amazing staff and really good food.
title: Beautiful hotel with bad restaurant and staff

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Suneth J,

Thank you for your review. I am happy that you enjoyed most elements of our resort. I hear your concerns about the food, we are surprised with your comment as most of the reviews here praise our culinary products and our chefs are very dedicated in producing their best. We will still take a look at our food and improve where necessary.
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Sun Aqua as the name denotes perfect place to enjoy the Sun and Aqua in Sri Lanka. This luxury hotel spreads around a huge property. By looking at the way they have placed their rooms it is evident they have given more concern to their guests privacy rather than cluttering rooms every inch. Architecturally, a beautiful hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean. The word luxury is fitting for the rooms. Beautiful infinity pool facing the lovely Passikudha beach is really a nice view.

Main let down hotel was the food. I would say the worst food we have ever had. The menu was terrible. Our holiday made miserable because of the food. We had to go to other hotels seeking food since we couldn't satisfy at all with their food. Very restricted menu.
title: Luxury Hotel with terrible food

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
I got the feeling, staying at this hotel, that the only goal is to make money. Of course, that's every business' goal, but some try to make the experience perfect for each and every client.

The good first: 

-Reception staff were very friendly and nice. 
-While the buffet was boring and unappetizing, the Ala Carte food was good.

Now all the issues:

-Pool was infested with boatman bugs. Thousands of them. These bugs eat algae, and that's the only reason they'd inhabit a pool. Water looked really murky at night by the pool lights.

-Pool is black. As a personal preference, I don't like that.

-Pool and beach deck chairs were very dirty and many were broken.

-The first frog we found in the closet was cute. My husband caught it in a laundry bag and chucked it outside. But the second one we found...it was just weird.

-Room hygiene was low, and the fixtures in the bathroom looked worn out. Some were rusty.

-Plunge pool in room with no filter on. Fine film of dirt at the top.

- Loud 70's and 80's music was blaring loudly from a disco-looking place down under the restaurant, and was very annoying during dinner. To be fair, upon complaining, the staff somehow put a stop to it.

-Maany members of taff poorly trained and do not speak English well.

- Due to all the above factors, especially the pool infestation, my family wanted to leave, as we didn't want to ruin our beach vacation. We explained the situation to the management in a very reasonable manner. They refused to refund the money, and insisted on offering us the Grand Pavillion, as it had its own, larger pool. The pool was filthy, and there were bugs in it too. We declined politely,  and asked for a refund of the remaining two nights. After much drama, and going back and forth with management in the Maldives, they agreed to refund 40% of the amount. A truly world class hotel would not allow guests to walk out unhappy, but they just did not care enough.. Being a world class hotel seems to take second place to making money.
title: Amateurs. Money comes first here.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear JGSinger,

Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience. I am deeply disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us. We will convene to a meeting to review your feedback with assignments mapped out to the relevant Department to improve on all the shortcomings.

Please accept my apologies and I will continue to reiterate in our various meetings the importance of delivering not only great customer service but also facilities.

Once again, I do appreciate that you took the time to give us a detailed feedback and if I can be of any assistance at all, please do reach out to me.

Yours Sincerely,
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get a beach suite with private plunge pool
text:
Hmmm, where do I start....

Good points first then all the bad ones:

Right on the beach. Caveat - disappointing beach, swimming normally difficult due to broken coral (a remanent from the Boxing Day tsunami, apparently) and while we visited Jellyfish everywhere. All up and down the East Coast.

Great pool. Warm, almost too warm. 

Really impressive design of main buildings, restaurant and rooms that were spread out with a very, very relaxed and spacious feel. 

Rooms were thoughtfully planned and super spacious. Really nicely done. Huge and I had a private plunge pool.

Food was actually really good. Solid effort by the chef.

The hotel provides accomodation for drivers. Well done.

Now for the bad news, and there was plenty:

I arrived at 6pm, 4 hours after check in time. I had beach suite.  The room was a storage shed ! Pillows pilled high everywhere, even in the SHOWER ! Ironing board and iron left on the bed. The outdoor table was inside with all the mouldy cushion stacked on top. Footprints over the remaining cushions. Towels strewn about.  Long hairs left all over the floor and bed. It was bad.

Totally unacceptable for any hotel let alone a 5 star resort. I expressed my unhappiness and was told i could wait 10 minutes for the room to 'be ready' ! I did mention it was already 6pm, right ???!!! 

I refused and demanded a new room. On the 3rd attempt after threatening to leave for another hotel, my request was granted. The excuse was, 'oh sorry. It seems the room wasnt prepared in time and must have been a mistake' ! No kidding....

Moved to the next room. Beautiful room it was too. BUT - the airconditioner was broken (needed to be fixed 3 times), the plunge pool filter continued to breakdown constantly until fixed the 3rd time. The electricity didnt work, so no lights. This required 2 efforts to remedy. There was mould over the sofa and cushions. The cupboard light didnt work. There was hair on the floor snd in the bed, again. 

They forgot to provide towels in the room, too.

The toilet leaked from the bottom all over the toilet floor. I slipped once and fell into the glass wall... lucky i didnt slice myself to death. The worst part was that the toilet leaked when flushed... you can guess what that means, right?????.... !!!

2 further attempts and a patch-up glue gun attempt failed to fix this for my entire stay. So, instead i just put a mat down and had it changed each day.... gross.

An ant infestation needed 2 attempts and a spraying campaign to irradicate - well almost.... It would have helped if housekeeping didnt eat and leave dropped food in the room !!!

Several, and i mean multiple, frustrating attempts to have everything at least satisfactorily remedied by the stand-in Manager came to nothing until the last night.

He didnt seem to understand and really didnt make any effort, apart from parading the house-keeping staff and Housekeeping manager before me to apologise, consistently.

I became very accustomed to the fix-it guy in my room.....

After all this, they even had the audascity to charge me for 2 extra bottles of water !

The only thing that was offered was a birthday cake (for breakfast) and they didnt charge me for 2 glasses of wine.

The staff left the previous evenings glasses, plates and leftovers out overnight by the pool until the next morning meaning the crows had a great time! Pretty unsightly at breakfast.

There were a few issues but i think you get the picture.

Overall, VERY disappointing to what could be a great hotel. Until the service is rectified, I would NOT recommend this hotel/resort. What a great pity.....
title: Could be awesome, yet...... Read the whole review

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Bertie C,

Thank you for posting your review of Sun Aqua Pasikuda. I am obviously disappointed that under my watch, the Team failed to deliver. We take every single feedback very seriously and will work hard to ensure that we improve our performance. 

Once again, we are terribly sorry to have let you down and I do agree that you can only rate accordingly as such if you do want to stay with us again, please do let us know - we would be pleased to see to your booking.

Sincerely yours

S.Sivanesan

Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Yes Sun Aqua,Trust is a luxurious resort ,but fails in a few points.

Check in super quick.

Rooms very,very large, with semi outdoor monster bathroom. ( private sunbathing ) possible by the half completely open roof,a nice touch..

Food only average, and below par for such a resort . Breakfast buffet poor, Egg Station ,could do with 2 people  frying in peak times ,( no Hoppers) additional toaster would be most welcomed speeding  things up .

Room service very wired  They come to your room with a I Pad to make your choice, so you sit under pressure from room service man trying to decide , this should be scrapped and replaced with written menus or hooked up to Internet ,so guest can browse at thier leisure.

Location fine ,good grounds and little beach

Prices are FAR to expensive ( more than European ) 700 rupees plus tax for a bottle of beer is NOT acceptable, remember more profit is generated by higher volume sells,I would say 500 plus taxes is a fair price ,and would increase sells.

Newer saw pool side cafe/bar open in my 4 day stay ( April 29th _May 2nd) this is also totally unacceptable, I paid to use all facilities ,yet was denied,if facilities are reduced ,due to ' low season' IT should be clearly stated on web site .it amounts to selling under false pretence.

Staff were fantastic at all times .

This hotel really needs to ' knock it's heads together' and address it's Short comings,it IS  fabulous resort, but could really be number 1 with just much more planning and attention to small details ,like TVs not secure, mine fell over, easily addressed and at very little cost. The silly room service I Pads ,I am sure resulting in lost sells ,due to the pressure of staff hovering over you, when you really want to browse and choose .

I will not return until I am certain that hotel is making it to be ' number 1" 

But my review is my personal thoughts,and I will say again THIS a top resort .
title: Dissapointed.

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take another Hotel
text:
We stayed three nights at this hotel at a Ocean Suite with pool and had this hotel picked for the last few nights before flying back home. Pasikudah is really calm and peacful, perfect to relax. Unfortunately the hotel is built at a part of the beach, where the beach itsself is full of corals and so you can not actually swimm in the sea.

Overall the sourrounding is quite nice but, there is lots of room for improvement as we had some events, adding some negative flavor to our overall experience:

One one day, the filter system at our pool in the didn't work. We reported it before going to breakfast in the morning. I went back to the room at noon, it still wasn't fixed (whereas roomservice had cleand the room in the meantime) I called a second time and when I came back late afternoon, it still wasn't fixed. So this time I went to report slightely annoyed to the front desk. The manager came with me, checked out the pool and also noticed, it was full of leaves. after about 5 minutes someone came to fix it (which took about 20mins). By now the sun had set and there was honestly no more use for the pool. The manager obviously realized that I was quite annoyed but did not seem very much interested in improving tmy mood. 

=> For the Hotel: Next time, you might offer at least a few drinks or something for the inconveninance. 

On another day we had booked 2 treatments at 2 different times. When I showed up for my treatment, I was asked where my company was. When I answered, that her treatment was booked for another time, the said I was wrong and it would not be possible to do it at another time, as it was all booked. 
(As a sidenote: next to us, there were about 7 other rooms occupied....)

Breakfast and Dinner:
I ram no fan of monotonous hotel easy listening tunes played in lobby, dining room at the bar, at the gym, everwhere. 
Problem at Sun Aqua was: They kept playing one song in an endless loop on and on, and you could even hear it at the beautiful infinity pool. So on the morning of the second day I asked them if they could change it. Guess what happened: They playe ONE other song in endless rotation....

Conclusion: 
A luxury hotel does not only life by a nice bulding and a good location. It is mostly gets it "Luxury" reputation from it's quality of service and making the impossible possible at any time. This is by no means what they acheive today.
title: Lot of potential to improve

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Lakmin S, 

Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback on your stay at the resort. We consider guest’s feedback very valuable as we are committed to providing the best in facilities and service and will take all necessary measures to ensure the standards are upheld to meet the guest’s expectations.

Please accept our humble apologies if your experience fell short of expectation. We were quite taken aback to learn of your experience, as our staff members take their roles very seriously and try, every day, to provide the quality customer service that our guests expect.

I believe it is important to do a detailed enquiry into all the issues you have raised as we wish to rectify the problems, if any, and ensure our service quality and brand value is upheld at all times. If you would be kind enough to please reach out to me directly at ibrahim.rasheed@sunaqua.com with further information on your name and period of stay, I would be able to take a closer look at the events that occurred. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Ibrahim Rasheed

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Based purely on great reviews on Trip Advisor, I booked 2 night at Sun Aqua last July. After a rather tiring drive from Colombo we arrived at the Hotel just in time for dinner. The 1st impression of the property was fantastic. The room, although away from the beach was one of the largest, best laid out and comfortable we have had stayed in a long long time. However the looks were deceiving.

There was a used bath robe in the closet. When complained about it, the answer of the most obliging front desk bloke was that the house keeping manager was on vacation hence the short coming. Strike 1

Went to the dinner buffet. An absolute shocker. I have never seen such a poor selection in any hotel let alone a ‘Star Class.. Add to the miserly selection, the food was tasteless. We immediately complained and had the executive chef at our table in no time. He wasn’t much of a talker. Frankly I don’t think we had any meaningful exchange of ideas and if we did, he surely didn’t show it. So we headed to the front office and our friendly superstar knew exactly why we were there. Apparently we were the 3rd or the 4th complainant of the night. His excuse this  time beats them all. “The F&B manager and the GM were on holidays. So the quality of food was poor”. He assured me that the issue would be rectified but I did not have a meal from the hotel again. I had very decent food from a place if I remember right, called Nandams close by and a few other Star Resorts including Uga. Strike 2

The following day my wife needed to get a massage. However she could not pass on the idea ‘sheila’ at the desk. The language gap was way too wide. I am all for providing employment to the locals but with the right communication skills.  2.5

The rooms have a central control unit. Neither the hotel staff nor my family could get the bedside lights working for 2 days. 2.75

The bath tub is open to the elements from the top and was full of dust and a few dead leaves. I guess the house keepers absence was the reason for this. Strike 3
Apart from all that, it was good. Whether we will return next summer diving season…. I don’t think so. This could be one of incident brought about by the local Eid holidays. but I don’t to try my luck again. 

There are enough pretty good star resorts in the area. It’s a shame that such a lovely property is managed rather ordinarily.

One point of interest. The room floor is on split levels with a probably a meter between the two. With no real ‘barriers’ Not too sure how well this arrangement suits a child.
title: Big Dissapointment

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Very friendly but completely incompetent staff and inexisting service to such an extend that it finally became funny.
Beautifull pool with way more live animals inside than what you could see in the sea.
Due to the full lack of management, the brandy new installations already start to fall apart.
On the plus side: the food was excellent.

To summarize, the prestation is far from what should be provided by this kind of establishment even to low for a two star hotel.

Better go to Arugam bay with a better adapted laid back atmosphere. Don't go there.
title: Chose another option

placeInfo/address: 89 Upper Lake Road Havelock Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Find a different hotel.
text: I wouldn't call this a 4 star hotel. Very little outdoor space, just a few tables and chairsout thd front, no AC, no pool and a very limited buffet option for dinner and breakfast. The food wasn't evrn hot. The service was fine, but if simply wasn't up to scratch, 3 star at most.
title: A three star hotel masquerading as a four star

placeInfo/address: 89 Upper Lake Road Havelock Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Go elsewhere
text:
Worst food in a hotel in Sri Lanka

After reading reviews we were really looking forward to our stay.

We arrived around 2.30 pm to a warm welcome and a mini cup of delicious soup.

Our room was good number 101 next to reception. Not ideal when a really terrible band started around 7 pm and boomed through our room.

We had drinks in the lovely bar when we arrived and again before dinner.

Ok onto dinner. 
Where do I start.
After looking at the unappealing food on the buffet we asked if there were other food options. We were told we could buy different food but they could not tell us what food.

We decided to go for the buffet. 
Firstly the soup was tasteless. There was not a lot of salard left and what was was messed around and unappetising.

Onto the main. Three plates of stone cold food. When we said something a lighter was brought and the Bain Marie’s  were put on. Far to late.

Finally we asked for the restaurant manager. He really didn’t know how to handle the situation.

He asked if we had any requests. We asked what was on offer. Finally I ordered steak which was nice. The others could not be bothered after 30 minutes of messing around and trying so much cold food.

We had coffee which the lady asked us to pay for.

All in all the food was horrendous.
Don’t stay here for dinner there are so many lovely options.
title: Move on

placeInfo/address: 89 Upper Lake Road Havelock Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Il y a des hôtels avec une âme, des lieux où l'on voudrait s'éterniser....et puis il y a le Galway Heights. 
Comment vous dire ? Dès l'extérieur, on croirait une école où une mairie. Puis on entre dans un lobby d'une tristesse à pleurer. On vous accueille par une soupe au lieu du traditionnel cocktail et un employé à l'air revêche vous intime de le suivre pour une visite des lieux. Elle se fait à toute allure sans vous regarder ni vous attendre et lorsqu'on a le malheur de lui poser une question, il vous fait bien comprendre que ce n'est pas le moment ! Incroyable !
Mais le pire, c'est l'ambiance générale. Vieillotte et déprimante.  La moquette désuète dans les chambres, au secours !!! Le bar qui diffuse des tubes français d'avant guerre et les serveurs qui vous fixent pendant que vous buvez... La salle de restaurant sent le moisi et le buffet est atroce. Les serveurs holmes restent les mains dans les poches tandis que les 2 femmes font tout le boulot. Bref, cet hôtel est d'une tristesse terrible avec ses tables de jardin sur le parking et son ambiance antichambre d'ehpad...A fuir absolument si vous n'avez pas le moral..
title: La grande déprime

placeInfo/address: 89 Upper Lake Road Havelock Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Far more amateuristic than our previous stay 7 years back. No working WiFi in the rooms at 3rd floor forced us to use the phones on the corridor and the laptop in the restaurant, and that is not holidaying but suffering. Another major issue is the stairs from 1st to 2nd floor - due to the typical old building setup, one of the stairs is 3-4 cm higher than the rest making me to fall twice and hurt my knee.  A clear warning notice on the wall is the least they can do.
Rooms good and spacious, nice shower, and on request a free heater. Breakfast and dinner good in setup but lousy in execution; dishes brought in 5-10 mins later than for the rest of the party, half cold, in wrong sequence etc. No amount of good hospitality, and they do their utmost swarming you with offers to help, can compensate this. Send good maintenance staff for e.g. the WiFi design and re-train restaurant staff!
title: Sorry folks, unavailable WiFi is just one example of how much to go...

text:
Unfortunately my stay was not a pleasant one .
We had travelled hours and was hoping for a smooth check in but as the staff showed us to our room it wasn’t the room we had booked and paid for ..
So when we told them were moved late but they put us right at the top of the stair way .
During the night all we could here is noises like running taps , needless to say sleep was lacking .

First night we stayed there was absolutely no western food , all curries but had clearly advertised western food in there buffet .

Sound proofing was non existent, you can hear everything in the next room  plus this music played through speakers in the hallways that you could clearly hear in the rooms .
So if you want to come here to rest don’t bother , if you want quiet you won’t have it .
Do your research as it’s not worth the trouble .
Sorry I couldn’t recommend
title: Don’t bother

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Oakes,

Warmest greetings from Jetwing Vil Uyana.

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. Please allow me to express my deepest apologies for the distress caused during your stay due to the presence of bats in your room. I can only imagine how unsettling and disruptive this must have been for you. Your understanding and patience in allowing our team to address the matter mean so much to us, and I am truly sorry for the inconvenience you endured.

As a sanctuary that celebrates the harmony between nature and hospitality, our resort is surrounded by the breathtaking beauty of Sri Lanka’s wilderness. While this connection to nature is something we hold dear, I completely understand that encountering wildlife in such close proximity to your accommodations can be uncomfortable. I want to assure you that we are constantly striving to strike a better balance, and your feedback is invaluable in helping us refine our preventive measures.

I also want to personally apologize if my response during this situation did not meet your expectations. It was never my intention to downplay your experience, and I am deeply sorry if my words or actions caused additional distress. Please know that your comfort and satisfaction are at the heart of everything we do, and your comments are a reminder of the care and attentiveness every guest deserves.

Despite this unfortunate incident, I sincerely hope that you were able to find moments of peace and joy in the serene beauty and unique character of Jetwing Vil Uyana. We are incredibly grateful for your trust in choosing us and for sharing your thoughts so openly. It is my heartfelt hope that we will have the privilege of welcoming you back in the future for a stay that is not only restful but truly exceptional in every way.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Anthony Ferdinand
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text: This place should be paradise, and in many ways it is. Spectacular location, large rooms with character, good food, helpful staff - all positive. However, we were unlucky. One evening, returning to our room after dinner, we found bats flying around inside. Staff were helpful in removing them, but they soon found their way back in. Staff came three times to remove them and to try to block up where they were coming in - they were great - but I was still up at 3.30pm getting bats out of the room myself. Unfortunately, the hotel was fully booked and we could only change rooms the following day. I accept these things happen. What didn't impress me, however, was the attitude of the general manager, who showed virtually no sympathy and empathy. He made light of the matter, almost laughing it off. There was no gesture of goodwill, financial or otherwise. Having slept only two hours that night, we were obviously exhausted for the next few days and it took the edge off our trip. A hotel is only as good as its general manager - can't recommend.
title: Bats in our room all night - no understanding or sympathy from the general manager

placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
roomTip: Don,T stay here.
text:
This hotel is more style over substance. It was listed as first class by our travel agent.However it was not. The public rooms were smart and the swimming pool was very good. But the accommodation was dreadful. The first room we occupied a”garden dwelling” was situated  at the far end of the site, next to the generator plant which was so noisy it was impossible to sleep. The bathroom wall had a hole in it where a fitment seemed to have been ripped out. When we complained someone came and filled it in. It did however have a very pleasant sitting out area with sofas, coffee table, fan and outside light.
In order to travel any distance around the site buggies had to be summoned.
After complaining, we were upgraded to a “stilted dwelling “. This was in walking distance of the main building. The telephone did not work. It was one of the worst designed hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. The room was enormous. The bed was on a raised platform in the middle of the room. It had a bedside table on only one side (l used an inverted basket on the other). There was inadequate storage space . Outside seating was provided on a small balcony overlooking the lake. It contained a quite large table and two pouffes. These were not comfortable to sit on so we had to move chairs from the room outside. We enjoy sitting outside in the evening but there was no outside light to read by.
The food was “international” and amongst the worst we had in Sri Lanka.
..
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Warm greetings from the team at Jetwing Vil Uyana!

Thank you for taking your valuable time to provide us with feedback following your recent stay and for recommending us to followers on other media platforms.

As explained, the initial dwelling shown to you was in fact a water dwelling, albeit situated very close to a potential nesting ground for otters. Hence, during this period, we opted not to disturb the surrounding area, allowing the otters to calmly reside in their new home, which also gave our naturalist the opportunity to study their behaviour over a few weeks since Jetwing Vil Uyana is more than an eco-luxury hotel; it is also a conservation site for animals such as the Grey Slender Loris. I truly apologise once again for the time taken to allocate another water villa of your preference and hope you grant us the opportunity to serve you better on your next visit.

We thank you for your kind sentiments about the friendly and helpful associates, the luxuriously cosy room with a bathtub large enough for two, and the beautiful interiors of the water villa overlooking the lotus-strewn waters. We were thrilled to read your posts on Instagram shared during your stay with us, which positively highlighted the personalised service extended by the team, and certainly look forward to welcoming you in the not-too-distant future.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Anne Dias

placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We stayed at the jetwing vil uyana for 3 nights between Christmas and new year. Overall we had a relaxing stay with the hotel set in an incredible location amongst the wildlife. However does not have the 5 star edge due to a few things: 

- at checkout they try and do a fx arbitrage on you , their guest, because they charge you in rupees then convert your bill into USD at a slightly off-market rate, so on our bill it was around 40usd extra in USD terms using their “exchange rate” vs the actual market rate you would pay if you paid on a card in rupees. Not a huge amount but why try and skim off your customers who are already paying a lot to be there

-non existent butler service: took almost one hour to receive one beer and one Bloody Mary so didn’t order anymore drinks. Sent back the Bloody Mary however they charged us for it at the end 

- food is prepared for the western taste, which is fine. However we specifically asked for spicy curry which they could not provide. Manager was apologetic and the meal was comped. Ordered pasta for the rest of the stay. 

- they should have at least two staff at the spa as the masseuse cannot speak English and I had to interrupt her lunch when I came for my pre booked appointment. There was no refreshment towel, drink or health questionnaire to complete before the massage either - seemed like an amateur operation. Actually a very uninviting spa overall -  real 5 star hotels don’t have spas that amateur
title: Not the best…

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback following your stay with us.

Please accept our most sincere apologies for not being able to provide you with satisfactory stay. It is our constant endeavor to provide the finest of products and services to our guests in line with standards of Jetwing Hotels and so, we are deeply saddened to read that your stay was not as expected. Your feedback has been taken very seriously and necessary steps have been taken to rectify the issue with our meals in order to avoid such re-occurrences in the future. 
 
Nonetheless, we are grateful for your feedback and hope this will not deter you from giving us another opportunity serve you better in the future
 

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Kingsley Paul
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
The food was horrible.  Just plain horrible.  Not what I would expect having dished out almost 40k a night.  Having stayed at Vil Uyana before, my expectations were sky high going in for my honeymoon.  The staff as usual was amazing and really attentive.  However, maybe due to Covid-19 situation, the food was terrible.  Morning breakfast was lame and boring...  not a single pastry item ( as opposed to the massive variety of baked goods otherwise expected at a Jetwing Hotel)... and whatever food that did exist lacked soul and falvor.

Saving grace of this entire stay was our buttler Gamini, who did go out of his way to make our stay comfortable. In fact all the staff were really nice and attentive.  

Jetwing, get your act together... this is dissapointing!
title: A Dissapointing Experience in Otherwise a Great Hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for bringing to our attention the issues you faced during your stay with us. 

Though we did address and discussed some of your concerns while you were staying at the property, please allow us to explain some of those concerns in more details, to ensure fellow TripAdvisor reviewers and potential travelers are well informed of what actually happened, the actions we took to rectify it and what we offered as compensation for the unpleasant experience.

Whilst we sincerely regret the issue you experienced with regards to the door lock initially, you will certainly recall that the matter was addressed on the same day as you reported it, with no additional request subsequently from your end to attend to such matter. 

As you mentioned in your review, and as per the conversation you had with the hotel team and General Manager, it is correct that we had an issue with one of the security officers we contracted with. We did share with you the steps taken, namely that the person was identified and terminated immediately, and that we are in the process of employing our own Jetwing security personnel for the property. 

We were certainly very concerned by the incident and the team and the hotel General Manager were there to reassure you and explain the measures taken. We trust that you appreciated our gesture of goodwill, for the inconvenience you faced, of refunding your entire stay for the 2 nights you stayed at our property.

Let us thank you for bringing to our attention some other issues you faced as well and rest assured that we are attending to each of them, especially the ones related to maintenance.

Again thank you for your constructive feedback and wishing you all the best for your future travels!

Ayubowan! (May you live long)

Kingsley Paul
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
The Jetwing Vil Uyana looked nice when we first arrived, but we quickly found many problems in our “water villa” (number 112). However, all those issues were eclipsed by a near tragedy our second, and last, night on the property.

One of the problems with our villa was a temperamental door lock that would pop open when we thought it was set. We told staff about it the first night, and again the next day—and they must have wrestled with it every time they left the room. But they did nothing to fix it. I was able to figure out how to manipulate the lock each time we went out so that we could leave the room without worrying, but there was no way to make it lock securely from the inside, except to use the chain higher up on the door. Thank god we did that night!

Sometime around 2AM a loud click woke me up; it sounded like it came from inside the room. But I didn’t hear anything else, and guessed it was an animal outside, or maybe the bat that lived in the villa (!)

The next morning, when we left for breakfast, we found a trail of dirty barefoot-prints crossing the entry to the villa and heading up the stairs to our door (see pic). With a shock we realized that the sound I’d heard was someone trying to break in and rob us, or worse. They must have been spooked when the bad lock clicked open, or were foiled by the chain.

Clearly this was an inside job, involving a staff person who knew about the funky lock. 

The manager on duty was concerned, but all he could muster was “sorry for the inconvenience.” An understatement in my opinion, given how close we’d come to a very bad outcome.

Two days later I got a call from the GM, who had been in Colombo at the time. He was very apologetic, and seemed genuinely horrified about what had happened. That made me feel better. He also offered to refund our stay, displaying some professionalism. But I still feel that I need to warn others about the lax security at the property, and the fact that at least one of the staff is a criminal. 

In the week since that experience, I still find myself waking up at night, spooked by any sound. Jetwing destroyed my peace of mind.

Other, but in retrospect less serious, problems with the villa included a lack of privacy whenever the curtains were not drawn over the floor-to-ceiling deck windows (112 faces an interior road and every time someone walks by, they have an unobstructed view into the room—very bad design!); the run-down appearance of the walls and floors in some spots; dysfunctional wi-fi when we first checked into the room (fixed a few hours later); rough, old towels (they should be higher quality at a hotel in this price range) and an adequate, but not exceptional, breakfast. Both nights we ate outside the hotel, so we can’t comment on the restaurant for lunch of dinner.

This was our first experience with Jetwing hotels (a chain of high-priced properties in SL). It’ll definitely be our last.
title: Attempted break-in while we slept!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for visiting our resort and for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. Kindly accept our sincerest apologies for having disappointed you during your recent stay. 

I hope you could give us another opportunity to rectify this experience for you and possibly regain your trust in our hotel. Please feel free to contact me directly (kingsley@jetwinghotels.com) for any assistance you may require in future. 

On behalf of the entire team, I would like to thank you once again for your kind patronage. 

Ayubowan (May you live long)

Kingsley Paul
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
roomTip: Avoid the room overlooking the sewage treatment plant
text:
We chose the resort because of the quiet location, nice setting & proximity to Sigiriya rock but rather disappointed as it did not live up to expectations.

- Booked the cheapest category room, when shown to room 145, could not believe it's only 5m away from the resort sewage treatment plant. If sitting outdoor which we were planning to then had to look at the ugly sight as well as the constant noise and unpleasant smell. When requested to move we were told the hotel was full so we asked if we could have the money back and got on to the travel agent to inform and also requested for alternative resort. It was only then that the manager said that he managed to shuffle guests around and upgraded us to a higher category room. We were grateful for his help but why waited until we were about to check out, not to mention how the hotel thought that they could get away with putting guests in that room when it’s not cheap!

- The villa was split over 2 levels with a private pool. While the villa was really nice and big, the views from the balconies  over the bush were OK not that special.

- Saw 3 loris within 30 minutes, were given a red light to wear on the forehead in order to spot and see loris. My strap was so smelly from sweat. The straps should have been washed after each use for hygiene reasons.

- Had a cooking class with the executive chef and it was good fun. Could get most ingredients back in Australia so certainly would give it a go. Thoroughly enjoyed the curry dishes cooked by us for lunch.

- Had half board dinner of 6 courses & it was excellent food but too much for us. The best meals in Sri Lanka for almost 2 weeks. Tasty and delicious food without being fussy. The executive chef and all his staff remembered my dietary requirements and catered accordingly without prompting. He even made a VietNamese salad for me after discussing Vietnamese cuisine during the cooking class. I felt very special. The chef went around and talked to a lot of guests every night. Really good PR!

- Service was good in general but not excellent and lacking the warmth & personal touches compared to some smaller hotels that we had been on the trip, however, we were very impressed with the GM who was always in the lobby to greet guests & made an effort to walk around talking to guests at meal time.

- When checked out it took reception staff 4 attempts to get the bill right. This was not acceptable!

It would have been a really nice resort & pleasant stay without the aforementioned issues.
title: It’s rather disappointing!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to post a review and bringing to our attention the many difficulties you faced during your stay. We regret not being able to meet your expectations in terms of the design of our hotel which is otherwise highlighted as unique by our other guests. The steps to the toilet have sensor lights that switch on when our guests need to use the bathroom which avoids any accidents or disturbances. We prefer placing the tea-coffee making facilities in the bedroom as opposed to the bathroom where the basin is. 

Our main restaurant opens from 6.30am to 10.00am for breakfast, 12.00pm to 3.00pm for lunch and 7.30pm to 10.30pm for dinner. However Sulang cafe which is located downstairs around the pool and the library, serves snacks and beverages any time of the day. We also have 24/7 room service and have placed room service menus in every room.  

We think you'd be interested to know our commitment to sustainability is broad and is not limited to room amenities. Do follow the this link for more information http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingviluyana/sustainability/

While thanking you for your review we wish you all the best for your future travels!

Ayubowan! (May you live long)

Kingsley Paul 
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text: This a a very odd hotel and in my view the room ( well, ours at least) was very poorly designed which made for less than optimum experience.  Once in the room, you need to go up about six steps to the bed area and then to get to the toilet/shower area - down two very steep steps.  Yet the land doesn’t change like that.  I felt all the time that it was an accident waiting to happen especially in the middle of the night when you want to use the toilet.  The tea/coffee making facilities are as far from the basin (for emptying water or washing cups) as they could be and with two small bottles of water supplied, you are likely to need to ring to ask for more pretty quickly.  Their approach to sustainability is excellent but in this case, that means tiny glass bottles of product in the shower and wasting lots of water while you try and unscrew the lid and actually get the product  out.   It also means huge towels that must require extra water, power and product to wash and dry.  The light switches just don’t make sense and there are no extra power points for the technology charging you need these days.  The fan and air conditioning are placed over the bed and over the mosquito net so on a hot night, you can have the noisy air conditioner on but no mosquito net.  The restaurant ( also up a very steep staircase) is disappointing - it doesn’t open until 7:30 pm which is very late after a long, hot,  day exploring, the food is expensive and the staff were not welcoming.  It gets very busy as soon as it opens so the wait for service is lengthy.  Power and wifi are intermittent which is frustrating but that may not be the hotel’s fault as the generator cuts in quickly.  On the plus side - the shower is great with good hot water supply, the breakfast is excellent and the bed was comfortable.  I would not be a repeat customer here.
title: Major design issues impact comfort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to post a review on TripAdvisor following your stay. We are greatly disturbed after reading your review as such comments are seldom heard and your review has our fullest attention. I really appreciate if you could write to me in detail regarding every aspect we failed you, especially in terms of service. Please do email me direct at kingsley@jetwiinghotels.com. 

However we would like to point out that our property is not merely hyped up as eco-friendly. It is built on a man-made wetland reserve. The setting you just commented as beautiful was completely created by us as these lands were barren land before. The lake too was man-made. Our inspiration was the Barnes Wetland Center in London. Today, these lands have become a sanctuary to over 125 bird species and many elusive creatures such as the Grey slender loris, the fishing cat and Eurasian otter. Crocodiles too have found residence in our lakes. We have the only loris conservation site in Asia and our property was designed by Sri Lanka's leading environmental designer - Sunela Jayawardane. 

For now, please accept our most humble apology for any inconvenience caused and I look forward to hearing from you. 

Ayubowan (May you live long)

Kingsley Paul
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
roomTip: forget it and stay some where more comfortable for the same price.
text: This is hyped to be a eco friendly.In my opinion it is just an excuse for a shabby run down villas. They are grubby, worn and very poorly appointed. The setting is beautiful and views stunning. But accomodation quality is important. and extremely poor Staff are not well trained and not at all helpful at all. Waste of money!
