placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
So I reached the Jetwing head office one day to book a vacation for my dad s birthday celebration where I had Vil Uyana in mind. My dad has recovered from a paralysis so has issues with steps. Hense i specially asked this lady about stairs in the rooms and hotel where she told me that only the restaurant had stairs and they would arrange meals downstairs for me. 

Then I reached the hotel and had the shock of my life. The forrest villa i booked had two levels where the bed room is only accessible with stairs. So my dad had to keep going up and down to have a bath or go to the pool. Also for each meal he had to do the same. It was a disaster and was a very bad start to the vacation. They offered to change the villa with supposed to be a lower amount of steps which also was equally bad. Hense throughout the holiday my dad was continuously struggling with regards to access.

But I should say the staff at the hotel did there best to handle the mess created by the head office. This review is not because of lack of service or quality at the resort but simply because of misguiding and cheating guests by the head office reservation staff.
title: Disaster from "mis"information

placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We stayed in the Forest Villa, two adults, two teenagers, in what was supposed to be a two story villa that sleeps 4.  We had stayed the previous night in the Water Garden, which was a beautiful two story villa with living room, pool etc.  We arrived at 7pm, in the rain, and waited 20 mins for a shuttle from a sandy car park that is the entrance.  Then after the usual long check in, we were asked to do a 'tour' of the facilities, including a wine cellar where added cost 'private dining' is offered, with a low entry way where I banged my head pretty hard (no padding or warning signs - and I am only 5'3"). 

Finally we were driven in a golf cart through the sand to the villa.  The bottom floor turned out to be one huge Stalinist concrete bathroom, with no doors on the toilet or shower, a huge hole in the roof, a mosquito breeding pond and a sand pit.  No living room, and one concrete couch.  There was only one bedroom (the only place with a door and ac), and they charged us for mattresses on the floor for the kids.  The concrete steps were slippery. The mosquito net was hung so that it did not protect the sleepers.  Terrible and not appropriate for a family.  I was in tears at that point from the bang on the head and the waste of $600.

We had paid for the half board dinner, which was very average.  I didn't eat most of it.  Dessert was the best part.  They also charged a lot for bottled water, which is annoying.  I noticed during the breakfast, free drinking water was served.  

During dinner the manager did come over and offer us a separate room for the kids.  At that point I was ready to just get back to the camp site and leave as soon as possible in the morning, but we checked out the room anyway and took them up on the offer.  The rooms were average but seem a much better deal than the villas, although the little pool was nice (but no more than 4 foot deep).

Overall I would not recommend this place.  Stay at the Water Garden.  Its the same price and 100% better.  There is just as much cool wildlife at the Water Garden and the facilities and food are much better.
title: Beware - villas have no toilet doors and concrete couches

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review following your stay with us. Please accept our sincerest apologies for the inconveniences caused during the stay. 

As you may recall, it was a night of bad weather with heavy rains and winds, because of which our team of associates may have been pre-occupied with safeguarding the property and ensuring the safety of our guests. And so, we might not have been able to give you the personal attention we are usually praised upon and the Loris trail was also canceled with your safety in mind. 

Since this was an exceptional situation, we hope you will give us another opportunity to show the true hospitality offered at Jetwing Vil Uyana. We would be more than happy to welcome you and your loved ones for a memorable stay sometime in the future. 

Ayubowan! (May you live long)

Kingsley Paul
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
Terrible service for the price they're charging. When we arrived via car, it was pouring, and the staff at the pavilion just stood inside with an umbrella but did not even bother to help when we got out of the car. We waited for 10 minutes before our buggy arrived (during which we became easy targets for mosquitoes), the same staff did once again stayed put inside the pavilion when we had to move our luggages into the buggy. 

Food was not bad but service was slow. Our mosquito net wasn't put in place after housekeeping (it was when we first arrived). The slender loris tour was cancelled because it was raining, and on asking what happens if it stops raining later, they said the path will be muddy so it will still be cancelled. Overall was a lazy vibe coming from the staff. No one seems to take their jobs at the hotel very seriously. Hardware wise it's a 4 star hotel. Service wise it's barely a 3. Shame
title: Lazy staff. Poor service

ownerResponse/text: This isn't a version of events we recognise.  We do not tolerate bullying or rudeness to staff and management and threatening a negative Tripadvisor review clearly demonstrates they had another agenda.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
What a magical place! If you are a lover of antiques this is the place to be!

But......

If you are a lover of antiques, magic, ambience, service and a holiday to remember for ever, this is not a place to stay.  Well, you may have better luck to tick these boxes but I did not!

1) I found the room that had not been cleaned to a standard of a 5* property let alone a 3*. Cobwebs, dust, insects (dead), ants in the rooms.  These faux pas noted within 5 minutes of walking into the rooms.
2) The bathroom was stocked with half used set of shampoo/bath wash. This was evidently leftover from the previous occupants of the room.
3) No turn down service. Guests were expected to arrange and open mosquito nets and remove the numerous pillows adorning the bed, because housekeeping is not available after a certain hour. We arrived at 8pm because we drove from Colombo airport to Wadduwa having  landed in the morning but decided to include a day trip to Negombo. Our late arrival was communicated in certain choice responses as an inconvenience. It was further mentioned that our annoyance at these remarks that we dont not have a sense of humour.
4) My wife has food intolerances that were communicated by the booking agent and we personally followed up and re-communicated the same to the kitchen staff at the Summer Breeze restaurant during our first night dinner, but during breakfast the next morning these instructions, whilst noted the night before, were not adhered to during breakfast. When this was pointed out this little mistake was denied even though it was physically evident on the plate of food.
5) These issues were communicated to the management and person(s) who know who they are but they were again in total denial until I decided enough is enough and I would rather check out and risk finding a lesser quality property for the rest of my stay. At this point it was agreed and an apology was offered this is not acceptable and that they had let us down regarding the cleanliness, dietary requirements and house keeping issues. But since it had to take my decision to cut short my stay to get the staff to realise they had let us down in the less than expected service, it was too late for my mind to be changed.

I am sure if you decide to stay at this property after reading my experience, I think you will find that your stay has been magic, as it should be because my experience has made the management realise they need to up their game 100 fold. I am sure you can make your own mind up.
title: Shame!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mark 

We have responded to your emails many times.

The cancellation policy isn’t incorrect.  
You made your booking in 2019 on a special offer for three nights, 18 months ago.
Only a partial amount of the deposit was paid.  Our normal deposit for this type of booking is 50%.
You changed the booking date of arrival several times and the number of rooms to which we agreed. 
18 months after making the booking you requested a refund.
We don’t offer deposit refunds on special offers, however we offered to extend your booking for up to 3 years.  This would have included your recent booking for 4 suites to stay in April 2022 which you cancelled again.  We consider we have been more than reasonable and extremely flexible, we are sorry you don’t agree.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: I am sure once there the experience would be excellent, but beware in these troubled times, the cancellation policy is incorrect, no refund has been offered only credit towards another holiday, once again I have asked for a refund now communication has ceased no response to emails at all, think twice before booking
title: Communication

ownerResponse/text:
I have no idea what you are referring to and I can only assume you have mistakenly chosen the wrong hotel to post your comments.

In an effort to understand your complaint I looked at your previous comments to other hotels and see you got married in a hotel in Sri Lanka in 2016 and you have just posted your comments in February 2020?  Over four years ago.

Therefore, I request you remove this review as it is nothing to do with us.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked a wedding and honeymoon with these people and suffered the worst customer service ever, so much so that we cancelled with them a week or so after booking (and around 10 months prior to the wedding). They were unbelievably rude and agreed to refund our deposit (as they couldn’t accommodate our - quite reasonable - requests), but then refused to refund over email.  

We’ve stayed in the best hotels and villas all over the world and have never experienced anything like it.  My suspicion is that that they are into their product far more than their guests.  

They’ll probably be ok, as long as everything goes their way.  It’s also interesting to see their responses to negative reviews ;-)
title: Faulty towers

ownerResponse/text:
We, of course, do not agree with a single word of your review.  You heaped mistruths for whatever reason.  I see little point in responding as you seem to have some odd agenda. 

It would be remiss of me not to mention that in conversation with our General Manager you told him you could remove the review in exchange for monetary compensation.

Readers can, of course, make up their own mind.

I am pleased you enjoyed your stay in all the other hotels.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: read revue and save you money and a good mood.
text:
I think you should read carefully and think twice before coming to the hotel. 
our first impression was an amazing hotel. it looked beautiful a lot of details and very stylish.
it was only a picture...
it's amazing how they ruin our first impression. on the same night, we came.
please keep in mind it is five stars hotel, which costs as 5 stars hotel, and:
(1) bathroom. there is no ventilation in the bathroom at all. only a ceiling fan, that kind using in Asia. So it was difficult to breathe, and it was a big question of sanitation as well;
(2) there was only one robe in the room for two people. and both slippers had a size of 38  only, while I have 43. very uncomfortable.
(3) restaurant. I was surprised they asking us to preorder the food before coming to the restaurant. but after we came to have dinner it was clear they are not cooking, they just bring the food from another place. food delivery service. they served it cold to us and the food quality was the second rate. even street food in Sri Lanka has a better taste. We ordered two glasses of different red wines. they brought it chilled... hmmm.. ok. I asked to bring another with a regular temperature. after the first drink, I reduced to drink more because it was very cheap in both glasses. To be a more clear glass of wine in this place costs around USD 10 and every meal costs us approximately USD 20. it was our 5th day on Sri Lanka and we had very delicious dinners in two other 5-star hotels for USD 30-50 for two persons including drinks.
(4) reception. it works up-to 10 pm as it is written onto the notice in our room. Does it suites to a 5-star hotel? I don't think so. By the way, after our check-in at 7.30 pm, I'd never seen anyone at the reception desk.
(5) bed. we were badly surprised there wasn't any blanked not only on the bad but in the room at all. while nobody at reception to ask to bring us one. the building was locked. I explored how to get out and found one person from the staff. He told me that they serve with a blanket only by request! but he promised me to find one. and it looks he exactly found it, he brought unfilled blanked which had the form of the crumpled ball.
(6) wifi. yes, it exists. but even situated in the main building you have only one stick.
(7) location. it locates in a very strange place it was hardly found by local drivers. it is rail-road right 3 meters opposite the hotel's gate. So, you can hear how rail-road sounds from time to time inside the hotel.

finally, we were very upset and decided to left this place the next morning in spite of we had a non-refundable rate.
title: Spoiled day of vacation at Reef Villa & Spa, Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We have booked two nights stay at Reef Villa based on a strong recommendation from my friend who had stayed there one year ago. We planned Reef Villa as our last stop in Sri Lanka with a very big expectation to have the best part at the last!
We are a family with two small kids and we arrived at place in the evening and right after checking in our room, we had our dinner in the restaurant. The food was so tasty as expected and we really hoped we were at the right place.
After dinner we went to our room and started to settle till i saw our baby's foot sole. It was shocking as the bottom of the feet of our kids who were exploring around the room were completely covered with dust! I removed my shoes and had few steps on the floor and could not believe how dirty and dusty my feet became! I checked the floor with my fingers and faced bunch of dust on my fingers! Unbelievable! Like the room was not cleaned for days!
I have called the front desk numbers in hotel with no response! Finally i could reach the security office on the phone and we were informed that nobody is available in the hotel! The house keeping is available only in the morning they said! Basically there was nobody left except the security guard in the hotel by about 10:30PM! We were desperate to stay in the dusty room for the night and felt completely uncomfortable!
In the morning the hotel manager came to our room and i showed him the situation and he apologized and he admitted that is not acceptable to have such condition and he has arranged the house keeping to deep clean our room. Of course from that moment onward we have already spent first half of our stay with big disappointment and regret for experiencing that bad night with much much higher price than any other much better hotel. 
The hotel rooms are uniquely large and really well decorated which feels like a luxurious palace room. However, the moment you feel the place is dirty makes everything else meaningless!
Anyway, we did not have anything to do but trying to enjoy our last day without bothering much and without any further expectation..
I should be fair to say the chef in the place is really amazing and every dish we had was really delicious. The restaurant staff and life guard Nihal was really kind and helpful, he helped a lot to take care of our baby while enjoying in the pool. We had a barbecue by the beach which was so nice.
Before leaving the hotel, we were given a guest book to sign by the restaurant staff and whatever happens, i wrote nice comments because they were really nice and kind. I would not find any point to leave a bad impression or comment for that book.
After leaving country though, i have shared my bad experience with the hotel owner and told how disappointed we were and i sent them the picture i took showing how dirty our foot became in the first night in dusty room. 
I have received a very rude and arrogant answer basically blaming me for being disrespectful. He mentioned maybe my foot was dirty before i arrived in hotel! He claimed that sending the picture of sole foot is upsetting the two muslim house keeping staff which i did not see any point for mentioning the religion of their house keeping staff for proof of anything! He extracted my comments from the guest book and said i was contradicting with my comments and he also claimed that since i haven't raise any complaint to him directly at hotel, it didn't seem i had that bad time.
So, basically i was blamed to be lying!
If you see the pictures of the place on their website, it is very green and beautiful lawn but, what you see in reality is a dried grass and unmaintained lawn! When i raised this, the owner said they are in need of rain and they cannot water the grass because they are an eco-friendly hotel and they don't want to waste the water. For an extremely overpriced hotel, that excuse doesn't sound any reasonable and realistic.
If you see the responses given to any negative comment on TripAdvisor from this hotel owner, you can understand how rude and arrogant he is. Basically he does not take any negative comment worth to be considered rather blames the reviewer.
There are much cheaper, very beautiful, clean and luxurious hotels (5 star hotel or villa) in Sri Lanka.. Think twice before wasting your money to book at this extremely overpriced place and to rude and arrogant owner.
title: A Total Disappointment

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
On May 30/2013 I arrived by Taxi at the gate of the very beautifully maintained Reef Villa and Spa. I was greeted by a kind SriLankan. 
Sadly from there on things went stunningly ugly! A European man came marching up demanding information about my ability to afford their establishment. He grudgingly allowed me to enter his domaine. His incredibly condisending attitude made me ill at ease. This manager/owner should not be in the hospitality business as he treated me with the utmost disdained. All my inquiries were met with defensive and arrogant replies.

I thanked him and I left.
title: Stunningly rude owner!

ownerResponse/text:
Uh Oh, the curse of the frustrated travel writer!

Actually, I have no idea how to respond to your review as you had not one single complaint while you stayed with us?

From your review it seems the costs were the main issue.

It would be worth reminding you that you booked several months before you stayed with us and you particularly wanted to stay over the New Year knowing the costs including the holiday supplement.  As you were fully aware, all our prices and menus are shown on our website.

We are a luxury property with first class service, and yes we make no excuse for being at the upper end in quality and in cost terms; we offer a fabulous private beach property, totally secluded with a fantastic seafood restaurant.

We are the only Conde Nast Johansens recommended property in Sri Lanka, for the past three years running.

It is particularly interesting to see you have made nearly one hundred “contributions” to Trip Advisor, which in itself speaks volumes.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ensure you do not book the suite which is right in front of the restaurant
text:
Since all the reviews were very good and there were not a lot of options left over for the New year's break we decided to book Reef Villas.

The resort is really nicely set up in lovely spacious gardens with fishponds everywhere (as well as mosquitos), dogs, ducks and iguanas are roaming around freely. All suites and common areas are decorated with a lot of attention to detail, you can see the owners put in a lot of effort. I prefer a more minimalist approach but that is very personal. It really was very beautifully decorated.
Our suite, Ketikaya, was spacious with a large four-poster bed and a separate bed including mosquito net for our son. The rooms are a bit dark though as the windows are kept fairly small and your terrace has a low roof therefore there is not a lot of light coming in which I do prefer when staying in a beach resort. We overlooked the pool directly plus the sea and was great so we were close to our suite and the pool as we are travelling with a child. However the suite next door was overlooking the restaurant......

The owners are very friendly and helpful as is the staff; they were all extremely friendly and outgoing. They kept bringing pieces of bread so our son could feed the fish, they were always smiling and greeting you.

There are a few cons though: One of the main ones is that the hotel is extremely high priced, I would say terrible overpriced actually for what you get.
1. Bathroom amenities - you receive mini bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body lotion, 2 of each and 2 pieces of soap. And they do not replace the bottles on a daily basis (we were with 3 so we did use quiet a lot). When paying 500++USD as well as 60++USD for our child you do expect good shower gel and the rest in large bottles which you can use freely instead of a bar of soap. Second, there were 3 towels on a daily basis, no evening replacement as hotels in this price segment do. Toilet paper did not get replaced as well and we had to phone twice to get a top up
2. Restaurant - you had to stick to the curries as they were really good, I loved the veggie curry, the chicken coconut and lime parcels, the cumin scented chicken. They came with dhal, chutney and pickles. All really good and I did look forward to dinner each night. They make you indeed pre-order as they mention they can start marinating etc. Normally we ordered around 6pm so that was alright.
But if you order western food......the quality was horrible. I had a chicken wrap for lunch and the filling was dripping with mayonnaise, I was actually nauseous the rest of the day after consuming it. And they charge around 19USD for a chicken wrap which I find extremely expensive. Since they have the only decent restaurant in the vicinity, there is no other choice than to pay but being a Sri Lank and paying more than I ever did for a wrap in Singapore (which is one of the most expensive countries in Asia, does not feel right. 
Breakfast was very basic - some fruits and fruit juice, eggs in different styles but every day the order with the side dishes went wrong. everyday |I had to ask again for strawberry jam as the prefer to give pineapple and marmalade. Jam was of super mart quality. Sri Lankan omelet was actually quiet nice but I can't eat eggs every day so I was stuck to toast or cornflakes. Again for these prices I do expect at least a basket with pastries, decent jams and more choices of breakfast. And for the 500++ USD cappuccino's were not included in the breakfast but charged separately for 4.5USD
3. New Year's dinner - as per usual, we had to pay for new year's dinner as it is mandatory which is okay. However we had to pay for our 5year old as well and he is asleep by 8pm, dinner only starting at 8.30pm.....which meant we paid 87++ USD for literally nothing. This began to feel like we are seen as some kind of money tree, just ensuring you get as much dollars as possible from your guests.
Dinner was set up in the garden with fairy lights and coconut torches, really extremely nice. There were fireworks afterwards. They could have left the Kandyan dancers out as they were hopping around for about 1 hour, doing some bad singing or having some music coming from the loudspeakers which hurt the ears. The food again was of horrible quality: I ordered my steak medium and it was served rare. Even when returning it to the kitchen it did not become medium and I did not eat half of it. My husbands steak had the same problem but since he is less picky, he ate it. The manager came to our table afterwards and offered us another dish but after half finishing it, I did not feel like getting another main course (I would have suggested they offered us a free main course the next day) Also since they had our pre-order wrong twice (why have us choose if you serve something completely different). we started with a smoked salmon parcel (welcome back to the eighties) which I did not eat since the sauce was the famous mayo again. Then I had pasta however was served a quail package. Needless to say I returned the package and received my dish after my husband finished his quail. What's the point of eating together, right....
The sorbet in between was actually nice. As dessert I had the Sri Lankan dessert which they also served to my husband who order the other dish.....Interesting cake and quiet nice but the vanilla ice-cream did not taste like vanilla at all. Dinner was finished with coffee (filter) or tea and some chocolates. For the 175USD++ we did not even receive a glass of champagne at 12 o'clock......
4. Service - the staff was extremely helpful but slow as snails - everything you asked for took easily 20-30 minutes, extra towels and shampoo around bed time, cappuccino in the morning, breakfast. It was as if they have no idea what they are doing and what service is all about. Asking when they should come by to do the turn down service (6.30pm) and then me having to call them two days in a row at 7.45pm if they could do it now since our son is going to sleep. Asking for extra towels, phoning twice and by the time they arrived 1 hour later everyone was showered. Asking when they should pick up the suitcases, we said in 5 minutes and then 20 minutes later it has still not happened
5. Check out - the most inexperienced staff member managed our check out and made a mistake in the invoice so we had to pay the commision seperately but the cc machine was not working anymore. If there is one thing you should have your most experienced person manage, it is check out. After going through this whole process, our bags were still in our room and they needed to find someone to go and pick them up
6. seating arrangements at the restaurant are managed on an interesting basis: last one to arrive at the resort gets the table in the middle of the restaurant. The other 6 are all aligned along the wooden railing and enjoy a view of the gardens/sea/pool, except for that one table. And because the roof is overhanging and low, you are really tucked away in the 'dark'. We were in luck since another family was leaving the next day and we got their table for the rest of our stay. So even when people are not there for breakfast or dinner, the table cannot be used.

To end on a positive note: the garden is right on the beach together with the infinity pool, they look impeccable with beautiful hammocks. However the ocean is not really swimmable because of the strong currents, also not when you are in season, there are strong waves and there is a very strong surf. People do indeed go into the sea and jump into the waves but it is only possible for good swimmers. Beach is endless and golden but there is a lot of dirt on the beach (not in front of the hotel as the hotel cleans it every day)  but when you go for a stroll you come across all kinds of stuff as it is all public. There are also cows, dogs and some pigs roaming around which I found very cute.
Wadduwa itself has nothing besides some cheap hotels and a super mart. No need to stay there for the village, restaurants or the facilities. 
The hotel offers excursions however they are again very expensive and wadduwa is quiet far from all the touristic places and traffic is very slow in Sri Lanka as they only have 1 highway. Using the highway it will take you you 1.5 to 2 hours to get to Galle.

Good thing, the hotel had wifi in the room and restaurant!

I think it is a lovely place but unfortunately it is not run as a high end accomodation.
title: Terribly overpriced and no high end service

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Preguntad sobre las tasas que se aplican en las facturas.
text:
Una pena que un sitio tan bonito no ponga sus precios reales en la carta y provoque equívocos desagradables. Cenamos allí y cuál no sería nuestra sorpresa cuando al llegar la cuenta el precio se había incrementado en más de un 30%.
Los precios en la carta no incluyen las tasas ni el servicio, con lo que el cliente no sabe el precio final de lo que está consumiendo hasta que no se paga. Una experiencia agridulce.
title: Experiencia desagradable: Los precios no son los que marca la carta.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Came for dinner probably the most inviting venue we found. Looks good from the out I but the food was very mixed. In my two weeks here this was without a doubt my worst meal. I'd ordered the grilled  octopus and it came out cold and very disappointing.
title: Looks good on the outside but did poor

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: if u have a lot of money go here! Otherwise go somewere up the street to the beautiful small restaurants
text: Really bad experience… we sat down for two beers got them after 20 minutes and enjoying it!! After the beers we asked for the bill. That took about 15 minutes nothing to worry about.. but when we got the bill HOLY **** two beers were 3000 roupies….. on the menu the beers were 1200 a piece but the service cost were 25 precent!!! NEVER VISIT THIS PLACE!!!!!!
title: BADDEST PLACE OF FORT GALLE

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t come here.
text:
The hotel looks really nice and is located very well. However there is no pool, no spa, and very unfriendly staff. The food is average but heavily overpriced. Especially they are adding tons of fees which weren’t added at any other hotel we have been in sri lanka like 25% government tax, 10% service fee. 
The wifi is really bad.

The staff always gives the impression that you are annoying them and you habe to wait ages for everything.

Overall I wouldn’t recommend this place at all. There is much better places for the money.
title: Looks nice, but everything else is bad.

Thank you very much for taking the time to share your candid review with us and please accept our sincere apology for below par experience with us. This is not the service standard we are thrive to achieve we will take every step to avoid similar occurrences in the future. placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We visited the 1710 cafe/restaurant and I've never seen such sullen and unfriendly staff. Not a smile from any of them. They had no interest in serving us, were not bothered when we asked where our order was as we had been waiting over half an hour and didn't even have a drink. No apology and no idea how to treat customers.
title: Dreadful. Go somewhere else.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Be very vary. The high Trip advisor ratings apparentlyseem to be "managed" through false reviews. The hotel is charecterised by poor and highly unprofessional  management especially its on-site GM Chamika. The owners and senior management are also not bothered about guest conveniences.

Be prepared to be locked out of your room for hours with nobody to give you your keys back. Other than this hotel , we have never seen a reception in any hotel that is unmanned for over an hour and you are locked out with no remorse on the part of the hotel for such issues. Also  be prepared for late check ins that are well beyond the official check in time - in fact do not be surprised if the hotel has allowed previous guests to stay on in your allocated room well into your check in time even in these Pandemic days. Their solution to such inconveniences and approach is to try and offer you a small discount and a meal to make up for their mistake. 
 
Strongly recommend exploring alternate hotels as this a a clear avoid if you are looking for quality service and professional hotel management.
title: Poor and unprofessional management

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
On monday restaurant full but no one was eating, after 20 minutes l realize most of the customers was leaving because tired waiting the order.
No one in charge for the welcome, no covid safety (gel, a customer register), we found a table, but no one clean from previous customers. Waited half hour for the order, another half hour for get the first plate  (but can't start because no one prepared fork and spoon), Than they informed us calamari not available so need change order. At the end after 90 minutes can start the dinner in a dirty table. Quality of the food at this stage was not important, want only finish and leave. 
My advice: Can't flood a restaurant with tables if are not able to follow all the customers plus need some basic training before run a restaurant, it is not a family restaurant or a basic restaurant so the workers must be trained and well organized
title: Lack of managment

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: I might seem like such a nag but wanted to put down my experience here because we were disappointed about this property. First of all, since Lighthouse and Kurulubedda have the same telephone operating system, we got wrong information over the phone but this mistake is partially from our end too, as we should have made things more clear but we didn't expect both properties to have the same system. So, we reserved a room via phone call and went there to find out the booking was not made there, instead made at Lighthouse. Thankfully, there were rooms available - the regular room and room with the plunge pool. We went with the plunge pool, since it was less than half the price of what was said to us on the call. My first impression of the room was that it was nice but the toilet seat was filthy - it was completely discoloured and should have been changed ages ago. The A/C took forever to cool and the manager told us to give the A/C 45 minutes for it to do its job, which seemed like a complete joke at the time. But even 45 minutes later, it was not cool but some mode changes on the remote seemed to do the trick. The main pool was one of the filthiest pools I've ever come across, with so many flowers and leaves floating and tiles that were not maintained whatsoever. Next, the light in the plunge pool and in the plunge pool area didn't function properly and it was way too dark for us to enjoy it for the intended time period. When it was time to check out, we needed to switch on the flashlight to look for something that had fallen and guess what, the area behind the TV cabinet was extremely dusty. The TV was also placed at an extremely strange angle as the mosquito net was blocking our view and had to be moved awkwardly to watch TV. The rooms are not soundproof, which has its pros and cons - while hearing the birds chirp is so refreshing, hearing people from the other villa and vehicles on the road wasn't the ideal setup. But one of the highlights was being able to eat on your own balcony, without having to dress up and go into the usual buffet. The food and customer service too was excellent. The wrong information about the room rates and meal plan (over the phone they said it was buffet but they do not offer buffet here), would have been completely fine, had they put in more effort into maintaining the cleanliness, which was unacceptable from a Jetwing property.
title: Very Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:

Greetings from all of us at Jetwing Kurulubedda. We are extremely disappointed in reading your review and knowing that you had to face an inconvenience with regards to your reservation. 
 
Jetwing Kurulubedda is a property that consists of only 06 villas and we have had a favourable response from many travellers  in the past months. As such, at times, the villas get fully booked. We hope that this experience will not deter you from visiting us again in future as we would love for you to experience the serenity and hospitality of Jetwing Kurulubedda someday in the future.

PRIYANTHIKA WIJENAIKE

Jetwing Lighthouse

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
If there was a way to leave zero stars or negative stars on TripAdvisor this is where I would have used it. Where to begin? The rooms weren’t ready when we arrived, which was fine because they suggested we have lunch while we wait. Big mistake. Lunch took 2.5 hours to be provided and even worse the rooms were still not ready. Start to finish 4 hours until our rooms were ready because there was insufficient staff to clean up. The rooms were incomplete, one of them didn’t have a tea kettle, another seemed like it had not been cleaned or opened up in a while. Smelled musty and uncomfortable. 

The next day they had organized a complimentary boat ride along the river to breakfast at the Lighthouse Hotel. This was by far the worst experience of the lot. The ride takes you past a massive rubbish dump and the river itself have garbage floating in it. I was embarrassed as a Sri Lankan given I had foreign family friends with me who were visiting for the first time. Worst part was that the boat moored at what seemed to be someone’s tiny shack which was untidy and all over the place. There were meant to be tuk tuks waiting to take us to the Lighthouse Hotel but they were late so we walked. 

Terrible Terrible Terrible. DO NOT STAY HERE!!
title: Worst experience of my life

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Choose the Lighthouse instead
text:
My husband and I recently spent our honeymoon in Sri Lanka. We both enjoy travelling and like to do things the local way on public transport and in homestays. However as it was our honeymoon we booked a couple of nights of luxury in the middle. We do not usually stay in luxury accommodation so hardly have high expectations but for the price we paid (over £200) in comparision to what we got for our £10 in various homestays, we expected a LOT more. You have to check in at the Lighthouse, which we only found out from reading other reviews. The staff here were friendly enough but refused to serve us lunch while we were waiting to get into our room because we did not look the part and they did not believe we were staying here. When our room was ready, the staff did not know where our bags had been stored when we went to get them. The property advertises a short relaxing boat ride to the hotel - in reality we had to bundle our own bags into a tuk tuk (we are used to carrying our own bags around, but this is a service I expected for such a price), which took us to someones back yard, where we then bundled our own bags into a boat. The boat ride itself was nice enough but we'd kind of had enough of waiting around being judged by then. Also turns out you only get this once - if you want to use the lighthouse facilities again you have to pay for a tuk tuk - we walked, it's not far.

The property is beautiful and set among the forest - we are both nature lovers and enjoyed the wildlife. However, it needed a lot of refurb - again, something that doesn't bother us in places we usually stay, but not what we expect for £200 a night. I have stayed in nicer places in SL since for a fraction of the cost. It was a quirky room with comfortable facilities and private balconies, although they overlook the properties and their plunge pools next door.

Food was nice, although service could be a lot better. We asked for local Sri Lankan food for dinner and explained that we did not want it too spicy - were served the spiciest foods we have ever had, even the waiter said that they would never normally serve it to anyone but a hardened local so staff clearly hadn't listened to us properly. We couldn't eat much of our meal so were disappointed - and hungry, despite having paid extortionate prices! The next day we ate at the lighthouse and recommend their buffet. 

The main thing that bothered us is that service very much depended on status - we are not five star people and it's obvious so we were more or less left to fend for ourselves while the staff ran around after their wealthy clients. Lots of little things like staff taking our cups away and not replacing them so that we had to run around looking for somebody to ask for a cup to even make a cup of tea. On the last day we were offered  a lift to the bus station, which was then retracted because somebody of higher status wanted the car Instead we were offered a tuk tuk at grossly inflated price - we declined and got our own from the end of the road for a third of the cost.

Not quite sure if they are trying to be an eco lodge (if so, there are MUCH cheaper with a better experience) or a luxury personalised service (for which they are simply not up to scratch). Having read about Jetwing since our stay, it seems very much like they are used by an exclusive clientele who only travel Jetwing around Sri Lanka, so the staff know who to impress - and who don't matter.

For a couple just wanting a couple of days of relaxing luxury to break up a busy trip we did not get what we hoped for - we booked another night of luxury at the end of our trip in Kandy at the Earl's Regency and received a totally different experience from start to finish for half the price.
title: Identity crisis!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We are deeply disappointed in reading about the issues you have faced and we have already informed the relevant managers of this for immediate rectification.

We would also like to thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We are a group that is constantly looking to grow and maintain very high standards therefore feedback such as yours is truly appreciated.

We hope that this experience will not deter you from visiting us again in the future as we would love to show you the true worth of the villa.

Ayubowan! (may you live long)

text:
We booked the Jetwing Kurulubedda for two nights but ended up staying there for only three hours. 
Its a new property from the Jetwing group with six rooms. The ambience and rooms are great but don't have enough staff to cater to the needs of guests. Our room did not have hot water and the staff had no clue why or when it would come back on. The food we ordered came late and tasted horrible. 
The location is a little off from the main road and it would be ideal to have your own transport for this property.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for posting your review on TripAdvisor following your recent stay with us at Jetwing Kurulubedda.
 
First and foremost please accept our sincere apologies for having given you cause to express your disappointment on certain issues. 

Please rest assured we highly value our guest feedback whether positive or constructive and we will ensure that they are addressed to the relevant managers for immediate improvement. 

Jetwing Hotels, as a company are committed to delivering uncompromising service to our most valued guests. 
 
I have addressed all issues in the room, including the water drip, I have also shared your comments with our Colombo team (Reservations) so they would also benefit from your experience. 

Thank you for the lovely comments made on the food and in particular about Dinesh, I will pass your well wishes on to him.

Once again, our sincere apologies for the disappointment caused and we do hope that your experience on this occasion will not deter you from visiting us again in the future. 

Ayubowan

Priyanthika Wijenaike
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The booking was made via booking.com. A late checkout was requested under special requirements.   The hotel never reverted.  Getting through to the hotel via number given was impossible.  Finally managed to get through to head office n was promised a call which never came my way.  I called again on the day of the visit. Finally Sachini called back as she was too busy to take my call before. She said that Bcuz she was on leave the customers were not contacted !!!! I was surprised.   Anyway upon requesting for directions I was asked to check in at lighthouse hotel and was categorically told that check in at kurulubedda was not possible.  However none of this information was available on booking.com.  Had I not called we would have driven straight to kurulubedda.  I was told that lighthouse hotel will accomoany us to kurulubedda.  Upon reaching lighthouse we were informed that checki in at kurulubedda is possible n they will not accompany us to kurubedda as promised by Sachini. This was not a good start indeed!!! 

The villa itself differs a lot from what is shown in pics.  The minimalistic approach is extreme.  No towels, bed side carpets, mirror in the room, etc.  The bathroom light was continuously flickering n staff did nothing. The worst was when we realised that the aircon is not working in the night.  In the middle of the night we had to shift rooms and instead of giving us a better room we got a tiny version of original.  Further the shower cud not be completely shut n waters was dripping throughout the night.  There was no soap or shower gel in the room either.

What is good about the place is their food n butler service.  Dinesh went out of his way to please us n food was very tasty n just as we expected.  But the hotel actually wanted to charge us Bcuz by mistake I broke one of the toiletries bottles while taking a bath !!!! Wow .... 

I doubt I will visit this place again as it is not good value for money .....
title: One night stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time share with us your recent experience at Jetwing Kurulubedda, Galle. We are sorry to know you had not received the expected experience from us and we most humbly extend our humble apologies for the inconveniences caused.

Your comment about the unorganized check-in has my full attention. You should not have been hassled to go to Jetwing Lighthouse to do the needful. Please excuse this careless mistake by the associates who are also very new to the property and are in the process of getting things organized and streamlined. However, it is relieving to know that my Front Office Executive had met you and had done his best to put things right. His suggestion for you to transfer from Jetwing Kurulubedda to Jetwing Lighthouse was purely a gesture to try and fix things as you had already been upset with the set-up at Jetwing Kurulubedda.

Finally, since you had not wanted to continue your reservation at Jetwing Kurulubedda, nor transfer to Jetwing Lighthouse, you had been suggested to visit Amaloh by Jetwing in Matara, to which you had agreed. I was informed by Mr. Vivian that you had liked the property and had been quite comfortable with the good services of hospitality that had been extended at Amaloh by Jetwing.

All in all, I once again most humbly apologize for all our shortcomings and sincerely hope this would not deter you from staying with us again the next time you visit Galle.

Ayubowan!

PRIYANTHIKA WIJENAIKE
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: always check on the exact location of your villa
text:
We were led through a muddy path to Villa 3 overlooking a muddy land which was being cultivated and with no privacy to anyone who chooses to stay in the villa. It was inquired as to whether we have ‘checked-in’ at Light House hotel prior to coming to the location. This indeed was a real surprise as I was not communicated in any way prior. I was informed that the process can be completed at the New Wing of the Light House and subsequently I was informed by the front desk that it was in the old wing. By this time I was exhausted and really disappointed with the entire experience. Given same I requested to see the Manager on arrival at the old wing and a front office executive named ‘Vivian’ came to my rescue. He definitely knew exactly what needs to be done to manage the situation. He took time to listen to my frustration and offered to provide a room at light house. I politely declined same as we have been to light house many times in the past. Based on our request Vivian got our reservation transferred to Amaloh, Matara.

I would not recommend Kurulubeddha to anyone who is looking for a peaceful holiday sourounded my nature. From the start setting expectations, communications and the attitude were not what the hospitality industry should be offering.
title: What you get is not what you see...

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback on Trip Advisor following your recent stay with us. 
We take our commitment to guest satisfaction very seriously thus we are saddened to have let you down on what should have been a memorable experience.  We do not have an excuse for the inadequacies, but would simply like to convey heartfelt apologies. 

However we were satisfied that you were pleased with the attention and the helpfulness of our associates at Cardamom cafe, specially the restaurant manager who was on duty at the time of dinning.

We will be more than delighted to welcome you once again and make sure you have a memorable stay with us at Jetwing Kurulubedda.

Thank you for your patronage.

General Manager
Jetwing Lighthouse
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid at all cost !!!
text:
1) Terrible customer service - arrived at front desk of Jetwing LIGHTHOUSE only to be told to go upstairs and FIND another reception.

2) Apalling behaviour - 1st floor reception asked us to find our way to the Kurulubedda by asking anyone downstairs.

3) Ghastly 1st impression - On arrival you park at a neighbour's house and the 20 or so construction workers giving you a virtual dressdown.

4) Dangerous walkway - Due to the work in progress,makeshift plank pathways are arranged which coupled with the rain provide slip hazards and a couple of near miss accidents.

5) Near miss Experience - My spouse tripped on one of the many wires running around (after having dodged so many of them) and nearly fell over as i caught her.Would have sued Jetwing instead of this review.

6) 3rd Class accomodation - Bad condition of Accomodation as most of the doors and wooden panels were ridden with insects and lizards and the washroom areas wère lacking in regular maintenance/upkeep.

7) Service redundant - We were served breakfast at the villa and the leftover plates stayed there till we checked out 2 days later.

Overall a terrible experience that caused me more grief and misery than any other  service related experience.I didnt ask for a refund as it was my fault for not reading the reviews and booking based on my past experiences with Jetwing which were very memorable for all the right reasons.

Your only saving Grace is the wonderful staff and service level of Cardamon Cafe and the commitment of your restaurant manager.

Shame on you Jetwing !!! You just lost a LOYAL Customer.
title: Worst experience EVER !!!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to post a review on Trip Advisor, and we deeply regret the inconvenience caused to you for the planned birthday surprise. 

We take our commitment to guest satisfaction very seriously thus we were disturbed to read about your experiences. Our sincere apologies for the unexpected experience caused due to the construction work in site and not informing about the situation during the reservation.  I’m sorry to say you have got the wrong information on the deluxe room which was provided as an alternative solution at Jetwing Lighthouse, this room is priced higher than Jetwing Kurulubedda dwellings. Due to the lack of communication and not exceeding your expectation we agreed to refund the money back, which is against the policy followed by the hotel. Thank you again for bringing forward your feedback. 

We sincerely apologetic that we have not given the service of our traditional Jetwing Sri Lankan hospitality and genuine service from the heart which we are certain would have led to a wonderful stay with us. We hope you will give us another chance to welcome you back to Jetwing Kurulubedda, Galle, 

Ayubowan!

General Manager
Jetwing Lighthouse
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I wanted to give my husband a birthday surprise at a less crowded calm and quiet boutique hotel, and I booked kurulubedda. And I checked in y'day looking forward for an awesome stay. 

So we went there parked on the garden of a private property.The photo below is the entrance to the place, they say they will take you on a boat ride to this place, which is an utter lie. We had to walk on the side of a huge construction site, a one foot walking path full of mud and pebbles and cement, surrounded by noises of constructions (mind you not the birds they talk of). Thoroughly disappointed we went to the villa, which is on the side of a small house, not even separated by a wall Or a hedge.. And they can jolly well see you at the balcony. Such privacy!!! We stayed a few minutes just shocked! 

I mean what a lie they carry out?? It's an open space and u wonder with all those people working around is this even safe to stay!! What are they thinking? They should have closed down the place until the constructions are over, we don't pay  our hard earned money on jokers like this to fool us. I called jetwing three times before I checked in and no one bother to mention about the constructions. My husband and I decided to leave immediately. So we we to jetwing light house to give us a solution. There solution was even more hilarious, a deluxe room at light house (which is half the price we paid for- and mind you they don't refund the rest of the money) or a room at jetwing era beach. Of course they don't understand that we wanted less populated place with a private pool. When I demanded only they consider there suite. Which again did not fulfill our requirements. After wasting our time , ruining our mood, the joy of birthday celebrations and lot of argument they agreed to refund our money back.. 

This is the worst experience we had.  Thank you jetwing for ruining our day, my surprise for my husband... It's time you close down the place till your renovations are over and change your whole profile in to what you actually offer rather than drawing a fake picture in peoples' minds..
 
Think about the people who actually stay coz they are helpless since they have paid money, and bcz some does not know what to do, or couples who come on their honeymoon! Is this the quality of a boutique hotel you show out to tourists who come to Sri Lanka?
title: Horrible place, do not expect what they have shown!

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I'll summarize:

1. They are under construction. Jetwing management really needs to understand that the clientele that comes here come for some peace, quiet and serenity. Not to walk through a construction site, and have 20 or so workers stare at you while you jump in the pool. If they need to expand, then shut the place down, finish construction and reopen. It's that simple. How can you charge such a premium and expect guests to put up with a half done property, noise and intrusion??

2. Sort out parking. Using Mr. Siripalas' house next door is not the answer. Either have your own park or ferry the guests to and fro. 

3. Villa 1 has a salubrious view of the neighbors house. How far was that thought out? If you are selling seclusion, at the very least grow a hedge! 

4. Nowhere on their website was it mentioned that they were under construction. And when we brought this up, the alternative accommodation we were offered came nowhere near the value paid for KB. 

We didn't stay 5 minutes. Got a refund and left.
title: Avoid Til they sort out some major issues!!

text:
Looking at the photos, you'll think that this is an amazing getaway from the daily life. But, you'd be sadly mistaken. The site is practically an uncleared backyard which they've built couple of villas. Throughout the day you could hear the yelling of parents and kids, fighting over homework or some other nonsense. They are working on expanding to build few more villas. So while one side of the view from the villa looks exactly like the photos with greenery, over your shoulder you'd see construction and of course somebody's backyard. 
Don't get me wrong; the food is good and the staff is very friendly and helpful. But unless Jetwing finds a way to relocate all the neighbouring people, this place will disappoint those like me who come for calm and relaxation.
title: Not the wilderness hideout you'd imagine

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

First of all allow me to thank you for taking your valuable time to bring to our attention the recent experiences you had with the Kurulubedda reservation. I have gone through your comments and would like to assure you that it has our full attention.
 
Jetwing Kurulubedda, a property consisting of only 02 Villas, attracts endless attention of all local and foreign guests. Therefore the villas fully booked most of the time, especially during weekends. Due to a system error your reservation resulted as an over-booking.
 
The team at Jetwing Lighthouse tried to make sure that you don’t feel completely disappointed with our hospitality. Our intention was to render excellent service to you by making the weekend an extra special one.

It must have been very frustrating for you to wait several days for someone to inform you on the status of your refund for that I am extremely sorry, if I were in your situation I’m sure I’d feel just as you do.
 
I make this an opportunity to extend my humble apologies on behalf of the Jetwing Lighthouse team for the inconveniences faced by you. We hope these isolated incidents will not deter you from visiting us again.
 
 
PRIYANTHIKA WIJENAIKE
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Booking is not guaranteed until check in. You may be offered a room at Jetwing Lighthouse, a large mainstream hotel on the side of a busy road instead of Kurulubedda.
text:
It appears that the overbooking issue reported by earlier reviewers is still alive and well. My wife booked Kurulubedda and received a confirmation email and her credit card was charged. So despite not receiving a reply to another email and being unable to contact them over the phone on the day of check in we assumed the booking was confirmed. 

Upon arriving at Jetwing Lighthouse we were informed that Kurulubedda was full and offered a room at Lighthouse. We had read the previous reviews and even joked about it happening to us, but assumed they would have rectified any issues being a major hotel chain. But on the first afternoon of a long weekend the joke was on us. And we were not alone as several other couples appeared to be in the same situation and left with their weekend plans ruined. Since our intention was to spend a weekend in a quiet place away from large crowds we declined the offer of a room at Lighthouse despite the best efforts of the staff to convince us otherwise. They then agreed to refund our payment first thing the following week. 

However since no refund or communication was received the following week, my wife emailed Jetwing to be told that the refund will be take 7 working days. However, 8 working days since the incident we are yet to receive a refund or any further communication.

Obviously they do not seem to think there is a major problem since this is not an isolated case but something that is happening repeatedly. I cannot understand how they think that people who booked a private chalet would be happy staying in a large hotel during a long weekend. Maybe they feel that with no options most people would just take the room and forget the incident. The complete incompetence in handling booking and the lack of communication and professionalism in resolving the issue has convinced me to never stay in a Jetwing property again.
title: Never again!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Jetwing Kurulubedda is our hidden wilderness gem. It is a private two villa property located in the middle of a mangrove forest partially surrounded by the “ging ganga”, one of Sri Lankan’s main water arteries. It is also partially surrounded by a typical Sri Lankan village, based around a temple less than a hundred meters away.

It is a truly unique property unlike any other. Yes, there are mosquitoes outside. As it’s a property within a riverside forest, this is to be expected. However, your room is sealed and air-conditioned for this exact reason. Mosquito nets are provided on your terrace should you wish to spend the night outdoors. No, there are no gardens, however this is very much part and parcel of the concept of Jetwing Kurulubedda which is a greatly self sufficient property growing a majority of the fruits and vegetables used in its cooking and offered to its guests. As is evident by all the other reviews, all our guests love the truly unique location, concept and the personalized care Jetwing Kurulubedda offers. We are truly sorry you did not feel the same way. 

We are glad we were able to accommodate you in another of our fine properties a little closer to your liking and we do hope you enjoyed the rest of your stay in Sri Lanka’s amazing southern coast.

Sincerely,

General Manager.
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Please do not book this place. Lots of mosquitoes, overpriced US$500 per night, the landscape was not looked after and the grounds are unsightly. No remote control, must borrow form next door villa, only have 2 villa in a small area. You cannot go anywhere because the area is small. This place is right next to a village. Behind  the villa there is a house and I can hear people talking, coughing and etc. I told the GM about my feedback he said it was my own opinion and other people loved it!! If you don't believe me do try it yourself. With such a price that we are paying we should deserve better service, luxury in the living area and surrounding area. With this price go to Amangalla instead where it is really luxury and good service!!!! Wanted to go there but fully booked. My compliment to the GM is upon my request he quickly looked into moving me out of Kurulubedda.
title: Mosquitoes

text:
The lunch buffet at Marino's was the most pathetic ever. The food was just tasteless, even the meat items tasted very odd. The Sri Lankan corner was a huge disappointment with only red rice and nearly 4–5 brinjal dishes in the buffet.

The fruits were ridiculous; there wasn't even a decent variety, just papaya, watermelon, and very few passion fruits.

All meat items except for braised beef and chicken supreme. I can't begin to explain how awful the taste was; they couldn't even season it.

The noodle chicken mushroom soup was a perfect crap pot. Most items were made from canned items.

I'm very surprised to learn that Sri Lankan cuisine could be such an utter disappointment. I'm a very regular diner at Colombo City hotels. Marino's lunch was not even close to mediocre.

It was just like they put a spread out because they had to. Please get chefs to eat what they cook.

This was my very first experience, and this will be my very last.

Even thinking about the lunch experience gives me a headache. I was in fact scared to taste the food because the awful taste just scared me off of trying.
title: Qualityless

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Remy,
Thank you for patronizing Marino Beach Colombo. We are thankful to you for taking time off to comment on your experience in detail. However, we do apologies for the disturbance that may have been caused by noise. This is not a normal occurrence. Also, we are sorry to hear that you faced inconvenience after the breakfast buffet. We always use the freshest and cleanest ingredients for preparation of our foods and drinks in order to provide our guests with the best possible gastronomical experience. We sincerely hope to have another opportunity to serve you and look forward to making your next stay an even better one.
Best Regards,
Prasanna K.
Director Operation
placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
To be honest the hotel deserve more overall then 1 star rating (good location, nice facilities) but on this specific stay it deserve 1 star and bellow is why :
I booked for a 4 day trip to discover Sri Lanka and relax. I arrived early in the morning and of course I did not expect to be able to check in, I informed reception that I will take breakfast and stay at the pool till room is ready.
I went for breakfast nice location, attentive service and decent buffet selection. By luck my room was ready around 11am and could check in. I requested for a room with no connecting room but got allocated to a room connecting (can happen) 30 min later got a different room.
As I left the night before from Abu Dhabi I did not sleep and went to sleep. 
Around 2pm I woke up from a strong stomach pain further more some loud drilling was happening just in front of my room (some construction happening next to the elevator).
I went to the pool hopping the pain will go and to be away from the drilling but 30 min later I started to get cold sweat and feeling really dizzy. 
From then I could not move from the room/bathroom and was feeling really sick to the point that at 10 pm I went with difficulty by my self to the emergency hospital as the reception could not help. 
After a terrible night I got woken up in the morning again from the drilling happening in front of my room. Still sick I went downstair to speak to the manager who got upset at me saying their is a note in the room so that I'm aware of it ! 
I explain to him that not at any point of the booking or check in anyone inform me of it, as well the note was till the 2nd of April and today is the 3rd to what he answered that they got delay so construction had to be for one more day. For the food poisoning he said he will share my feedback to F&B manager, I explained him the only food I consumed since I left UAE at 9pm the day before was the breakfast buffet (I did not eat on the plane) so no doubt on the origin of the food poisoning. (but never got contacted by anyone or check on my well being).
At this point I got enough and asked to cancel my remaining stay and I paid to change my flight back 2 days early. 
As per management they agreed to refund me the 2 night I will not stay but charged me fully for the two night I stayed and refused to give me a complimentary shuttle back to the airport in the early morning (he gave me 50% as a kind gesture however it's still more expensive then an Uber).
Not at any point management show genuine care of the situation. I understand this is not a 5 star hotel but basics of hospitality still need to be maintained. And I'm not an expert but if drilling is planned in advanced at least the room in the vicinity should be blocked for the duration of the construction.
And please have a serious look on the hygiene standard of the buffet / kitchen !
title: Good hotel but very disappointing experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Annie,
Thank you for choosing Marino Beach Colombo for your recent stay. While we regret any inconvenience that you had to face, let us reiterate that no fraudulent activity has taken place within the premises of our property. Your accusations have been thoroughly investigated and a detailed response has already been forwarded to your attention. Further, if required we are also in a position to provide you with internal CCTV footage. We hope you will stay with us when you visit this paradise island the next. 
Best Regards,
Prasanna K.
Director Operation
placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is cashless and will only accept credit card payments throughout the hotel, restaurants and bars.
Having recently stayed here and used my credit card I was upset to learn that my card was used fraudulently many times after I checked out. My credit card company have confirmed that someone at Marino Beach hotel is the likely culprit for the fraud.

I have had no response to the emails I have sent to the hotel about this matter and am still awaiting a refund for checking out after two nights instead of the originally planned six.

Everyone we met in Sri Lanka, outside of this hotel, was kind, helpful and friendly. 
It's disappointing to be ignored by the staff in this hotel regarding a matter that left us in a terrible financial situation in Sri Lanka, as my credit card had to be cancelled.

Avoid this hotel!!
title: Avoid this hotel!!

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Do not come here, ever, if you do not wish your money to be stolen.
text:
Do not go there! Ever! I have my money stolen from the safe and nobody wants to take responsibility. They say that it's only me who can open it but obviously it is not true. The employees were into my bagpack instead of cleaning, and one time they locke my suitcase with the number code lock. Took me almost an hour to open it. 
Never happened anything ever like that with us, and we are not first time travellers. We have been all over the world, always had great times.
Here we booked 21 nights, but truly regret it. 
Don't come to Marino Beach, even local tourist offices saying that they have lot of problems with the staff. They can't be trusted, so they do not bring their clients here anymore. Wish I would knew that before! 
Now I'm stuck here, hoping to get a refund for the rest of the time, so I can go somewhere else.
title: Avoid it for good!

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Been travelling to colombo many times. Decided to try Marino beach for the first tome. Terrible decision. Very unclean not a 5 star standard. I booked a suite room. The couch had so much patches of dirt. Aircon was bad. Toilet vanity was so small you cant keep your toiletries there. Ugly ceramic flooring in the entire room. Worst is how unclean the entire hotel is. Bed and bedsheet low quality. Not at all a 5 star standard. I would probably give it a 3 star max. Staff wer unfriendly. Never staying there again.

There are plenty of beach facing properties so please do your research before reserving! Most of the reviews reflect the property and not the people in it. They just spoil the holiday vibe.
