placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Do not stay here! They are racist !!!
text: RACIST! One set of rules for my white friends and another set of rules for brown people! SHOCKING! If a white person wears a thong/speedo it’s swimwear, when a person of colour wears it, it’s underwear and inappropriate. I am BEYOND DISGUSTED by this Jim Crow era racism and segregation type behaviour! DO NOT SUPPORT this kind of racist establishment. Deplorable!!! They treat people of colour with such disrespect that it ruins your entire stay in Sri Lanka! Not worth it! Not worth the risk! Not worth supporting! Not worth staying!
title: RACIST STAFF!

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
The lower level staff a phenomenal. That’s the good. The upper level staff are ridiculously crude, racist, and unfriendly in their own professional way.
I normally rent several rooms for my friends and family at least five each time i stay there. I come from the United States and tip the staff generously. I also give the staff chocolates and various gifts each day as I genuinely love their customer care.
But At checking in, they make you wait in line while 2 people wait on one customer. Don’t greet you properly and their only purpose is to ensure they are following the rules provided to them by management. Thus giving poor service to the customer.
I saw them being clearly racist and serving a foreigner before serving a local customer.
I saw a manager blow his nose in the restaurant in the dish area and not washing his hands prior to serving someone at the buffer. They embarrassed my son in the restaurant in front of his new bride saying you must pay before sitting down with his parents so he had to run upstairs to grab his wallet while his wife sat on a bench so when I approached my daughter in law they told me i had to pay for her before she could sit with us in front of so many patrons which was embarrassing. I threw a US $100 bill at her and brought my daughter in law bach with me to our table. I complained and got sorry sir replies. They wouldn’t allow my friends to join me for dinner at the chinese restaurant rooftop saying it was for hotel guests only?? Of course they allowed my white friends without questions but stopped the locals.
The economy is going down Marino Beach and if you want to stay in this modern world stop being biased and racist!
Also the straw, my wife is going to Sri Lanka to help with one of my daughters in law’s emigration to the US so i booked a room for her and sent a message that she would arrive at 5am and they replied that check in time was 2pm.
We have no control of airline flight schedules but have a choice on where to stay. Goodbye Marino Beach Hotel. You will be missed but the world is big even in little Colombo. Hello Shangrilla!!
title: Poor Management

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I stayed here for three nights for a short honeymoon. Having stayed here twice before, l have to stay we most definitely won't be staying here again. You just feel that the priority here is making as much money as possible from the guests! Maybe I'm old fashioned but l always felt that decent hotels made you feel special and nothing was ever too much. My wife and I didn't get that feeling at any time. The first issue was the bath tub, which gave way underneath me, while I was standing, soaping my body. Both of my feet went through the bottom as what looked like very thin plywood coated in plastic gave way. At this point I'd like to suggest I'm 5'10" and 90 kgs. So I wouldn't class myself as particularly big. It was just the cheapest material that this bath could have been made from, which you don't expect in a 4.5 star rated hotel! The material ripped quite a big gash in the back of my heel, which needed treatment. As the half full bath emptied at a very quick rate, l suddenly thought about the electric wiring for the ceiling below. (We were on the 7th floor) this was very stressful. Fortunately the water remained in our room, l believe as it appeared to drain off via the shower outlet.
We were offered a miserly free breakfast for our troubles, which I found slightly insulting. I suggested a free spa for both my newly wed wife and myself, which the lobby manager just laughed at. We didn't find it funny or thought my request was a greedy one.
The lobby manager said he would ask his boss. We heard nothing back from him! 
We were duly moved to another room, similar to the one we had. Needless to say we only used the shower and kept well away from the bath. On our final night l wanted to see a football match on the tv. I had bought my firestick for this purpose but didn't anticipate the limited number of power sockets. I needed either a twin adapter plug or a small extension lead. I was told in no uncertain terms that guests weren't allowed either of these. So my wife and I headed into Colombo to purchase one. During this mission, whilst I was getting an extension lead, my wife was waiting in a local Uber tuk tuk. The driver had no patience to wait (10 minutes) for my return. We wanted the same tuk tuk to return us to the hotel. The driver started screaming absenities at my wife and threatened to beat her with a stick if she didn't pay him immediately. I came out to this commotion, which was really nasty and upsetting. Needless to say the driver was sent packing with a flea in his ear! My point is, we didn't have to experience this had the hotel simply loaned us a stupid little adaptor plug. On the day of our departure l spoke with the checkout desk again bringing up the possibility of a free spa, which was flatly declined (apparently the was run by a different company) we were offered a complementary lunch and a delayed check out until 17.00.
We accepted and all l can say is that it was just as well our checkout was delayed because we waited well over an hour to receive our food order!! When it arrived it was dried out and lukewarm. All this did was strengthen our resolve never to return again. Why do so called up market establishments treat their guests so shabbily? Do they not realise we have a choice and now thankfully a voice?
title: This hotel is all about making as much money as possible from it's guests. They appear to be totally unproficient in the art of

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in this hotel recently during a short staycation.

This hotel is conveniently located in the Galle Road closer to many shopping areas. Additionally, the hotel is connected (or rather in the same building of) to Marino Mall, which is a shopping mall owned by the hotel's parent company itself. We briefly did some shopping in the mall, and although it is not big as some of the malls in the area, it had decent number of shops.

The hotel has a nice rooftop garden and a pool. I think despite of some minor 
noises from the surrounding, many would enjoy this rooftop. Sadly due to our schedule were unable to enjoy this view at night, but I would imagine this would be a perfect location for a romantic date after the sunset.

However, I think they have room to improve in several aspects. We were disappointed about the service of the hotel's staff. We noticed a lack of warmth and professionalism from many of the staff we encountered. I don't know whether this situation is only common to local guests, but we would expect much more friendliness, warmth, and professionalism from a hotel of this caliber. I would suggest the hotel to improve their staff training.

We only had breakfast from the hotel, although there were few food items with good flavor, we noticed a considerable lack of quality (flavor and freshness) of many food items available. Also the number of varieties in the hotel breakfast buffet is also limited. 

I think the cleanliness and the quality of Wi-Fi can also be improved in the hotel. 

However, considering the premium location and the views, I think this hotel is suitable for a short staycation.
title: Conveniently located with nice sea views

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: We had group dinner & drinks couple of nights this week at restaurant/ bar on pool desk level service was so slow they were even not busy took ages for drinks didn’t come in and try to push for second rounds didn’t check food satisfaction unbelievable service so bad we spend quite a lot each night there since our group was around 8 , only good thing about this area was there swimming pool looks great infinity pool but man service needs serious improvement
title: Poor service at bar level bar thinks tides

ownerResponse/text:
Dear esteemed guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at The Westbury Palace. We sincerely apologize for the shortcomings you experienced during your visit.
We understand your concerns and we take your feedback very seriously and will use it to address these issues and hope to make positive changes that will lead to a more enjoyable stay for future guests.
We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the room upgrade to a higher category. We are committed to providing high-quality food and service to our guests.

We value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to address your concerns.

Best regards
Nihal Jayasinghe
Resident Manager.
placeInfo/address: No. 17 Udupussellawa Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid the breakfast ‘bacon’. It is rank.
text:
On arrival was somewhat amused at the faux golden, plastic, ‘palatial’ interior design and furnishings.  With numerous cheesy,  ‘oil painting’ photos which paradoxically add to the sterile atmosphere, this gaff is all chintz.

Our ‘Graeme Thomson’ bedroom was well appointed, with comfy bed, fine cotton bedding and a single sink bathroom with double jacuzzi. However after using the jacuzzi, the bathroom floor was flooded.  Assumed it had happened due to water overflowing the tub so spent next 20 minutes moping up with towels as assumed it our fault.

Went down to dinner, explained the mopped up flood to the manager who said engineer would take a look. Turned out it was a leaking fitting in the jacuzzi and not down to us at all. Could have done without the bathroom flood stress not of our making.

And so to dinner.  Firstly, the wine list was very expensive which I wouldn’t have minded if there had been some quality wines there but it was mostly cheap Ozzie bargain basement plonk. Fizzy water it was that night.

Onto the food. The tuna fish salad starter was very school dinners - some tiny scraps of tinned tuna flaked onto a highly acidic lettuce salad.

The mid course of lentil soup was served warmish and decent but uninspiring.

The main course was very poor. Cold reheated grey chicken with cool mashed potato. The chicken frankfurter was a bizarre site on my plate but at least vaguely edible by comparison to the foul chicken. Two tiny sprigs of broccoli nestled next to three minute fingers of carrot were edible but not at all satisfying as such a small portion.

Lastly dessert, I specifically asked for the apple crumble to be well heated ie hot but one minute later out came a small apple pie, fridge cold. Now things were starting to grate a little.

We then attempted to order a packed breakfast for the next morning as we were headed out at 5.30am for the much anticipated Horton Plains hike. The chef very enthusiastically offered us chicken sandwiches.  Alarm bells now rang. Went through it a few times and finally succeeded in securing boiled eggs, plastic cheddar cheese, plastic buns, a banana, some dried nutty biscuits, small juice and water.

Left hotel very early next morning at 5.30am for Horton Plains which I’d highly recommend if you like hiking and an epic view from a great height.   This is the main reason to visit bijou Nerawa Eliya as not much else of interest in the town except Victoria Park.

On return to the hotel 6 hours later we found our room had not been cleaned.  When my wife complained, the manager claimed that the waiter had asked me at 5.30am if I wanted our room making up. Bit of a misunderstanding there as indeed the waiter had mumbled something but I thought he’d asked if we wanted anything further?  Why oh why, in the absence of a ‘Do Not Disturb’ sign would a hotel ask you if you wanted your room making up? 

Upshot now was we’d lost faith in the kitchen and the hotel’s hospitality.

Later that afternoon the apologetic staff persisted in offering us afternoon tea or a drink. It felt like a gesture of goodwill but on departure the next morning I was amazed to be presented with a bill for the beer.

Sri Lanka has so much fine food and warm hospitality to offer the weary traveller but sadly for us not at the Westbury ‘Palace’.  Basil Fawlty has unfortunately popped up at the Westbury. Shame.
title: Newara Eliya’s answer to Fawlty Towers?

ownerResponse/text:
Dear valued guest ,

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback regarding your recent stay with us at The Westbury Palace. We genuinely appreciate your insights, as they are invaluable in helping us enhance our service. We strive to exceed customer expectations but I do recognize that in this instance we have fallen short and would like to sincerely apologize for this. We would like to further discuss what has happened and how we can correct in retrospect our mistakes.

Thank you once again for your valuable input, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you better in the future.

Best regards
Nihal Jayasinghe
Resident Manager.
placeInfo/address: No. 17 Udupussellawa Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: I found the Westbury Palace perplexing and the glowing reviews even more so.   Our bedroom was comfortable and the double jacuzzi bath a nice feature but the decor throughout - faux Georgian furniture, fake fireplaces, strange, unidentified portraits and Bridgerton style piped music in the weird, windowless dining room is tasteless and tacky.  The real issue though was the food.  The tuna salad starter comprised a few flakes of tinned tuna with lettuce, my husband’s main course chicken was grey and tasted distinctly reheated while the accompanying ‘sausage Buckhurst’ was an anaemic frankfurter, the mash was cold and my fish resembled school dinners.   Furthermore, the next day we arrived back after a 5.30am start and 6 mile hike on Horton Plains (awesome views - a must do) to find our room had not yet been cleaned though the hotel was virtually empty.  The outdoor pool is pleasant enough and there’s a lot of hovering from well meaning staff but the Westbury is far from palatial.   Cannot recommend.
title: Perplexing Establishment

ownerResponse/text:
Liebe Nicole,

vielen Dank, dass Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben, Ihre Eindrücke mit uns zu teilen. Wir schätzen es sehr, dass Sie unser Resort erneut besucht haben, und freuen uns, dass Sie die Betreuung durch unsere Ärzte und Therapeuten als ausgezeichnet empfunden haben.

Es tut mir jedoch leid zu erfahren, dass Ihre jüngste Erfahrung nicht vollständig Ihren Erwartungen entsprochen hat. Bitte erlauben Sie mir, einige Punkte zu klären, die möglicherweise Missverständnisse verursacht haben.

Zunächst möchte ich in Bezug auf das Ereignis mit dem Straßenhund betonen, dass unserem Personal das Wohl der Tiere am Herzen liegt und dem Hund kein Schaden zugefügt wurde. Wir behandeln alle Tiere mit Respekt und Sorgfalt, und unser Sicherheitsteam würde niemals solche Maßnahmen ergreifen. Wir verstehen, dass Tiere in neuen Umgebungen manchmal beschützend reagieren, und bemühen uns stets, solche Situationen mit größtmöglicher Rücksicht zu handhaben.

Bezüglich der WLAN-Netzwerke schätzen wir es, dass die Sensibilität gegenüber elektromagnetischen Signalen für manche Gäste von großer Bedeutung ist. Unser Team ist darauf geschult, dies zu berücksichtigen, und wir sind stets bestrebt, für alle eine ruhige Umgebung zu schaffen. Wir bedauern jegliche Störungen, die Sie möglicherweise wahrgenommen haben, und werden mögliche Anpassungen prüfen, um Interferenzen für zukünftige Aufenthalte zu minimieren.

Schließlich möchten wir uns für die Nachfrage zu den Überweisungsbelegen und die Abschiedsarrangements entschuldigen, falls diese als aufdringlich oder unwillkommen empfunden wurden. Unser Ziel war es lediglich, sicherzustellen, dass vor Ihrer Abreise alles in Ordnung ist, da wir stets transparente Abläufe und klare Abrechnungen anstreben. Wir verstehen, dass diese Situationen stressig wirken können, und nehmen Ihre Rückmeldungen ernst, um unsere Abläufe zu verbessern.

Wir schätzen Ihr ehrliches Feedback sehr und sind entschlossen, diese Anliegen anzugehen, damit all unsere Gäste einen ruhigen und erholsamen Aufenthalt genießen können. Nochmals vielen Dank, dass Sie Ihre Erfahrungen mit uns geteilt haben.

Mit herzlichen Grüßen,
Garden Beach Team
placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir waren das zweite Mal aufgrund der hervorragenden Ärztin dort. 

Leider haben einige Dinge diesen Aufenthalt überschattet.

Ein mit dem Haushund Lilly angefreundeter (einsamer, trauriger) Strassenhund wurde aufgrund eines einmaligen Bellens uns gegenüber von dem angestellten Security Mitarbeiter getötet(!).

Aus unserer Sicht wollte er nur das Hotel beschützen und war in keinster Weise aggressiv. Zuvor hatten beide Hunde miteinander auf dem Hotelgelände gespielt und der Strassenhund war sehr zutraulich.

Aus unserer Sicht ist das ein NO GO. 

Wir haben das auch Jan dem Gästebetreuer kommuniziert. Es erfolgte leider keine Reaktion.

Der zweite Punkte waren 3 Wochen Schlafstörungen aufgrund von 5 (!) WLAN- Netzen nachts im Schlafzimmer. 
Auch das haben wir dem Inhaber und Jan mitgeteilt, dass das ein wichtiges Thema für uns ist, da wir beide wegen körperlicher Themen mit der Aussicht auf Gesundung diese strapaziöse Reise auf uns genommen haben.
Leider keine Änderung.

Der dritte Punkt war auch interessant, als der Inhaber am letzten (!) Aufenthaltstag unsere Überweisungsbelege unter Druck anforderte, die wir ca 4 Wochen zuvor überwiesen hatten.

Zu guter Letzt zeigte sich Jan noch passiv aggressiv indem er die übliche Abschiedszeremonie versagte , da wir kommunizierten kein TIP zu geben für einzelne Mitarbeiter.

Da wir aufgrund dieser Punkte immer wieder gestresst wurden, war die Panchakarma Kur leider nicht sehr effektiv.

Ergo: 
Strahlensensiblen ist ein Aufenthalt nicht zu empfehlen
Tötung von Strassenhunden stresst extrem
Vielleicht sollte der Inhaber seinen Mitarbeitern mehr als 100,- EUR im Monat bezahlen, damit sie nicht abhängig vom TIP sind und boshaft reagieren
title: Ärzte & Therapeuten super

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mrs. Wong,

Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at Hilton Yala Resort. We sincerely regret that your experience did not meet expectations and appreciate the opportunity to address your concerns.

Regarding your check-in and payment process, we apologize for any miscommunication. As your stay consisted of back-to-back reservations booked using points, our system required a re-check-in and incidental payment for the new reservation. This was explained upon arrival and kindly reminded before your safari. However, as this was not completed, our team had to request the payment to proceed with the check-in. Additionally, we regret the oversight in selecting the incorrect currency when processing your payment, which resulted in the transaction being declined.

For clarification, the 25% Hilton Diamond discount was applied to the food charges. Upon further review, the same discount was also extended to the beverage items. The revised total before taxes and service charges amounted to LKR 49,275.00, and after applying the applicable 34.34% taxes and service charge (LKR 16,921.04), the correct final total was LKR 66,196.04.

Initially, an incorrect amount of LKR 75,129.64 was charged to your Amex card. To rectify this, a credit card refund of LKR 8,933.61 was processed, ensuring that the final amount charged was correctly adjusted to LKR 66,196.03. The voided transaction details were shared with you via WhatsApp on the same day.

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by the room temperature. Our engineering team inspected the system, and to ensure your comfort, an alternative room was offered solely for the purpose of sleeping, so you could rest comfortably without needing to pack and unpack your belongings. You would have been able to return to your original room in the morning and pack at your convenience before check-out. Your feedback has been shared with our team to improve service and provide a more seamless resolution process in the future.

Regarding your service experience, we regret that you felt uncomfortable during the payment process. Our intention was never to inconvenience you, and we will be reviewing our approach to ensure a more guest-friendly resolution in similar situations.

As a gesture of goodwill, we were pleased to offer a complimentary dessert during your dinner on February 25th. We truly value your loyalty as a Hilton Diamond member and sincerely hope to welcome you back for a more seamless experience in the future.

Please do not hesitate to reach out should you require any further assistance.

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
text:
I gave it a 1 (very poor) out of 5 stars rating because I did not enjoy my recent 2-night stay at Hilton Yala Resort from February 24 to February 26.  

1. Hilton Diamond member privilege
(a) I presented my Hilton credit card for incidental charges at check-in (Feb 24); however, the front desk staff informed me that the credit card deposit was not necessary., I was assured that I could settle the charges upon my departure check-out.  As a Hilton Diamond member, the front desk staff recognized my Diamond member status and acknowledged the 25% discount on Food & Beverage and Spa service.  
(b) On the 2nd day (Feb 25) when I returned to the resort in the evening after the safari tour, the front desk informed me that my credit card (credit card record from Hilton booking portal) declined the dinner transaction on Feb 24. The staff requested my credit card to settle the dinner payment.  Since I didn’t carry my credit card in the resort, I asked if I could pay the dinner bills altogether at check-out tomorrow (Feb 26), the staff insisted I must resolve the payment immediately.  After the dinner, the front desk staff took the credit card machine with him and accompanied me to my room.  At my room, the front desk staff showed me the total amount of 75,129.64 LKR to be billed which includes 2 dinner payment - tonight's dinner (Feb 25) and last night's dinner (Feb 24) payment; however, my credit card was declined, so I asked him to try it again, the 2nd attempt was successful.  Later, I received an email alert message from the credit card company that the amount of 75,129.64 USD was declined due to exceeding my credit limit.  In reality, there was nothing wrong with my credit card.  The front desk staff charged the incorrect currency which is why the payment couldn’t be processed. 
(c) At check-out on Feb 26, I reported to the front desk that the Diamond member 25% discount on Food & Beverage was not given to the Beverage items on both Feb 24 and Feb 25 dinner.  The front desk staff reviewed my bills and confirmed the errors, the correct amount should have been 49,275.00 LKR, and it was processed to my credit card right away.  The front desk staff told me that they will void the transaction of the incorrect amount of 75,129.64 LKR and will send me a receipt.  As of today March 7, I still have not received the void receipt.

2. Malfunction AC system
(a) The room temperature remained at 20 celsius degrees.  The temperature was unable to be adjusted, it could not be set to my desired temperature at 25 celsius degrees and as a result, I had to turn off the AC system during my 2-night stay. While I appreciate the General Manager's apology, I am disappointed that no compensation was offered for the significant inconvenience I experienced at a 5-stars Hilton resort. 
(b) I reported about the freezing cold room temperature on both the first and second days of my stay.  Despite confirmation that a technician had inspected the issue, the AC system was not repaired. The front desk offered an alternative room for sleeping only, which I declined due to the impracticality of packing and unpacking my belongings for a single night.

3. Bad Customer Service 
(a) Furthermore, I was insulted by the handling of my payment.  Being escorted to my room to settle the bill a day before departure due to a front desk error is unacceptable.  If the matter was urgent, I should have been informed at breakfast on the second day when the credit card rejection occurred.  This level of customer service is unacceptable for a 5-star establishment.
title: Terrible and Unpleasant

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Binuki,

Thank you for sharing your feedback following your recent stay at Hilton Yala Resort. We sincerely apologize for the issues you encountered and the disappointment you felt during your visit.

Regarding the welcome experience, our records indicate that the reservation was made for four adults, and the welcome amenities, including face towels, were prepared accordingly. We regret any inconvenience caused by this oversight.

Our lobby is infused with our signature Hilton Yala essence, designed to provide a unique and pleasant ambiance. We are sorry that it did not meet your expectations.

We take your feedback about the food quality very seriously. Our executive sous chef and the F&B manager spoke to your group during lunch, offering replacement food items and dishes outside our menu to accommodate your preferences. At dinner, our F&B manager again assisted your group with choices. Finally, at check-out, our Front Office Manager spoke to your group, and it was during this conversation that the gentleman in your group aggressively raised his voice, leading us to discontinue the discussion professionally.

We apologize if the western menu items did not meet your tastes, though we are glad to hear that the Sri Lankan Kottu Roti was a delight.

Lastly, we did offer a takeaway breakfast to ensure your departure was as smooth as possible given the circumstances.

We did try our best to meet your expectations in every way and are disappointed that we could not meet them. We treat all our guests with utmost professionalism, and our TripAdvisor reviews received to date contradict your experience at Hilton Yala.

Warm regards,
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
text: Our stay at the Hilton Yala Resort was a huge disappointment. From the moment we arrived, the lack of a proper welcome was noticeable. With six of us, only four face towels were provided, leaving two of us waiting. The reception area had an unpleasant smell, which added to the disappointing start. Lunch was a disaster; not a single dish was palatable. Even after informing the waitress, the food quality did not improve. The glasses provided for water had a very unpleasant smell, and the replacements were just as bad. During dinner, an iced mocha was watery, and the replacement was equally terrible. Dinner was a nightmare, even worse than lunch. The staff's mocking attitude towards our complaints was unprofessional, and the absence of managerial intervention was a letdown. We left without having breakfast, utterly dissatisfied. I strongly advise against choosing this hotel for your stay. It is truly disappointing to receive such poor service from a Hilton property. The property itself is beautiful, but the staff needs better training, and the food quality must be significantly improved to match the property’s potential.
title: Unsatisfactory stay

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Katie, 

I am sorry for this experience. The winds we cannot predict. There was an unexpected lull early October which was longer than usual. The winds did come back till about mid October. 

However, that aside, I am also SORRY that none of the staff had acknowledged you! I will look into this IMMEDIATELY. I (Dil) was overseas, however that is no excuse for what happened. 

Regarding the transport, again I will go back to see where the miscommunication was made. I am sad that you state you will not return, it is a very special place. 

Dil
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
Unfortunately we did not have a good experience during our stay. While it is a beautiful place, and I'm sure has great kitesurfing when the wind is good, we cannot recommend it based on our experience. We stayed during the first week of October and did not have any wind. Of course the resort cannot control this, but it was disappointing nonetheless, and it was their response and the overall vibe we experienced that led us to have such a negative experience. We were picked up at the airport by a driver from KSL who was very professional though quiet and the van was comfortable. Upon arrival at KSL we were met by a few people who took our bags and told us to follow them to our room. Absolutely no one asked our name, asked us to check in or provided any information. They took us to the room and then walked away. We called after them asking if we needed to check in or what to do next, and they said we should come to lunch at 1 and everything would be explained then. We had told the resort ahead of time we wanted to go kitesurfing and one of us needed lessons, and would start that first day. We found a paper in the room saying lessons would leave for the lagoon at 2:30 so we assumed we had some time to figure things out. There was no wind at the resort, but wondered if there might be wind at the lagoon (assuming so since there was no indication that the season had ended and the website suggested there was usually wind through the end of October). At 1 we wandered through the property and entered the area with tables, just assuming this was where lunch would be. There was a large group of people already sitting, talking loudly, laughing, enjoying themselves, speaking French. Not one single person acknowledged us, even looking up let alone saying hello. We assumed they were a group of friends, not interested in making new ones, which was fine, until later that evening and the next day we realized they were the staff! No one spoke to us until we finally struck up a conversation with another guest traveling alone who informed us she had been there 6 days and there had been no wind the whole time. She said there would be no kite surfing that day and this was the only thing that was mentioned to us about it. We asked what else there was to do, and she said we could go swimming or stand up paddling. We wandered down to the beach after lunch, still with no introductions, and found a lone beat up stand up board and paddle. We played in the water for a while and then wandered back to the resort. Decided to have a drink at the bar and the bartender was very friendly - this was a positive. We asked him what else there was to do, and he said "beer pong." Needless to say we were not super impressed. We did have a conversation later with another one of the staff who provided us some recommendations for surfing further south. Still no one had acknowledged us checking in, or providing us info on the forecast. At this point we began planning how and when to leave to try out surfing. Over breakfast the next morning (which according to the sign started at 7:30 but was not served until after 8:30 - which is fine, but again, no communication), we ate and planned our departure. During this time someone named Leo from the staff came over and introduced himself to us, asking us our names and our plans (almost 24 hours after we arrived.) He told us to come for him to anything. We told him we were thinking of leaving, unless he thought the wind would come up. He left to check the forecast and came back, saying the wind looked good. My boyfriend went to look with him and realized the day he was referring to that was "good" was Thursday (we were scheduled to leave Wednesday). We told him we would leave and head to Hirikitiya, and asked about helping with a ride. We had a ride website we were using so had an idea of price, but told the staff if someone in the area needed business we would be happy to use them. They started arranging things and quoted us a price. We agreed and went to pack. When we returned it was the same van we came from the airport in, and they told us the price was actually much higher because we were going to Hirikitiya and not Galle. At no point did we tell them we were going to Galle so we have no idea why they would have quoted us a price to Galle. Another frustration. 

SO overall not a great experience. As for the positives: we liked the room and the outdoor bathrooms are awesome. The bartenders were friendly and the beer was good. The property is great and I'm sure it's a great place to kitesurf when their is wind. Unfortunately after less than 24 hours there, the vibe was so unwelcoming and frankly we felt misled as we later looked at their instagram account and it appeared they were well aware the season had ended early and did not share this with us. Sadly we would not return.
title: Sadly disappointed

ownerResponse/text:

Gabriel

placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
Hi, usually i don't like to write bad reviews but the stay at this place couldn't help it. 
My gf and i were on a backpack trip in Srilanka and decided to visit Kitesurfing Lanka for the last 3/4 days since firstly i kitesurf, secondly knew people working there, was a chance to meet up (with no any offense to them)
here below are the pros and cons of the stay: 
pros: 
-spacious rooms and bathrooms along with the terrace. 
-Some of the staff is nice and friendly like Mickey, tikiri, zac, Ola and Sebastien.  

Cons: 
- When we arrived the first night there, we spoke with more than 4 people, contributing in the management and told them that tomorrow morning, i will be assisting my gf with her riding skills (who cannot ride upwind 100%) and rent equipment for both, Noting that some of them knew that i was an assistant instructor. And of course, everyone smiled and encouraged me to do that. However, the next day, after arriving to the spot, the guy responsible for the rental did not allow to rent for her equipment because she does not ride upwind 100%. We don't mind putting your own rule, we totally respect that but just be clear from the beginning and be straight forward other than being a hypocrite. She had to go back to the camp and pay her own TukTuk because swimming there is a no go zone. 
-the conditions of the Big Lagoon are very normal, not as mentioned in the website. Buffalo's Poo is everywhere when setting up the lines and kite and the wind is very gusty. the center offers only water. 
- DON'T wash your harness in their Tank, it is disgusting. Green Color and viscous. 
- On your way to the reception, the odor next to the toilet is unbearable. I did not find it clean as a place compared to other accommodation in SriLanka.
- FOOD is way below average in terms of quality and variety, also not as mentioned in the website. Breakfast was literally the same for three consecutive days. Ohh and the Bell that they ring for food time makes me feel like at a "cantine" or school for sheep. 
-Most important One: THE VELLA ISLAND! What a joke really. Way over exaggerated. 
however, I have to say conditions are perfect for kiting, constant wind and huge space for flat water. 
So here is the story with the Organizer called "Amin" the Moroccan cheesy guy! 
The trip was on Thursday and Friday. Customers have an option to return Thursday night or Friday night. We talked with the guy which also sounded very nice on Wed night to subscribe our names and automatically decided to put us for two nights. Around 10pm, my gf and i decided to change for one night but Amin was already disappeared and thought he might be sleeping. We thought that there is no problem to tell him the next day morning, NO BIG DEAL. The day is for 45 EUROS BTW, SO EXPENSIVE compared what is being offered. So the next day morning, we told him that we wanted to go back on the same day and suddenly turned into an evil and saying : No it's impossible. Whether you go for two days or you can't go. This conversation occurred literally before 5 min leaving the truck. His argument was that only one boat was returning back and is already full. so we said, "what if someone gets injured or get sick?" he replied this is another issue. 
So we decided to go since we had no option and will see if we can manage to talk to people there and manage our return. When we arrived there, there was no toilet, no non-salty water for a quick shower, beds are like WW1 and the food was below normal, equal to 200 rupees maximum/person. Plus, no beach boys to help you. I personally launched and landed kites of customers/ friends more than Amin did for the whole day because he was busy teaching and earning money. Meanwhile, we have found a fisherman to get us back for 5000 rupees +tuktuk. Also, we found once we got back that one of the instructors was returning on that "full boat" and we as customers are at the end of priority list just for this Amin don't pay an extra boat for two people. Very unprofessional and cheesy guy! Of course, we told the reception the story and there was no positive response whatsoever. 
Oh and the first aid box is horrible! don't take the risk to try new tricks at that place as no professional backup plan is taken into consideration. 
- Internet was barely working for the whole stay, it was frustrating to use it. 

Anyway, i am writing this in order not to complain about the money i spent, (it s my last concern) but on how this place cash cow money from customers while giving a smile. Such an abusive behavior and you can feel it.
title: Disappointing Stay

roomTip: Make sure you are not confused when you book so you don't end up in a tent when you have booked a standard room!
text:
I have had the worst experience of my travels! I made a booking at Kitesurfing Lanka from 26th to 29th of December on the 17th of November to avoid festive seasons rush and received a confirmation. We also made a 50 Euro deposit to confirm the booking through paypal at the request of the owner. We booked 2 standard rooms and after 3 and a half hours of driving to get there with our boys (10 and 13) we were told we had booked one tent. It was a bit of a surprise for us as it says standard room and not tent on our booking. We were also told that it was not their problem by the staff who was handling our booking and that they were discontinuing the bookings through Agoda.com etc which we did not really understand. The owners were not on site. 

He then gave us the owner’s number and when I explained the situation to him I was told that he would look for another hotel nearby. However, after 2 hours of sitting around we called him back and his phone was switched off. We tried to find rooms for the 3 nights at another hotel in the area but was not successful as all hotels were booked out. We were with our cousins who were with 2 babies who also booked the same standard room and was given a tent with common toilet facilities. So we had to book rooms in Negombo at a Hotel where we would not normally have gone. It was a very bad experience which spoilt our holidays that we were very much looking forward to. No compensation and no apologies until the next morning which was in the form of an email trying to justify that we were confused and that they will amend the details on the Agoda.com website so people are not confused in the future. What a lot of good that did us! Terrible!
title: Biggest disappointment!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Michelle,

Thanks for taking time to write a review. Sorry to hear your experience was not up to standard inspite of your friends coming back again to the kite camp for the second time in a row. 

I readily accept your feedback about the noise in the morning. We will try and see how this can be minimized. 

Having said your side of the story, I would like to also give our side of the story; 

1. Pricing - Prices have been communicated to your in advance, very clearly (Euro 35 per person full board). We even share photos of the accommodation and common washrooms in order to balance your expectations with what is offered on e mail. As our other guests experienced tents also come with nice bedding, electricity and fans. All your meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner as well as desserts, tea/ coffee) were included in the price. I am not sure you get Cordon Blue, Grilled Fish, Chocolate Mousse etc in a normal kite camp buffet style anywhere else in the world but at our camp you do hence we justify the price with what we offer. Dont forget WIFI and the transport to the kite lagoon at scheduled times. 

2. We have scheduled times for transport to the lagoon in the morning and afternoons. Your statement about flexibility is misleading. We offer scheduled transport - FOC. If you however need transport outside these times you can always request from our staff who will happily arrange a tuk tuk/ jeep/ van for you. For this you pay and prices are fixed so that guests wont get ripped off by the fluctuating prices. 

For the benefit of other readers, the lagoon is 15 minutes drive from our camp. You can also kite in the sea in front of the camp and do a downwinder as well to the kite lagoon (15 minutes). 

3. Airport Taxi - Please understand that we give opportunity to the local village to do the transport service for us. By the time you sent us a mail, the vehicle was already in the airport waiting for you as per your flight details. Your communication was too late - simple. We however tried our best to speak to the drivers to reduce the rate which we did on your bill. 

To go ballistic to my staff was not in the spirit of Kitesurfing Lanka or a kitesurfer. We did our utmost to ensure you had a pleasant time. Your own friends continued to patronize KSL for a reason. If a mistake happened, its normal but please not have all the anger and try to take on someone else. We are civilized and can talk to find a solution - always.
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text: It is extremely overpriced for a tent. Noisy workers do not allow for any sleep in the mornings and the wind is very gusty for kiting. The location is about an hour walk from kiting lagoon so you must take a truck which is scheduled the same time every day, not leaving much room for flexibility. We were also charged for two taxi rides instead of one, because we only told them 12 hours in advance of our change of schedule, however no where did it say 24 hours was needed.

A colazione, prenotata per le 07.00 poiché dovevo partire alle 07.30 hanno iniziato a portare il cibo , pessimo alle 07.25 
Se questo è un servizio da hotel 5 stelle…..
title: Altamente sconsigliato

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
roomTip: just don't book here.
text:
I do not recommend this property at all. 

It is well more expensive than other properties in the area, and is treated as a luxury boutique property. It is not

I paid full price only to arrive and find out the spa is closed for renovations. The pool is under renovation. In fairness they said they could heat it for me but it isn't close to a reasonable temperature for the climate and takes hours to heat......to say nothing of the construction nails around the deck and the ones that had to be removed from the pool. 

They market that there are fireplaces in the rooms
 Actually, what they have is the type of cheap and ugly fake units one finds at Walmart for sub division homes. 

The shower head in the room at its highest, is about chest height.....and I am 5 foot 7.
the walls and ceilings are paper thin. I can hear everything from the hallway as well as every single movement from the people in the room above me,

If this place was $100 a night. sure it would be great. But I am paying over $350 a night, and that is absurd for what is being offered. 

The view is great. You can get that at many hotels.

I feel robbed and disappointed.
title: Do not stay here. Stay elsewhere

text: I stayed in Amaya Langdale in August 23-25 with my family. Although the hotel market itself as a small luxury hotel, I did not find it to be so luxurious. The hotel had 13 rooms and all were fully booked. There was no buffet and there was only two people to receive order and serve. The hotel was terribly under staffed. Food was okay but not what you expect from a hotel of this class. The TV in the room was broken and the hotel said due to lightening strike. Plastic water bottles were used and so was not mortivated by a green concept. The location is very nice and staff was very friendly. In fact the staff apologised for having a few staff and the delays. They said they were closing for a major refurnishment. I went there because of the great Amaya name. Amaya has great hotels like the one in kandy which is a wonderful hotel. But not this particular one. Hope it will become better after the refurnishment.
title: Amaya Langdale

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
Positives:
Location and the some of the services offered, particularly the front office and the waiters, were fantastic. The ambience and the scenic beauty that we could view from our room was spectacular.

Negatives:
Food was a total let down, especially for the price that was charged as a boutique hotel. Both the breakfast and dinner menus not only offered very limited choices but also were quite bland in taste. The food needed more seasoning and this does not mean making the food spicy. Having said that, at a time when only locals were occupied at the hotel then the hotel can easily cater to the Sri Lankan palette. The bakery products tasted stale and were heated in a microwave just before presenting them to the guests, which became rubbery and dry after a few minutes. The set dinner menus lacked taste and the soups that we had throughout the three nights, although they were supposed to be different types, tasted the same and actually tasted like a instant soup made out of a packet. Somehow the Sri Lankan menu, which included string hoppers & milk rice etc., tasted better than the western cuisine. Overall, we felt that all those fresh local ingredients that the hotel could source from were not treated with care to make a delicious dish.
title: Excellent location with dire need for improvement

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
I booked langdale based on the slick website and service offerings they professed to offer as part of their affiliation with the small luxury hotels of the world brand. Having stayed for 3 days at the hotel with my family I can say that the hotel fell woefully short in many ways than one.

CONS (which regretabally vastly outweigh any pros):

Staff - severely undertrained. They did make the effort to be courteous and helpful but their lack of professional hospitality training was undeniably obvious. 

Food - absolutely sub par. Their attempt to cook western fare borders on the inedible. (Would suggest sticking to Sri Lankan food varieties, which the chef is likely better at, that would satisfy locals and be a novelty for foreign tourists).

Accommodation - nowhere close to the enticing pictures online. The furniture in the rooms are dated, sheets overused and stained. The bathroom showers were screaming for more water pressure. 

PROS:
Location - The hotel is situated in a picturesque locale and is close to Nuwara Eliya.

Premises - The premises were well maintained.

Would advise management to make some major  investment in training staff, in revisiting the food menu and in refurbishing the rooms/bathrooms - otherwise I would sereiusly question the hotels ability to qualify as a luxury “anything” of the world.
title: Luxury Small Hotel...Really?

text:
I went there with friends, my friend booked the rooms well in advance more than 2 weeks before.she has mixed up the dates and booked it for 3rd and 4th April instead of 4th and 5th.She called them the se day to change it to lahiru who promised to call back but never had the decency to do so.she has called many times nothing happened.when i checked through internet there were rooms available on the days we need as its not the weekend.I badly needed to change the days as i have a special proram on that day.Then i called and lahiru promised ti call head office and do something.he never did and didnt answer my calls evan.He should be trained how to treat the customers.if he told me in advance that it cant be done without ignoring the calls it would have been alright.
Food is good, serving staff too, esoecially sanjeewa and Nazmi.We had a tripe room which was very small though it had a nice view.
The second night there was no water in the bathrooms and when water came there was no hot water.
There was  a RAT running in the living room which was horrible.
The hotel was not up to the standards at all.
With the nice scenery around they can and should impove especially in customer service.
title: Not a good place to stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear  Guest, 

Ayubowan from Amaya Resorts and Spas!

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
This is meant to be a luxury boutique hotel. We arrived and were greeted nicely but it literally went down hill from there. We stayed for two nights and I was so close to leaving the hotel early and looking elsewhere. Such a shame because the hotel exterior is beautiful but then it fails in every other way! 

There was no aircon, no ironing board or iron. The lamp shades falling apart. We were rationed to less than one toilet roll a day, no extra roll left in room. I called housekeeping for another roll but they never brought one up. It was also weird that on the second day of our stay all of the cushions on our bed were removed from our bedroom? Why?? We are an older couple. 
The shower tap was difficult to use and floor of shower cracked. The tap in the sink was loose and I was afraid that it might fall off if I used it. The hot water ran out when running the bath tub. This hotel needs some love and a clean inside the shower. At night you can hear everything in the hotel because of the thin walls so don't expect much sleep until all the staff have left. 

On the first day I ordered a cheese platter and an hour and a half later after questioning staff was told they didn't have any and to order something different. 
Staff at the front desk were not trained well and did not understand English - what I was saying but still saying yes?? 
Breakfast was ok but no Sri Lankan meals, just pastries, fruit, eggs and bacon, nothing special for a luxury hotel. The male staff serving us at breakfast was polite. 
The meals for dinner are very pricey and nothing special. 

All in all this is not a luxury hotel. I have stayed in plenty of beautiful luxury boutiques and this is not worth the price to stay. I wish I stayed somewhere else.
title: Look elsewhere. Beautiful exterior but lacking everywhere else. Not a luxury boutique hotel

placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
roomTip: Very noisy if you have room above Carpark
text:
We have recently returned from Sri Lanka and after a few days of travelling across country, there were 4 of us,we were looking forward to spending 3 nights at the Langdale, especially as it is part of the 'Small Luxury Hotel" group. Im not sure when SLH last visited but they need to soon.
The sunbeds by pool need replacing, the mattresses on them very badly worn and looked awful.
The rooms were adequate but there really wasn't any luxury, no Mini-Bar, no Air Con.
We had a balcony which was nice, but no chairs to sit on, why.
The Staff were very friendly but not really sure when they had training. We decided to have Dinner in the Restaurant on the first night. Mismatched Wine glasses on the table not really very SLH.  all ordering Chateaubriand, what a treat....Wrong!! Not only was it the worst meal I have ever had I am not sure what cut of Beef it was, certainly not Fillet but our waiter cleared starter plates while our friends were still eating and brought out two Mains and said we had to wait for the others which was odd as we had all ordered exactly the same. The Wine list was virtually non-existant they only seemed to have one bottle of everything.
At first we thought it was funny trying to laugh off all the mistakes but by day three that had worn thin. We tried to complain but were told that there was no General manager on Duty for our entire stay, one  member of Staff said they were on holiday, another that they were at a Conference in Colombo?? In the end we contacted our Travel Agent who did manage to speak by telephone to a Manager who was very apologetic but it was to late. we have contacted Small Luxury Hotels to tell them how disappointed we were.
title: Small, yes! Luxury, NO!! Avoid.

placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
The stay we had in Langdale was not really up to the standard highlighted by the hotel. 

1. Location/view: Fantastic (5 out of 5) 

2. Meals: Terrible (1 out of 5) 
First night they organized a buffet out of their usual 4 course meal and there was nothing to eat for the vegetarians. There was not enough food and people had to wait for long time until food arrives. Bread/buns served were not fresh. Food on menu was not labeled, people cannot find the meat until they eat it + many more 

Next day after we complained, they organized the usual 4 course meal, but again not up to the standard, we couldn't eat the salad, bad smell coming from the prawns, many gave up eating the salad and returned it. The main meal was quite small and not really the ideal size for a dinner. Only the soup was good in that meal 

Breakfast buffet was a disaster. The ham and bacon served was beef, there was no chicken, we had to ask for chicken sosages few times and then we got it. This is simply common sense where for a local crowd you need to serve chicken because not many people eat beef. Same situation continued on the second day breakfast 

Both the Manager and the Chef don't have common sense to put up a decent meal/menu where people can eat and have options for all 

3. Service: Poor (2 out of 5)    
People waited until food comes from the kitchen, we had to ask for plates, we had to ask to re-fill the food, we had to ask lot of things, they never think and do things

4. Facilities:  (2 out of 5) Only 8 channels in cable TV in rooms, to see rest of the channels you need to come to the bar. The safety lockers in 2 rooms were broken.  

Overall not a good place to visit, not worth for the money you spent. If you only need a place to sleep and have a good view on the mountains, then fine but you need to sort all your meals from outside
title: 20 pax booking to Langdale

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
View - 4/5
Food 1/5
Service - 1/5
Staff Friendliness - 3/5
Rooms - 3/5

Here's the story when I went there for my office trip with 20 of my colleagues for a 2 night stay. 

View

Surrounded by mountains in one side and a tea plantation on the other this is one for the classic Nuwara Eliya views. But not something you can't miss ;)

Food

Day1 Dinner - Instead of the normal dinner they decided to give us a buffet since they though 20 people is too much to cater with their normal buffet and gave us noodles/fried + chopsuey + chicken/pork. That's it. Hello what if I don't eat meet?

Day2 Breakfast - Noodles + egg curry + omelette + potato hash browns + beef. Hello, what if I don't eat beef?

Service
Day1 dinner, some of our team members had to wait in line until they bring soup cups, until they bring plates and until they fill up some dishes. Terrible. They only notices some dishes are empty only when we pointed.

My roommate asked to clean the room when we go out in the morning. Came back at 12.00 PM. Room was not cleaned yet. There was no electricity for about half an hour at that time as well. 

Rooms
The room was up to the standard until I went for a shower. There was a bath tub with a hand shower. The hand shower was not long enough and I either had bend down about 1ft or sit on the bath tub to take a shower :(. The rooms are not soundproof as well.

Staff Friendliness
They were OK until one of the room service members asked me whether my nearby room was empty for cleaning where few of my colleagues were. When I said NO, she let out a sigh with a disappointing face.

All and all, please stay away from this place. There are plenty of good places around with the same quality of view, which is the only thing worth coming here for.
title: The view is not worth it

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
roomTip: Choose an upstairs room
text:
I made a reservation to have a day spent at this so-called "mini luxury" hotel in the end of July 2017. Making the reservations itself was pretty difficult with the pretty lazy and inefficient reservation desk. After many emails, I got it through and was keen to see this place. And also knowing other reviews, I specifically asked them to reserve me an upstairs room.

To my horror, when I called them in the morning on the day I was to check in, they made a big fuss that I cannot get an upstairs room and all upstairs rooms were occupied. With many calls to the hotel and to Colombo office, I manage to win my case having requested myself upstairs room months ago to which they didn't refuse at that time. It was completely a fault of the silly officer in the reservations dept but to her credit, she corrected her miss and swapped us for an upstairs room!

(+) Scenery! That's the only thing this hotel can give. The small garden is well kept.
(+) Friendly staff - sometimes felt sorry for them as they had to make up with pretty old facilities.
(+) Decent pool with hot water.
(+) Nice tea estate adjoining the hotel where you can hike through.

(-) Biggest negativity is the Extraordinary Price for this shabby property which even only serves a limited ala carte menu!
(-) Old and shabby facilities. My room's safe was broken - they took so many tries and time to fix it and later had to replace with another. TV aerial was broken - only 1 or 2 cable channels could work. If you want to see more channels, you have to go to the TV in the bar.
(-) Very poor meals - bread served for starters were old and not fresh. Very limited choices on the menu.
(-) Bikes were broken. Nothing much you can do except for a shaking mini pool table.
(-) This hotel looks underperforming and seems not much interest is given to it by the management to maintain it.
(-) The few small rooms that are on the ground floor have zero scenery!

Overall, I was very upset about the price I spent for this.
title: Luxury is only the scenery!

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
In summary, there is no luxury at this hotel - even basics are missing. Staff are not trained, just not responsive; I asked for a napkin which came 20 minutes later along with the rest of my food order at breakfast. 

Rooms are small and dated, very thin walls, you can hear everything and you will be awaken with the first person waking up and going for breakfast. Absolutely no privacy. Horrible bedsheets quality. 

As for food, I made the mistake of having dinner there which came 45 minutes later and was just not good at all. Breakfast is barely edible. 

In fairness the manager did take the feedback and tried to be nice by following up but it's just beyond her; the place is not equipped and they just don't have any luxury standards. I was offered a complementary foot reflexology which was the best service that place could offer.

This is an expensive hotel so definitely not worth the price tag which is a shame because it's in a beautiful location. There generally seems to be a shortage of good accommodation in Nuwarya Elya but still do not let this be a reason to stay at this place.
title: A waste of money and a beautiful location

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
Thoroughly regret not heeding all the previous bad reviews, choosing to book this place because of the gorgeous views. The views are indeed lovely, one window overlooks the pool deck and mountains, other window overlooks the hills. But even this view cannot salvage what I have to call a truly poor experience completely not deserving of the SLH brand standards which one expects. The electricity stopped without warning four times over 90 minutes, when that happens, you will also realise this place does not have emergency lighting either in the room nor in the pitch black hallway. NO lights, NO announcements whatsoever, NO working telephone. Guests are left in the dark literally. After the fourth blackout I marched down to reception and was greeted by four blasé looking dudes. No hello good evening are you alright, or even a greeting just blank stares. So I had to ask the obvious, if they noticed the four black outs. Their response was along the lines of oh this is Sri Lanka, blackouts occur. And when asked about the phone, they looked amused and explained like they were talking to an idiot child, that of course the phone also doesn't work as it runs on electricity and it takes a few minutes after the lights for the phone to work again. No apology until I asked why they did not have emergency lights or a backup generator. Finally they said oh yes now they've decided to turn on their backup generator. Sorry. 

YOU EXPECT THIS FROM A USD50/night place, NOT A USD350/night place. By way of service recovery they sent up a plate of stale looking cookies. Wow. I've travelled to lots of developing countries and stayed at far more modest digs, both in Sri Lanka and all across the globe. Not once have I been hit by multiple blackouts in one single night, and not once have I experienced a complete and utter lack of emergency measures such as emergency lighting or an immediate backup generator kicking in. Or such complete apathy from the clueless staff who do not belong in a SLH property. They do not have the finesse or even the polish or niceties you expect from LUXURY. 

On to the ageing rooms. The doors have warped so much they require superhuman strength to slam close and then prise open. Both toilet and room doors have this problem. No bar fridge, no mini bar items, no wine glasses even or cutlery. Cheap looking tea bags and instant coffee packs. No glasses in the toilet either, or even face towels, just two sets of hand towels. One measly set of toiletries, and such thin cheap tissue paper and toilet paper. Even our USD70/night Zinc Journeys in Sirigiya had lovely thick 3-ply purple patterned loo paper. Yes I judge a place on the little extras, but isn't that what luxury prices are meant to afford a weary, pampered traveller?

Breakfast while good, really was staffed by poorly trained young staff who looked like they were constantly scared of spilling something. We asked for an additional platter of some fruit, they simply rejected this, not even offering to do it for a small supplement. Just flat out no. Are fruits so expensive here??? The room was charming, but they also forgot our orders for water, we gave up.

Not looking forward to the electricity situation tonight.
title: First world prices, third world service and mod cons

placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed from 14 to 15 April 2025 at Cinnamon Bentota Beach – @cinnamonhotels @cinnamonbentotabeach.

They were so unbothered – clearly prioritizing the foreign guests over us locals. It was honestly disappointing. Check-in was slow, and check-out was just as frustrating. What’s worse is that even though we’re paying a hefty amount just like everyone else, the service doesn’t match what we’re being charged for. And when that happens, it really ticks me off.

We were placed in a room at the far end of the property — apparently in the “luxury wing”, but I don’t see how a 5-star hotel can call it luxury when we have to walk ages just to get to the pool or restaurant.

The property itself is beautiful, but the service at the pool was awful. No pool attendants, no waiters in sight, and we had to call the general line to request someone – still no luck. Waited 45 mins for someone to even take our order, and then another hour for the food and drinks to arrive. Their excuse? “We’re too busy.” Not acceptable at all for a hotel of this calibre.

Some saving grace:

	•	The gym was decent.
	•	Pool itself was clean and nice.
	•	Dinner buffet had a solid spread and service was decent.
	•	Breakfast buffet was better in terms of both food and service.

It’s a stunning location, no doubt. But the lack of service, double standards, and poor guest experience really killed the vibe. They need to do better – especially for us locals who choose to spend and support our own hotels.

#CinnamonBentotaBeach #DisappointedButHonest #SriLankaTravel #LuxuryHotelsLK #HotelReview #SupportLocalTourists #BeachResort #CinnamonHotels #TravelSriLanka #Awurudu2025 #TravelDiaries #RealReviews #IslandLiving #DoBetterCinnamon #FoodieAdventures #Foodie #Foodporn #InstaFood #FoodPhotography #Delicious #Yummy #Foodgasm #LKA #SriLanka #Foodie #Love #Explore #InstaGood #PhotoOfTheDay

placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
Были в медовый месяц неделю в этом отеле сразу после нового года.
Примерно за три недели до прилёта предупредили отель, о том что прилетаем, сообщили, что у нас медовый месяц, написали даты, чтобы, как обычно бывает, отель успел подготовиться и все красиво украсить. В ответ кроме презентации экскурсий и расценок в спа нам не сказали ничего.
По прилёту оказалось, что нас никто не ждал, (не смотря на наличие номера бронирования и подтверждения бронирования от отеля) 
Два часа мы просидели на рецепшене, под их разговоры о том, что мест нет и нашего бронирования не существует. Через два часа нас всё-таки поселили, но с условием - мы живем тут только два дня, а дальше перевезут в другой отель на два дня, а потом вернут обратно. (Мы оставили заниматься этой проблемой переселения тур агента, а сами пошли заселяться). Зайдя в номер мы обнаружили, что нам решили подменить номер на обычный, не смотря на то, что мы брали делюкс с видом на океан.(Очевидно, что стоимость у них отличается и само собой никаких украшений в номере не было) Мы вернулись на рецепшн и наши выяснения продолжились, спустя еще час нас переселили в номер с видом на океан, но по прежнему утверждая, что выселят нас через два дня. Спойлер, нас действительно выселили, в качестве извинений мы не получили ничего кроме трансфера в другой отель. 
Когда мы первый раз выселялись из номера, то в чеке на оплату мы увидели спа на 150.000 рупий, который мы не посещали, этот вопрос занял 30 минут, чтобы мы не платили за то, чего у нас не было.
По возвращении в отель во второй раз нас даже не подумали заселить раньше, не смотря на то, что чекаут был в 12, нам пришлось сидеть с чемоданами до 14.
По плану у нас была экскурсия на следующий день в 3 утра и мы попросили на кануне заранее ланч боксы, которые нам, конечно, никто в итоге не приготовил, потому что все забыли и нам дали воду и апельсин с яблоком. 
Когда мы вечером вернулись с экскурсии, то из номера пропала красн��я пижама (мы смотрели и искали во всех углах номера) поэтому позвонили на рецепшн и нам сказали, что на следующий день попробуют что-то сделать, утром нам ее вернули без каких либо извинений или объяснений
На одном из обедов мы нашли в макаронах личинку, но из нас пытались сделать дураков, объясняя все тем, что личинка (мертвая, в масле, на дне тарелки) прилетела к нам с дерева, опять же после этого не было никаких извинений и объяснений.
Под конец отдыха нам опять добавили в счет спа, которого у нас не было на 150.000 рупий, и это опять заняло какое-то время, чтобы доказать, что нам не делали массаж
В самих номерах много плесени в ванной, местами разбитое стекло, присутствует запах затхлости, а так же, если не попросить, то ничего кроме одного полотенца на человека вам не дадут (в нашем номере не было халатов, тапочек и полотенец для рук) Работники ждут чаевые за все, что они делают, в ресторане, если попросишь фильтрованную воду, то они добавляют чек за дополнительный «сервис»
Под конец хочется сказать, что мы не супер искушенные путешественники и у нас нет высокой планки в плане ожиданий от сервиса и ремонта, но это действительно было очень плохо
-не может быть в ланче за 30$ (+ 10%) личинок
-не может рум сервис брать из номера пижаму, когда им захочется 
-нельзя выселять новобрачных в медовый месяц, не предоставляя щедрых извинений 
-не может спа центр выставлять счет за несуществующие процедуры
title: Невероятной красоты остров и совершенно ужасный отель

text:
I’ve been a regular guest at Bentota Cinnamon Beach Hotel and have always loved their hot butter cuttlefish, which is my favorite dish. Normally, it’s served with fried rice, chili paste, sauce, papadum, and a fresh salad of tomato, onion, and cucumber, making it a complete and satisfying meal.

However, during my visit last Sunday, I had a very disappointing experience. I was served only the cuttlefish, which wasn’t fresh or hot, and the presentation felt rushed and careless. When I inquired why the fried rice and accompaniments were missing, the staff informed me that they were not included, which was completely contrary to my previous visits. After raising this concern, they brought plain rice but still didn’t provide the chili paste, sauce, papadum, or salad, which are essential parts of the dish.

As a loyal customer who has always enjoyed dining here, this experience was truly upsetting and below the standard I expect from a place I admire. I even took pictures to show the stark difference between the usual quality and what I received this time.

I hope the management addresses this issue seriously to ensure consistent quality and service. A gesture like a complimentary dinner would certainly help restore my trust in the restaurant.
title: Disappointing Experience at My Favorite Restaurant

text:
Firstly I would clearly say SriLanka is an amzing country , clean and beautiful beaches , pretty countryside, amazing hill station and would highly reccomend everyone to visit. People are nice and helpful.

We cancelled our Taj Booking and moved to Cinnabon because of reviews and wanted to try it.  Property is pretty, refurbished, beach access and river access is also great. Room are spacious and clean. The biggest turn off is staff seems unhappy and unwelcoming.

1. Check in process was slow and with a lot of confusion ( ignored it)
2. Checked in at 9:30 pm, staff suggested we take the buffet, so we went ahead. within 10 mins of sitting down we are asked to speed up by staff saying buffet closes sharp at 10 pm. A asked for a fresh appam at 9:55 and the lady on counter gave me the worst look ever.
3. Next day breakfast we reached at 9:30, again by 9:45 staff asks you to speed up because buffet closes sharp at 10. There isnt enough staff for you to order any stuff sitting down, if given a request to bring a coffee or omellete staff looks disgruntled and order comes atleast 15 min later after multiple reminders
4. Asked service staff for a bathroom cleaning while heading to beach at 11, they said only afternoon staff will do it. Their time is over.
5. Following day dinner,  On the indian counter asked for a roti instead of Naan, one cook agreed to make it, followed by a loud verbal altercation between two staff on why roti request was accepted.
6. While pool was open at 7 pm, pool guy only got towel after multiple requests, since his time was over.

Property is 5 star but service is abysmal for a luxury resort.. In 3 nights we stayed there, never once felt welcomed. Would not reccomend this plac.e
title: Hopitality levels are not upto par- Not a welcoming Hotel

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No entertainment in the evenings apart from a cultural show which last 5 minutes and is repeated the same every night
text:
TLDR: Cockroaches, Broken room with no aircon, bad service from management, bad buffet food, mis-selling rooms on website...avoid

Upon our arrival, and following a full day of travel (c.7 hour drive), we had hoped to relax in the room / poolside for an hour before dinner. Unfortunately, having arrived at 5pm, the check-in process took an hour and we arrived at our room around 6pm. Already frustrated, we were met with great disappointment with our ‘luxury seafront / sea view room’ - at this point it’s worth quoting how the room is described on your official website / booking page “Our Luxury Sea View King Room delights you with terrific views and elegant interiors. Delve in an elevated private terrace with a view of the stretching Indian Ocean”.

Please attached image to see the reality of said view.

Given this disappointment, I informed the front desk that I would like an explanation, to which they replied that ‘we do not own the trees and therefore cannot cut them down, not allowing a sea view’. I wasn’t happy with this excuse and requested a new room with an improved view. 

We were then shown 2 new rooms, the 2nd of which I agreed to take - it’s worth noting while slightly improved, there was still no view of the ocean, however, by this point my partner and I were so exhausted that I could not muster the energy to look for any better. We kindly asked for our bags to be transferred to this new room, so we could freshen up and change clothes before going for dinner (already sad we would now not have time for a swim before sunset).

The bags took around 1 and a half hours to arrive, meaning we were not able to get ready until 8pm, essentially feeling held captive in our room while we waited! It would have been appreciated for reception to offer us refreshments while we waited, however, were told bluntly that we could ‘call room service’ - which we had to do multiple times given the ever-extending time it took to be reunited with our possessions (including laptops and chargers etc.).

We eventually were able to attend the buffet at around d 8:30pm (much later than we had wanted) having finally changed clothes etc. The food was poor and overpriced. When we arrived back at our room, feeling exhausted and stressed out by the check-in ordeal, my partner and I had wanted nothing more than to relax in a cold room, and watch some TV. Unfortunately, this is where the real issues began.

The first issue was the fan was not working above the bed. The air con was also not working efficiently and was not reducing the temperature below 25 degrees + (too hot for comfort). The next issue was the TV was not working. I informed reception, who sent an engineer to fix these

Issues as it was going to be a very uncomfortable night's sleep. He arrived at almost midnight, and spent 15 minutes attempting to fix each problem - none of which were corrected.

About 5 minutes after he left, I heard something fall from ceiling. I inspected the chest of drawers next to the TV to find a very large cockroach scuttling around the table top, and also on the food & cake we had in our room. Needless to say, we would not be eating these. My partner was also hysterical and refused to sleep in a room potentially infested and likely unsanitary.

This was the final straw after a quite frankly shambolic first night at your hotel. I immediately informed reception of the problem and requested a visit from the night manager. He then moved us to room 3306 - coral suite. We got into this room just before 1am, exhausted and fed up. I’m sure you have now seen the image of the cockroach as the night manager took a photo also, but I have attached here again for reference along with multiple images documenting the awful first night experience. I also have an extended video showing the cockroach moving around the room. 

This final room change of the night was appreciated and the coral suite was adequate for the remainder of our stay - but also not without its faults (strange high-pitched noise, faulty taps etc.).

A couple of days later, the night manager approached us while we were having a drink in the long bar to ask how our stay was progressing. I informed him that while the room change has been appreciated, the overall sentiment from us was disappointment. Essentially, it felt as though a full night of our holiday had been stolen from us, and a full night's rest - which was greatly needed after long travels - was also denied (meaning the enjoyment of subsequent days was reduced through tiredness). He didn’t seem to understand this and was defensive about the situation.

I also want to note that for the majority of our stay, we were made to like 2nd class citizens vs. guests in big parties including a Russian chemical company and an Indian wedding which essentially took over both the hotel’s facilities, and the beach (making it a building site on two occasions while stages were erected and dismantled). The persistent hammering late into the night to create the rather garish 'Hollywood sign' by the swimming pool (directly below our room) on our final sleep was also frustrating. 

Overall, while the upgrade at the time was appreciated, it didn't paper over any cracks and the stay was poor - they have subsequently offered another night free in on of their Sri Lankan hotels, however, being based in the UK, I don't see us taking up that offer any time soon.

Unfortunately, the General Manager, Johan Aschan, has also chosen to ignore our messages about this bad experience.
title: Cockroaches, Faulty Aircon & Fan, Poor Service From Management - Avoid
