placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t stay in extension and take earplugs
text:
Building
The original building is beautiful and unique. Unfortunately, it has been ruined with very poorly designed and constructed extensions exasperated by poor maintenance ( see pictures)
The hotel is also situated on a railway line! 
The staff, particularly reception , do not appear to have any pride in the hotel. There is no information available regarding the building or the services, not even a map of the grounds which are quite extensive. There is a small art gallery which is not publicised and ,when you go to look, there is no information about any of the pictures, not even a small plaque giving title and name of painter.
Rooms
Despite being aware that my husband was disabled, we were initially allocated a room far away from restaurant and all other hotel facilities.We had paid extra for a beach accessible room. We were informed that the hotel was full.After a very tiring and traumatic experience, we finally agreed on a ground floor room which was far from ideal. There was mould in toilet and shower room and both indoor and outdoor sofas were stained. The room looked generally neglected. After 2 days ,we were moved to a junior suite in main building. The room was excellent,totally different from those in the extensions. We were closer to railway line and “hooting” trains but learnt to live with this, triple glazing would have helped with the sleeping! 
Food
We enjoyed excellent food throughout our stay. Breakfast buffet was chaotic when hotel was full of weekenders. Evening buffet had an amazing choice of food, mainly good. The a la carte restaurant was superb. There is an open kitchen ,staff are friendly and helpful with allergies. All the food we had there was delicious and good value.
title: A very mixed experience.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback, and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused. We understand how important your holiday plans were, and we deeply regret that we were unable to meet your expectations.

As mentioned, the issue was related to a sewage problem that required immediate attention, and unfortunately, the rooms were temporarily uninhabitable due to the smell. Our front office manager personally reached out to you to explain the situation and inform you of the issue. We understand how frustrating this must have been, especially so close to your travel dates.

While we did offer a refund, we recognize the disruption this caused, particularly during the peak season, and we genuinely regret that it impacted your holiday plans. We have taken your feedback seriously and are reviewing our processes to prevent such incidents from happening in the future.

Once again, we apologize for the inconvenience, and we hope you will consider giving us another chance in the future. Thank you for your understanding.

Best regards
placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa Road Meenawatte Estate, Kandy, Wattegama 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Simpson's Forest - Luxury Boutique Resort & Spa
text:
Highly Unreliable for booking!!!! Be warned about the management of this hotel-  

Booked double rooms directly with the Hotel about a month before we planned to go in December. Paid a 50% deposit as an advance payment.
 Oddly, they kept calling and asking us if we were sure we were coming, even after we paid the advance. 
 10 days prior to departure, the manager called to cancel our booking, He said it was due to a sewage problem and that the rooms were smelly. They said they will not be able to repair it in the coming week, which I found very odd and highly unlikely.

Oddly enough the hotel remained open, and when I called the reception later, was told that they were fully booked till mid-Jan. Don't know how this was possible. 

They did refund our money,  ruined the Christmas holiday for 4 families. It was near impossible to find another hotel so close to the date, being peak tourist season. 

Pretty sure it was a lie, and they gave the rooms at a higher rate to someone else, which apparently has happened before from what I've heard  

Careful where you book.
title: Terrible experience- Totally Unreliable for booking!!!

placeInfo/name: Simpson's Forest - Luxury Boutique Resort & Spa
text:
It’s very nice ecofriendly and newly build hotel. Its Staff also (Except senior front office Management & Hotel Management) very friendly & giving their utmost service within capacity of their area. 

I was there earlier 05 nights in two times with good and very unfortunate situation.

1st time I was spends 02 nights with my office staff and It is nice get-together.

2nd time I went there with my family and one of my best friend’s family for 02 days (Total 09 pax). There was mountain bicycle in front of hotel and I noted that our children play with the bicycle in checking time. Then we came for a lunch. Meantime our kids play with bicycle once again after having lunch at car park under our super vision. (The day car park was free as hotel is having only our group)  

Unfortunately, my little daughter met with an accident in front of the hotel area. There was a big slop without any boundary wall or fence.  She was fallen to 6-8 feet deep unsecured deadly water drainage with bicycle. I have to thank to Gods to save her life

Immediately we took her to a hospital with unconsciousness situation. Fortunately, my wife is a nursing officer and she was given big effort to regain consciousness situation as that area very rural and we spent more than 2 hours to transfer to Peradeniya hospital.

I would like to give my thanks to all doctors, nursing staff, ambulance driver and other staff at hospital, because all of them give full effect to recover her life. They have done over o1 hour surgery & admit during 03 days. Now she is fine with scars around the face.   

I mentioned the above story, as hotel management don’t take any responsibility for this incident. They were ignored us every time when we try to meet them to discuss the issue, stating that they are busy with meetings. We had to stay even the discharging day of our child at the same hotel. However, they were fully charged for 03 days and gave only Rs. 3000.00 discount even though we paid per night Rs. 50,000/-.

I want to inform you that When you decide to select this hotel, you should go there alone without child and you have to take your own risk. They never consider guest safety in the hotel premises. You must give full attention to following.

1.	When you take the bicycle they never give any advice or notice. 
Due to this incident, I requested them to remove the bicycle for kids in front of hotel and issue them with advice regarding the sloppy area and advise parent also. Unfortunately, I saw the repaired Bikes in the same place when we leave the premises. 

2.	There is very dangerous end of the pool, there are over 30 feet hell and especially baby pool area also deadly hell. No any boundary wall, fence or safety tactics. 

3.	There are Durian trees (Scientific name: Durio) side on the road. Near pool area and bungalow. when ripe fruits falling, it caused to very serious injury If it fallen to someone head. Not any Cover or safety precautions’. 

This incident was happened on 19-08-2018, Until today (10-10-2018) hotel management or any representative never apologies or ask the situation of my suffering kid.   

I never willing to go there in my life time and not to recommend anybody, as the hotel don’t have any experience how to manage errors or mistake directly affected Human Life, and do the best Management to collect the Money by over promising.
title: Ignorance of guest care.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Andrew, We are quite shocked by the vociferousness of your review. We have had a 4.8/ 5 review ratings out of 623 reviews on TripAdvisor,  9.4/10 in bookings.com 4.4/5 on google and 9.8 on Hotel.com...... We are perplexed at your anger because what is omitted in your review is you booked an entry level room for your honeymoon and we feeling empathic of your situation offered you a complimentary Suite upgrade as it was your honeymoon. The confusion is that you were also comparing a much more secluded boutique luxury experience to what the Anantara and Mariott Weligama offers which is around 200 rooms with buffets and a much different & active experience. our offering is clear on the website for what it is which is why guests choose this more intimate setting over the other two hotels you mentioned which are different experiences. We purposefully do not have buffets but an a la carte menu. We are secluded and not part of a larger town scene.  you also omitted to say I met you as I was at the Villa the night you came to get your luggage . and spoke with you in detail but clearly you had made your mind up. regardless of our efforts to help and also point out we are not a large mass hotel nor do we purport to be. I also have no disparaging comments to make of these hotels nor should I. Your review is your point of view which you have a right to but I feel has a lot of unproductive commentary. The third party you booked through never agreed to a refund if that was the case you would have received it.... Complaining about leaves falling I guess is expected where your surrounds are not all concrete but also in further evidence our place or similar with trees outside were not of your liking.. We tried to do our best immediately to upgrade you for free to a suite . It seems nothing we would have done would have matched your need to go to a much larger hotel under any circumstance. We do  not want to nor do we compete with this. Clearly your review of 1/5 is yours but 100's of others disagree. Should you have accepted the suite we offered you free of charge perhaps you may have enjoyed a different discerning experience. You chose not to, which was, your choice.. We wish you and your wife all the best going forward and encourage you to book in those larger type properties which you prefer up front from the beginning. Their style of Hotel is great and all places have a choice of offerings for guests. 
Best regards
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
HOTEL IS A SCAM! IT IS A GUESTHOUSE NOT 5* HOTEL. IT HAS NO STAR RATING!
HOMEYMOON RUINED!!!!
We booked online from the UK for our honeymoon as all booking websites stated this was a 5* hotel. We picked it due to this and it was the most expensive hotel in the area (even more than the Marriott Weligama/ we had just arrived from Anatara resort) and our longest stay. On arrival we were so underwhelmed. The property grounds were not tidy with leaves everywhere, the bathroom was run down with no amenities like a vanity or dental kit, the towels were not hotel and poor quality.
The bar staff hassled us to buy drinks as we walked around. No 5* service. Breakfast was poor.
We raised our concerns with the manager in the first instance and enquired about checking out early as we were on our honeymoon and had paid a lot for 5* and this was clearly not the case. The manager agreed to upgrade the room but we decided to sleep on it and decide in the morning.
I then woke up with dead mosquitos on my pillow (first time in all of our Sri lanka 3 week stay) despite the mosquito net. Breakfast was poor quality with no fresh fruit and options of cappuccino at an extra charge! This is not 5*..
They had no complimentary activities like yoga, you also cannot surf on the beach!
We immediately expressed checking out early due to disappointment and getting a refund for the remaining nights. The manager Kenny then stated we booked through a third party so we needed to contact them to check but had we booked directly with the hotel he would have refunded us. So we proceeded to do this.
The third party agreed for a refund based on this ( we have it in writing) and said that they had made contact with the hotel and that they had agreed for a refund for us.
We then proceeded to book an alternative hotel (as we had confirmation we booked the Marriot).
We proceeded to get our bags and tell Kenny this, however he disputed the refund saying he had not stated this to us or third party and that he will not refund us. He called the higher manager who suggested our experience was due to booking an inferior room and 5* is subjective so we would not be refunded.
It was sad and upsetting and has ruined our honeymoon. Upon checking into the Marriot, they advised us the property had no star rating we then emailed the official Sri Lankan tourism board who said the same (photos attached).
Please note my other reviews I rarely leave bad reviews!
title: HOTEL IS A SCAM! IT IS A GUESTHOUSE NOT 5* HOTEL. IT HAS NO STAR RATING! HOMEYMOON RUINED

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Buddhika,
We are very sorry with your experience and a bit puzzled that you feel our pictures are deceiving. We have full beach views and do serve meals at our beach hut. We have put up a cinnamon fence beachside which we didn't have before but this is due to restrictions with Covid, and duty of care of our guests which is our #1 priority.  However, this hasn't altered our location which is beachside. Unfortunately Tripadvisor doesn't seem to have the ability to add photos that I can add to this reply but I have taken the liberty to post some photos on Instagram and Facebook taken at 5pm today through to sunset to see the views and also including the cinnamon fence and seating beachside for meals. 
 We can get the beach at different levels during different seasons due to weather patterns which is beyond our control. It is possible you experienced this a few days back of which I am sorry to hear. We do appreciate your candid feedback and we are adding a ladder for those days that there might be a drop in the beach. 
In regards to the the charge for Sausages and Bacon these are automatically included in the BB rate in the Western breakfast option with Eggs, Juice and fruit. However if there is an extra order above and beyond we do charge as we pride ourselves on made to order A la Carte menu options and no Buffets.
We are sorry that you too did not feel treated as a VIP as we would like to treat all our guests as VIP's. We appreciate your feedback and are sorry you feel there was any form of misrepresentation.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t waste your money staying at this hotel! very disappointing and no value for money!
text:
Absolutely no value for money. The pictures they have used are very deceiving. There’s no access to the beach from the hotel and there are meals on the beach as shown in the pics. Whiles the junior staff is very helpful and provide a great service the management is completely the opposite. 
If you are looking for a place with a beautiful beach front this is not the place.  Although the rooms are nice, the money you pay here is wasted. There are so many other places you can get for half the price. Here you will be charged for even sausages or bacon at breakfast even if you go on BB basis. I would not visit this place ever again and will not recommend it for anyone either. Just an expensive place with false advertising. 
Don’t be fooled by the pics of the beach. There is nothing like that. 
Also if you are unlucky enough (as we were) to be there at a time a so called VIP is residing, the manager will treat you as if you are staying there without paying and will even ask you not to swim on to one side of the pool just so that you don’t disturb the “VIP”.  
Overall a very disappointing place and DO NOT BE DECEIVED by the pics. You will be shocked if you expect what’s on the pictures
title: Disappointing place with false advertising. Waste of money!!

placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a review I’d hoped not to write.  I stayed at this property in 2017 and liked it and promised to return.  I booked for a total of 9 nights for July 2018 and paid about 3 weeks before my intended stay, but unfortunately had to cancel about 10 days before arriving because of unexpected hospitalisation and 2 subsequent operations.

I sent Marcy my hospitalisation certificate and she told me to cancel the bookings on booking.com and said that she would look into a refund in the circumstances.  I followed up my email a few times and received this response:

“Oh my goodness.  My sincere apologies for the breakdown in communication.   I will review all of this once I am at the office and respond to you
>
> Best regards
> Marcy”

That review never happened.  I called one day and Marcy said she was only thinking of me that morning and would look into it and come back to me.  I didn’t hear anything and so I called and Marcy told me that the internet had been down for 3 days and she was still catching up.  I believed her.

As no response was received, I called again and spoke to Marcy - she told me a full refund for the 9 nights was being “processed” and that I’d receive an email.  I believed her - again.  A week passed and no email or refund had been received, so I called Marcy again - this time her story was there had been a 2 day holiday and banks had been closed, so all payments had been delayed and again it was a full refund.  Marcy told me to call her again if the refund wasn’t received.

Well, as you’ve probably guessed the refund wasn’t received and Marcy never accepted any call from me nor did she even have the courtesy too return my email or voicemail requests. 

This is so disappointing - not only not receiving any refund at all (when I checked and saw the rooms had been rebooked), but the continual lies and lack of respect to a returning customer - the spin of lies over 2 months speaks volumes.  I would prefer to stay with, and give my patronage, to people who are honest and treat me with respect. On a side note our ‘non refundable’ air tickets and accommodation at another property were refunded without any issue.

Sadly, Sri Shavari, fell down very badly here, despite me giving them every opportunity to explain, but instead a succession of lies.  The lack of honesty and integrity is so disappointing.
title: Dishonest and disrespectful

ownerResponse/text: Althaf N, you have not visited our property.  You have not had a meal here.  You have not booked a room here.  You have not seen a room here.  You have not had a spa treatment here.  What you have had is an unfortunate car accident with our villa driver, which we have left to our respective insurance companies to manage, much to your chagrin and anger.  Your dealings with our manager and owner have been entirely about the car accident and our refusal to deal with you directly rather than through our insurance companies.  You, sir, have committed a tripadvisor fraud by making up a terrible story about a property that you have never been to.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text: The food is soooo gross. Room is uncleaned. You can see cockroaches in the room. Unprofessional staff. The manager Sisira doesnt even know how to speak to customers. I would never visit again. I wouldnt give a single star. I think the owner of the hotel charlyn doesnt manage the property properly. It is a beautiful villa with rerrible management. I would not visit place this again.
title: Terrible customer service

ownerResponse/text:
It was with dismay that I read your review, which followed the review of Chloe whom was also a part of your group of 4.   I have already responded to Chloe’s review and my  response to yours  is as follows.
Your group booked 2 Terrace Rooms via two separate online booking agents.  The description of the Terrace Rooms on the online site you booked provided the below description:
Room size: 20 m²
Bed: 1 large double bed
Located on the second floor in the Spa building, this room has a maximum occupancy of 2 persons including infants and children. The guests can choose to dine at the room's private balcony or on the front lawn's beach side deck.
Room facilities: Balcony,Patio, Garden view, Terrace,Satellite Channels, Flat-screen TV, Safety Deposit Box, Air Conditioning, Iron, Seating Area, Fan, Mosquito net, Wardrobe/Closet, Clothes rack, Shower, Hairdryer, Free toiletries, Toilet, Bathroom, Dining area, Dining table, Outdoor furniture, Outdoor dining area, Wake-up service, Alarm clock, Towels, Linen, Upper floors accessible by stairs only
Free WiFi is available in all rooms.

Upon check in I did take you aside as I noticed that your group of 4 had oversized luggage plus hand luggage.  I showed you the rooms that you had booked.  You indicated that you thought that you had booked the Villa rooms based on the photograph of the Villa on the website.  I advised  that you had booked the 2 Terrace Rooms which are the entry level rooms.  They are clearly identified as such on the online booking website – they are our smallest  rooms; are located in our Spa building and are available at the lowest rate.  The photos of theTerrace Rooms on the online booking websites do not in any way misrepresent the room, its size or its location, which I indicated to you when I said there are not any photos of the Terrace Rooms that are similar to the Villa Suite photos.  When booking online there are 4 Rooms/Suites to choose from and you chose the entry level Terrace Rooms rather than one of the 3 other Suite rooms available in the Villa.  All 4 Rooms/Suites are clearly identified with their own photos and descriptors on all online booking websites.

Wishing to make your stay here as pleasant and comfortable as possible I did offer you and your husband an upgrade.  I even offered it on a complimentary basis.  I did this of my own initiative.  I showed you the Ocean Suite room and you accepted the upgrade.  Unfortunately I did not have another higher category room to upgrade your son and his partner to on a complimentary basis, despite your strong suggestion that I should do so.  The price difference between the Terrace Room and the Ocean Suite is USD 190 per night, but I did not request any extra payment from you.  You pressed the issue about upgrading your son to a Beach Suite.  I advised that we did not have another Villa Suite continuously available for the length of your stay for your son and further that I was not in a position to offer a 2nd complimentary upgrade.  At no point did you advise me that your son was recovering from surgery and it was certainly not apparent to me, as he wore no shoulder sling.  I did say that your son and his partner would be fine in the room that they booked and paid for.  The Terrace Room is a very popular room and enjoys regular and frequent occupancy from a variety of other guests, without complaint.

Regarding your criticisms of the complimentary upgraded Suite, the living space in the villa is a common shared space, which is also clearly identified and set out in the online booking engine’s website.  I explained that to you before you accepted the complimentary upgrade.  Similarly, it is also explained online that meals are served in the villa’s dining space, on the villa’s terrace, in room, or on the main pool deck.  We have a full kitchen with Chef and Sous Chef.  We have complimentary wifi throughout the property and I apologize that the wifi password  was not  available in your upgraded Suite.  Once you brought it to my attention you were immediately given the password.  The password was available in your son’s room as I reviewed it with him and his partner.  

Your family chose to go out for dinner and when you returned you advised me that this place was not for you and that you would be checking out in the morning.  

Your complaint about the beach perplexes me as our property is located right on the beach and it is completely accessible.  Similarly I am confused by  the complaint about your husband’s breathing machine.  Your Suite has many power plugs, including two power plugs on either side of the bed, as there are bedside lamps.  There was no need for your husband to sleep on the Suite’s couch.  There is a fridge located in each villa’s pantry. 

While the power did go off twice during the night, we have a generator that kicked in right away ensuring that electricity flowed all night, including lighting, air conditioning and overhead fans.  Unfortunately the hot water switch to your son’s room had been accidentally turned off, but once we were notified of the situation it was  rectified.  A dog did playfully try to catch your son’s partner’s dress and I immediately removed the dog from the property and apologized. 

We have been in operation for almost 2 years and the overwhelming experience of our other guests has been a very positive one, with high marks given for our service, our amenities, our staff and our meals.  Guests genuinely enjoy the fact that we are located outside of Mirissa, so they can enjoy the peace and quiet our beach offers, but also in less than 10 minutes be amongst the hustle and bustle of Mirissa Beach.  We have many guests whom have enjoyed long stays here.  

I do agree with you that it is always advisable to know which room you are choosing before you book, as complimentary upgrades are not always available when you realize that you have mistakenly booked a room you did not intend to.  Taking the time to read the online description of the room and to view that particular room’s photos is a good way to educate yourself on the room you are booking .

The matter was resolved as per your request to have the remainder of your 5 night booking cancelled without  a cancellation penalty to yourself or to your son and his partner.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked this place based on the images and the ratings and one of the most expensive places in Mirissa, how could we possibly go wrong! 

We interpreted to be a spacious villa, beautiful decorated with an amazing pool located in Mirissa right on the beach.
What a way to spend 5 nights /6 beautiful days with our family and help our son heal after a traumatic injury at work in which has caused some trauma and distress.

We get there after a 5 hour car ride and all exhausted, thirsty, tired and hungry!
We are greeted, our driver had to find a local accommodation which we had been informed by an email, I was shown to the rooms just after we were told we had too much luggage (2 large and 2 small suitcases) just came from Italy! I was offered a larger room option one with sea view which was not really recommended as sea is quite rough and strong wave sounds and no privacy, so we picked the other one which was recommended by Marcy (Canadian Manager) and she also said that my son should be ok with the terrace room. 
He got a room with no phone and two mattress joined together. My son had just had a shoulder surgery!!! 

We could have had him upgraded at an additional $190US per night! The vibes were not right so we chose not to go with that option plus we had already paid almost AUD$300 per night for 5nights x 2.

I did mention to Marcy that was not what I had visioned, I did expect the Terrace Rooms to be what they were, her reply was "we don't even have images of the Terrace Room"!

The living spaces images shown are of common living areas unless you book the whole villa which is over $1100 per night I think! 

There was no restaurant and asked for a menu for room service about 3 people came to the door, all I could recall that stood out on the menu was Fish and chips or something similar, while we are still trying to settle, mind you my son's room had no Phone so you need to go downstairs for room service, we had no telly in our room and could not get access to WiFi at that point.

It was quite late so we called our driver and we had dinner somewhere local.  When we got back all we could think of was, how the hell are we going to cope for the rest of our stay? No fridge in our room, my husband could not plug his breathing machine (for sleep apnoea) so he slept on the couch! The power went off 8 times, and my son's partner was stuck under a cold shower in the dark!  Again no one to call and no instruction as what to do in the event that happened, as this is very common at these premises according other staff members, Not to mention one of the dogs tried to nip my son's partner.

Breakfast was included but we refused to even have a coffee and left as soon as we could get our driver to pick us up and takes us to Hikkaduwa, booking which we had made near midnight the night before in the presence of the Operation Manager who was very sympathetic and understanding of our circumstances. 

When we got to Hikkaduwa we received great hospitality, 2 TVs in each room plus a phone in 3 locations, I almost cried (we only needed one of each while on holiday) and the standard essentials.

Make sure you know what room you are booking and it is not a 5star place.  To my understanding for a place to be 5star it needs to have a restaurant, TV, Phone, idiot proof instructions, tea and coffee facilities, fridge etc in which this place not have in every room. 

These Villas / rooms are approximately 12mths old so the furniture is fairly new and pool looked nice. Not that we got to use it! 
This place suits a person that likes to be isolated, happy to just sit by the pool, no need for a TV or phone, and expect for the power to go off several times a day. You will know what I mean once you are there!
title: It looked too good to be true!  But was a disappointment!

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your constructive feedback.  At Sri Sharavi we aim to provide each guest with an impeccably relaxing experience and we are most disappointed that our efforts were not satisfactory for you.  Our villas are individually staffed with a house butler who is on duty to care for our guests, while at the same time provide them with privacy.  We will certainly discuss with our staff how to better balance their level of service.  We are happy that you enjoyed the layout of the villas and we certainly hope that you took advantage of having exclusive use of the villa living/dining space and private terrace, while you dined. The pantry you mention in your review is there for the house butler to service the guests and also for the guests' convenience should they wish to keep snacks and not meant for cooking.  Our menu is focused  on Sri Lankan dishes, seafood and fish, along with western food choices.  Our Chef does his best to accommodate guests' requests, but unfortunately some Indian menu requests are not available.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
Going by the high ratings, we had opted for this place. Undoubtably the location right touching the sea, a large long swimming pool make this seem like a beautiful place for a holiday but the facilities are poor.firstly we were misled by term  garden facing room. This was nothing but two plants on side of room and with a tall wall behind. Then there was no phone in room so one has to go search for their meagre staff for anything you need. The free wi fo was another disappointment as it almost never seemed available. The place had a pantry where food could be cooked if desired but who would do that on a holiday? The absence of a restaurant but a cook in house with very limited food options and that too at very high price, made us search for food options outside.
This place is liked by those foreigners who just wish to relax.
title: Nice layout, sea view but unsatisfactory facilities
